My friend and I came here and ordered the Mediterranean skewers with sundried tomato, mozzarella, artichoke, and two types of olives. We also tried the caprese skewers which were on special. The spinach artichoke dip came out piping hot and we requested tortilla chips instead of the flatbread. The dip was savory and cheesy and ooey gooey. Just a warning, there is some spice in there so be prepared for heat! We continuously noshed on the wasabi peas that are served upon arrival. It was my first time having them and they were addicting! Now let's talk about the cocktails...I had been dreaming about he watermelon martini since last summer when I tried it for the first time. I had two this time and they are de-lish!!! Fresh watermelon in a cocktail should happen all the time. It's served with a sour watermelon candy on the rim, too, which is fun! The  specialty cocktail of the night was called the Woo Woo and included peach schnapps. I stuck with the watermelon martini even though the Woo Woo was fun to say! My friend and I are already talking about when we can be back for happy hour again!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Love this cozy little bar! It feels like Europe... Which means the tables are tiny (but big enough to hold your wine and cheese so minor issue!)

The service is always great and attentive without being over bearing. 

The wine list is amazing and they have great deals for happy hour as well as 1/2 priced bottles on Mondays. 

You can design your own cheese plate and it's seriously phenomenal. The server explains each piece and suggests which combos work best. 

I recently had the wine poached pear and arugula salad & it was amazing.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
I went to the North Point last weekend with high expectations and they were definitely met! We went for lunch, but I will indubitably be back for dinner. The atmosphere is very inviting, with busy outdoor seating and jazz standards on the stereo luring you inside. We sat inside and sipped on some draft beers while we browsed the hefty menu. They also have half price wine bottles on Monday nights!

My two lunch companions ordered flat bread paninis, but I took the riskier path and ordered one of their meat and cheese boards. I was not disappointed. I ordered the prosciutto, Genoa salami, and brie which came with half a soft boiled egg, pickled ginger, fig compote, two different types of mustard, and toasted baguette. The decomposition of the dish was actually appealing and the flavor combinations were unbeatable. Making it more like a savory and sweet meal all in one, I mixed the meats with the baguette and the brie with the fig compote. This was one of the best lunches I can remember. 

I also tried a bite of the the Caramelized Portabella Mushroom Panini with Truffle Oil, Feta, Mozzarella, Roasted Shallots & Sundried Maine Blueberries. The sundried blueberries were a turn off for me on the menu, but flavor wise they were very subtle and it was a smart dish. 

I would recommend the North Point to anyone and it was a great experience. Make sure you don't have anywhere to be though because they are very busy and most likely under staffed. Enjoy some drinks while you wait for your meal.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Meh. Decent appetizer. Decent happy hour but better beer / wines not included (no real issue with that). 

The fact they charge $4 for each watered down soft drink and don't inform you as much as they are happily refilling your kid's glass (you find out when the bill comes and you spent more for the coke than you did for the food) is a joke. Apparently it is stated on the main menu, but you would have no idea if you order from the drink/apps menu as we did. Disingenuous at best. Go elsewhere.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Stayed in downtown Portland for one night. Lucky us The North Point was across the street from our hotel. The place was cozy and they offer indoor (tables and bar) and outdoor seating. The pictures in the bathroom? Absolutely hilarious, and they add so much charm to the place. We had the caprese salad, fresh and delicious. We chose tacos for dinner, chicken chipotle and pork with pineapple. The chipotle had just enough zing to make my lips tingle, but not burn :) I would recommend this place, it is small but somehow there was plenty of room for everyone that came in.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Cute little spot on a pretty quiet side street. We had yummy draft beers and tacos. My husband had the Cubano and said it was better than ones he's had in Miami so I guess North Point does it right.

Wish we had had more room on our bellies for a cheeseboard or dessert. The Nachos also smelled great.

Service was very nice and relaxed. Casual fun atmosphere.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Holy crap. This place is awesome. The atmosphere is fantastic. My wife and I had the Brie wheel (so good), a couple of specialty cocktails (wow) and split the turkey Gouda sandwich (might be the best sandwich I have ever had). We are from out of town and the bartender even was giving us future breakfast and lunch plans. Will definitely return when we are in Portland!!!!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
The cheese and meat boards at North point   are nothing short of a Normandy victory, and that is just the beginning of a great experience. Great happy hour. Great food and I'd know a ww2 reporter. 

Hemingway and I would split the charcuterie board at hotel ritz Paris, drink our way through the "A" list of wine bottles, and talk about black marlin, trade winds and Castro. 

It was a great time to be a war correspondent living in Paris. The year the war ended Hemingway and I were 39 and 0 in bar fights.

Atmosphere Versillian. Resist the urge to flash a ring on bended knee mates. 

Sleep tight

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Walked over from our hotel. Snagged  two seats at the bar. Ordered a martini and a rye smash.. drinks were great, bartender was very nice. Ordered chipotle chicken tacos and capris salad.. waited 25 minutes for food... tacos were very disappointing.  Capri salad had  unripened  tomatoes
In late August with fresh produce markets everywhere they should've been able to get ripe tomatoes. The chicken tacos were just cubed chicken and a pile of iceberg lettuce go for the drinks not for the food. When the bartender came back around to check on us my husband told her that The tomatos were unripened and she was kind enough to go back and bring to ripened tomatoes out so kudos to the bartender

name: the-north-point
review_text:
So much about this tucked-away little place in Portland's Old Port keeps drawing me back, despite its cramped space and seemingly hidden spot.

A little of everything awaits you here. This isn't a burgers & fries kind of joint, but any palate, from the most provincial to the world-traveled will find something here to enjoy and quell any hunger pangs. The food is simple but impressive: grilled and stuffed flatbread sandwiches contain everything from grilled kielbasa and vegetables to the turkey with mashed and dried cranberries. The Cajun pulled pork is also a favorite of mine; even with my Louisiana blood, it hits home.

There's the mound of North Point nachos, loaded with all the fixins which might be expected. What isn't so expected perhaps is the large menu of cheese & meat plates which could be perfect for a hearty lunch of a light dinner over drinks. The roasted Calabrian figs keep catching my eye though I've yet to try them on any of my visits. Nor have I ventured into the sweet crepe offerings, yet. There'll be time for that no doubt as this little place feels like a mainstay. 

The speciality cocktail menu features everything from a white rum raspberry mojito to a smoked caramel vanilla bourbon. The price points are a bit steep, particularly if you're looking to pair a simple, inexpensive lunch with a drink. They range from $10-$12 so by far, not the most expensive in the area, but getting there. Lunch for two on a Sunday afternoon was two of the grilled stuffed flatbreads and two sodas at $30, plus tip. Again, not the absolute best price in my opinion, but such things are objective.

Yes, cramped and reservations and a wait list are not kept here, but still very much worth the try, and likely a revisit.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Holy moley! What a find! Funky clean arty retro 70s meets Victorian parlor pub in an amber lit setting. World class Maine Beer Company "Lunch" craft beer was a balanced hoppy bitter IPA with a creamy cheesy aroma. Free fried Wasabi peas to start. Staff easy to joke with in this comfortably cushioned upscale hippy setting. We ordered the meat and cheese plate. Cranberry orange coated spiced chevre, wild boar salami, smoked duck breast and Molisana pork with garlic corn a pepper. Highlights: mustard had a cocktail quality flavor to it, spicy pickled veggies were not over brined, charcoal toasted flatbread was paper thin crisp yet soft inside, and  plates were exactly what was described on the menu and keenly balanced despite our doing the choosing. Old world prepared sausages live up to high expecations.

name: the-north-point
review_text: It was a rainy day and we were searching for a place to have a cocktail.  We ran into North Point to avoid a sudden downpour and decided we couldnt wait the rain out without buying something.  What a great find.  Awesome drinks, great food and charcuterie plates.  More upscale than it appeared from the outside and fantastic staff without any attitude or snobbery.  We make sure to visit at least once or more every visit now when we hit Portland.  Met one of the owners last visit and he was very cool.  Been here 4-5 times now.  Highly recomended!  Last visit summer 2015!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Amazing! My husband and I stopped in because we loved the music they had piped outside. This small, eclectic place was awesome. I got a Bloody Mary and he got a bourbon cocktail, both of which were delish. Complimentary wasabi peas were a good snack. We got the meat & cheese board and our server was super helpful & knowledgeable. Excellent food and we just loved it!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Great find in Portland. Hard to find and you might be turned off by the outside appearance BUT, BE BRAVE. Go forth into this place and you will have a great experience - in service, food and ambience!! Absolutely worth the visit. 
Our server, Shelby, was great from the moment we arrived until we left.  She even laughed at my bad jokes (wait - they aren't bad - they are outstanding!!!)
We both ordered stuffed wraps and they were both unique and very tasty. 
Even the background music was good - oldies and just loud enough to hear cleat but quiet enough to not allow conversation - just right. This place gave us an experience we will remember for some time (maybe even longer than 2 weeks ).

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Decided to check it out for drinks. Very cozy, funky bohemian atmosphere w/ bluesy classics playing. Already a fan.

The Margarita - refreshing and not as sweet as I'm used to having - more on the  bitter side. Worth trying. 

Jala Berry cocktail - spiiiicyyy and strawberyyyy, mmmm...

Grilled cheese - well, it is decadently cheesy though I couldn't really tell there were 4 different types of cheeses, just seemed like one. I felt my cholesterol rising after the 2 bite.

Chocolate martini - ohhh so chocolatey!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Delicious and fresh craft cocktails in a fun environment. Yummy small bites and flat breads. We loved the charcuterie selections. Be sure to check out the photos with captions in the bathroom.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
My North Point experience was a very unfortunate one. For starters, I came for a late lunch and most (all?) of the reviews are about brunch or cocktails. Perhaps I should come back at one of those times.

It was a beautiful day, so we sat outside. We had to ask for the regular things that start a meal like water, place settings and napkins (I erroneously assumed the latter two would come with our food...). 

My cocktail was really good. I got the ginger Germaine which is St. Germaine, bitters, a sugar cube, ginger, and prosecco for $11. They give you a little bottle of prosecco to top it off. Highly recommend this drink. Unfortunately my friend's drink selection wasn't as good. She got the sangria slushie which is rose wine, puréed fruit, rum, and fresh fruit was unfinishable. I've never come across a sangria I didn't like. Avoid this drink. 

Flatbreads! They have a good selection. I had the BBQ pork with coleslaw and mozzarella. It got better and better with each bite (I believe the more I bit into it the better the mozzarella ratio became). Unfortunately I found a large, round, rock-like piece of bone in my flatbread that could have really hurt my teeth. The manager was walking by at the time and remedied the situation with a crepe (which I took to go in hopes of enjoying it for breakfast tomorrow). 

One final disappointment: the crepe menu. It's great that you can pick any two fillings for a sweet crepe, but it's saddening that none of the options are fresh fruit. It's hard to imagine a crepe without bananas or strawberries. We asked to see if they had bananas in the kitchen but not on the menu and they didn't. 

I plan to come back at one of the peak times all the other good reviews wrote about and hopefully I can update this review.

name: the-north-point
review_text: We popped in for their Tuesday Mojito Happy Hour.  We had a blueberry and a regular/standard mojito.  They were $6.00 each.  They were tasty, not too strong and not too weak.  Caitlyn, our bartender, was SUPER friendly and had the best smile.  It's always nice to feel like you're welcome in an establishment and they appreciate your patronage.  They also played the best music for the time we were there...Squirrel Nut Zippers!  Check it out!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Martini drinks are to die for. Bring my friends and they all agree.  Haven't tried much food here, only the nachos minus the meat and they were ok. Perhaps the meat makes the dish.  Other people seem to enjoy their small dishes but overall the drinks alone are worth the trip.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Sometimes I can be incredibly difficult to please. I know this. Chances are you know this, too. And it's not because I have unrealistic expectations when I go out; I think it's because I am a girl who is happiest sitting in her underwear in her garden surrounded by her gnomes drinking wine right outta the bottle. If I have to put pants on... If I have to spend money.... If I have to be social... It (the WHOLE package, that is) has to be worth it. Many friends - many of the wonderful people right here from our Yelp community - have suggested The North Point to me. "It's really European, Steff, I think you'd love it," was what one person said, knowing that I had lived abroad multiple times. "It's got the same kind of soul you have," said another - I still don't know what this means. And finally, "They've got a quirky sense of humor like you." THIS, I knew about. I've been a HUGE fan of theirs via social media for some time. Have you seen some of the stuff they post? Let me give you an example of their profound, philosophical chalkboard sentiments:
1. "I'm on an all fruit diet... well actually just grapes... fermented grapes... actually I'm just drinking wine... it's a wine diet."
2. "When things don't go as planned, it's because your plan probably sucked."
3. "'Come on... what's the big deal? It's okay... you only broke up with her a few weeks ago. Don't worry so much... it's totally cool... she won't mind... it's only 3am... pick up the phone and ask her if you can come over' - 5 Mojito's"

Today - FINALLY - I gave in and checked it out. I loved the abruptness in which their storefront sits on the cobblestone street. I loved that I was greeted by two separate servers (hostesses?) who asked me how I was doing and paused for an answer like they genuinely cared. I loved that the moment I sat down at the bar, a "regular" sitting nearby (an older gentleman, totally sober FYI) engaged in a conversation with me like we were old friends. We talked about how much sexier cats were when they have double paws, how important it is to "disconnect to reconnect" and the evils of the internet (segue...), and how he'd like to start a website for sex that wasn't considered porn. He also - very politely - interrupted my conversation on his way out to let me know that he thought I was "simply fantastic and had great values." A girl can ride a life-high on a statement like that for many weeks. Please note: he is my new favorite Random in town.

I wanted so badly to try the Smoked Caramel Vanilla Bourbon cocktail, but I was seduced by $3 Allagash's during Happy Hour. My friend had the Cucumber Gin Martini sans simple syrup and I thought it was lovely tasting... "like what a garden or farmers' market would taste like if it became a drink" is actually what I said. Lovely manager Kelly said the Maine Wild Blueberry cocktail was very refreshing and appropriate for the state in which we live; she also promised that the sangria was mighty fine as it came adorned with basically a fruit salad. I will be back for both.

The decor? The lighting? The space itself? Yes, all very "across the pond" in feel and character (read: charming, cozy, intimate but fun). The staff? According to their website they claim to be "the friendliest staff you'll ever encounter." I can't disagree with this - the two guys rockin' the bar (and who we mostly interacted with) were on point, humorous when called for, and very friendly.

The only thing I didn't love here was the food... but sometimes a girl just needs a good watering hole, ayuh? We tried four separate cheeses (1. halloumi [which can only be described as "insanely sexy"]; 2. murcia al vino [entirely unmemorable]; 3. camembert au povire [definitely interesting - and something I might seek out at a whole grocer]; 4. cambazola [the lovechild of Stilton and Brie]) and while they were tasty, the accoutrements were SEVERELY lacking and underwhelming, and the portion for the price paid was just plain stupid. If it's got enough other awesome stuff going on though (like ambience, amazing staff, stuff drinks, a great happy hour, etc.), sometimes a place doesn't have to win both your food and drink heart over. The North Point has successfully burrowed into my soul (I wonder if they'd let me bring my gnomes in with me next time) and I can see myself coming back here for drinks and hopefully becoming a regular!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Too many choices in downtown Portland! We were in the mood for something light and quick. Yelp steered us right. We took up seats at the bar. We had the chicken skewers with blueberry sauce and also a Thai chili sauce. Then we got an order of loaded nachos. Good stuff! The bartender was courteous, checking on us often even while she was very busy. The second bartender brought us our food order, she was also great! Good food, great service and great location! Stop by and tell 'em the Merrdog sent you- you'll be glad you did!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
I've been on a quest, since moving back to the area, to try a new place for lunch every day. I'm so glad I started to do this because I've found some real gems like The North Point!

It's a small place on a side street in the Old Port and if you didn't have these reviews or someone who had been there before to recommend it to you you'd probably never stumble upon it. That could be a good thing for fellow Yelpers because if it were on a more public street with more foot traffic this place would probably be so popular that you would be waiting forever for a table. So the secret is safe for now but you should take advantage before the word gets out to the general public!

The colors, artwork, layout, music and overall feel of this place is hard to describe unless you've been there. It is classy, comfortable and interesting. I give it 5 stars for atmosphere.

Then there were the staff. They were extremely friendly, casual and genuinely interested in making the experience a good one. For that I would also give 5 stars. I hope that the owners know how good their people are and treat them with respect because they are such a great asset and tie the whole experience together.

The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars on the overall rating is the food. Don't get me wrong, the food was really good and you can tell they put a lot of thought into it and invested in quality ingredients and a great chef. The problem I had is that I think it is overpriced compared to some of the other great places around. Shaving a couple bucks off of the menu items would probably draw an even bigger crowd and they'd feel like they were getting their moneys worth. Also, I probably say this of a lot of places I visit, a few more craft beer selections would be a plus. :)

I will definitely make this a weekly or bi-weekly lunch spot and if they rethink the prices I will up this place to 5 stars overall.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
The North Point has been eluding me for a while now.  Many peeps have recommended it over the last couple of years.  I stopped there first on an epic night out, but just for drinks.  The food looked good, but I had to hold off.  The drinks were amazing though.  

The service was also excellent.  Outside seeting was plentiful and perfect for the nice weather.  I had a fantastic Gin Ricky, which I'd recommend.  Maybe a tad too sweet, but super enjoyable.  The wine and beer selections were excellent, and my friends were impressed. 

I recommend The North Point if you're looking for a place to get a great drink and maybe even an app (They did look wicked good.)

name: the-north-point
review_text: Any place with outdoor seats, delicious non pretentious appetizers and delicious drinks is a yes in my book.  Stopped by for a quick bite so I cannot say if the entrees are divine but what I experienced was nice.  The owner came out and introduced himself and chatted with us for a bit, which is always lovely.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Ok, so picture this: it's midsummer, sweaty, humid, beautiful - and I'm craving a delicious drink to cool me down. We had been walking around the Old Port for a few hours shopping for ridiculous gift ideas, and I was as thirsty as I'd ever been on my life. We ditched down a side road to escape the sun, and I spotted a new place with funky music blasting to the street. There were tables out on the cobbles that just pulled us in. A friendly waitress drops down some little green wasabi peas and took our order. I asked for the best, most refreshing cocktail they had. A minute later I gulped down one of my new favorite drinks - a Mango Peach-atini. Now hold on, I know it sounds a bit fru fru, but believe me when I say it was the absolute most perfect thing in that moment. 

A year later, with many other cocktails consumed, the North Point has become one of my favorite spots for delicious drinks and delectable eats. Also, best nachos in town (hey, I love my pub grub).

name: the-north-point
review_text:
I've only been here for drinks, so I can't speak to the food.  The menu looks good though, and if the quality and presentation of their cocktails is any indication, the food must be top notch.  Funky atmosphere with nice patrons (in my experience).  

On a side note, I dropped a not-small sum of money without realizing it.  Not only did the person who found it turn it into the staff, but the bartender returned it to me when I casually mentioned I lost some cash.  People/places like that are rare.  Thumbs up from me.

name: the-north-point
review_text: If you love charcuterie, do not miss this hidden gem! North Point is the best place in  Portland for charcuterie, cheeses, and a ginormous bowl of castelvetrano olives. Also a decent cocktail menu. Check it out!

name: the-north-point
review_text: We came for pre-dinner drinks and we were very impressed by the service here. Great ambience,  cozy comfy couches and seats with pillows. The staff are friendly and very personable, making you feel right at home. We ordered pear martinis and the drink comes with a slice of pear on the rim.  Just simply delicious.

name: the-north-point
review_text: The place is quaint and funky.... the charcuterie selections are vast!! Great options...Black truffle salami, for example?!! Ghost pepper salami!?! Friendly staff. You must check out the creative use of old photos in the bathroom.... ;)

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Happy hour! Although nothing seems exceedingly pricey for Portland, happy hour let's this place compete and defeat any dive. Wine lovers unite behind the wine specials. A set, happy price for all wines?! Sign me up!

Try to spinach and artichoke dip. The flat bread is not heavy AT ALL. Spoon it on and fold it over New York pizza style. Seriously so good with a pepper jack twist. I will be experimenting at home.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Me and my boyfriend came here a couple nights ago - We loved it! We had already eaten, so this rating and review doesn't include any opinions about the food.

We heard the restaurant before we saw it....Great Motown music had us dancing in the street! We weren't even sure it was a restaurant - kind of looked like a funky antique shop. We walked in and were blown away by the cool decor and all the things you could look at.The lighting and pillows cushioning the booths made it a cozy, comfortable place that wasn't too loud or quiet. We were sat immediately at the bar and had a couple mixed drinks each which averaged $12 each. Our bartender and the other staff were friendly and sweet. Everything (including the bathrooms) was very clean and nicely kept. We definitely plan on coming back and trying the food.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
I'll start with my delta. The service is incredibly slow. Like I could leave and come back and my water still wouldn't be here slow. We waited over 5 minutes after being seated to get menus and a total of 15 minutes to order drinks and an appetizer. Everyone is nice but the service comes across disorganized.

The decor is adorable with pillows surrounding the wall seating. Its gives off a very comfy vibe.

I ordered the vanilla bean martini which was good. It has a nice clean taste.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip that was good. The pita slices seemed a bit stale as they were very hard, but not in a good way.

I really want to give this place 4 stars because of the tremendous effort I could tell the owners put into this place.  I can't give stars on how it should be though; it must be based on my actual experience.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Love this place!  They make the best mixed drinks and the food is always good. The rude, obnoxious owner is apparently at their other location now so don't have to listen to his childish antics. Happiness for everyone!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
We were drawn in by the music on the street and the fun decor.  Upon walking in you are greeted by eclectic decor with great art and unique photos throughout. It was the food and service that will bring us back! Juls is a dime, absolutely awesome! 
The flatbreads: Reuben, Cuban, and New Yorker ... Full of flavor, very tastey and the perfect size. The cole slaw is minced and adds a smooth cool addition to the meal. For dessert: we got the sweet crepes; lemon&blueberry and Nutella - two very different tastes both thoroughly enjoyed by my kids. 

The bathrooms were clean as well as entertaining! 
Home Run!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
We went here upon a recommendation from a friend ... I'm so glad we made it here. We got there around 6:30 and say at the back of the bar.  I tried their d'anjou pear martinis and couldn't get enough of it -- delicious!!! 

Highly recommend this place. And the city of Portland is absolutely adorable!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Really really love this place for a quiet night with someone special or to catch up with friends. Wonderful dim romantic, laid-back atmosphere and open relatively late!! They were serving food when we got there at 11:30pm. I've been here twice and both times, left with a happy belly...though the first time I was more impressed with the food than the second time. 

For an appetizer, we ordered the nacho's twice. The second time, I asked to sub the minced beef for something else and the chef improvised some other minced meat that turned out to be really yummy. I LOVE nacho's and The North Point does theirs right. Plenty of cheese, beans, shrooms. Could do with even more salsa and guacamole though! 

Totally would recommend the stuffed flatbread sandwiches, but not all of them are winners. It is totally a panini/wrap/pizza all rolled into one delicious parcel. 

LOVE:
- The Cajun Pulled Pork - Smoky juicy pork. What more could I ask for?? 
- I forget the name of this and it's not on the online menu - but it's got sauteed fruits and turkey in it. SO DANG DELICIOUS!!!! 

Like:
- The Maine Mushroom - great for vegetarians. Very hearty and STUFFED silly with sauteed mushrooms. The dried blueberries add a really unique spin to the flavors of the wrap and make an otherwise, more monotonous 'shroomy flavor take on a new twist.

Meh:
- Smoked Salmon - Would probably pick another sandwich. I normally LOVE smoked salmon, but there wasn't as much salmon as I would have liked, and the fillings just gave the sandwich too much of an earthy flavor. Not my cup of tea, but may be yours...

Would totally return to try some cocktails and other menu items. Maybe even venture out of the flatbread section of the menu...

name: the-north-point
review_text: Wait staff was knowledgeable and friendly, drink was fantastic. Cool vibe inside. Great spot tucked away in the Old Port.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
The North Point is a cozy little place that serves small plates and amazing drinks ($5 mojitos on Tuesdays!).  This visit I was able to find a seat at the bar and the service was great; bartenders were attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. I had their special - sample of three different sausages with four different dipping sauces and a raspberry mojito. I knew going in that this place was known for their mojitos so of course I had to have one and good Lord it didn't disappoint (I also had their peach mango-tini, which was equally was delicious.) I could have easily sat there for a better part of the night and had a liquid dinner, their drinks were that good! 

If you're claustrophobic in any way this is not the place for you.  Most of the seating is two person tables that are inches away from each other. Because of the close quarters you may get to know the tables on either side of you quite well and make a few new friends. So pull those tables together and have some fun!

name: the-north-point
review_text: After 3 attempts to get my drink correct, which took20 minutes even though we were the only customers for the first 15 minutes), I finally just ordered another and it was just ok. Overpriced weak drinks (2 mediocre drinks and a bowl of olives=$30! In Portland?!), decent atmosphere, decent menu, just basically a rip off. It was completely empty on st Patrick's day. I can't imagine ever returning and wish I could get my $ back!

name: the-north-point
review_text:
First and foremost, I didn't come here for happy hour or at night. I say this because this seems to be the context in which most of the positive reviews are written. That said, I thought the place itself was really nice, made a great drink, but the food wasn't impressive to me. Now I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong thing or if it was because I came at 12:00pm on Sunday when it was empty, but food wise I wasn't impressed. 

To start with the positive, I got a hot totty made with Meyers rum and it really hit the spot, especially given that it was snowing and freezing outside. Aside from that, it wasn't the greatest dining experience from a food standpoint. I had the Maine Mushroom stuffed flatbread and a baby spinach salad. The salad was ok, but I wouldn't say I enjoyed. The flatbread was similar. Decent, but not memorable. It was definitely heavy on the bread and not so much with the mushrooms and stuffing.

Aside from this, the restaurant itself is awesome from a style standpoint. It has the feel of a cabin kind of place and you feel like kicking back and relaxing. There's a whole bunch of really awesome art on the walls by this one specific artist and it gives the place a very unique feel. Servers and bartenders are very friendly and they also made a hell of a bloody mary.

I definitely wanna come back here for happy hour or an overall night out to get a different experience when I'm back in Portland. I liked the place, just not to food.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Stopped in with my wife for dinner on a whim. I have heard good things about this place so had to check it out. It's located in the space called Options where I used to get my hair cut years ago.

We went on a Saturday night and totally lucked out.  We found a parking spot one street away and when we walked up, the owners greeted us at the door and offered us two seats at the bar since no tables were available. There were good tunes playing from the sound system which is a major plus for us. The decor is arty and funky.  The bar dominates the right side of the space and the left side has about 10 tables. There were two tables outside on the sidewalk. It's pretty small but didn't feel cramped. The staff is very friendly but not intrusive. 

My wife ordered a margarita and I ordered a beer.  The margarita was good.  It wasn't too sweet which is half the battle. They had about a dozen and a half beers available.  Their specialty is flat bread sandwiches. Do not let that deter you.  They were not food on a roof shingle.  My wife had the ham, brie and green apple, hold the candied walnuts and honey while I had the club flat bread.  Both sandwiches were delicious.  They were warm and toasty but not overdone....just perfect.

So if you're into something to eat on the lighter side with a drink or a beer, I would definitely consider North Point. It's fun and cozy and unpretentious.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Amazing meat and cheese plates.... of the beaten path, well worth the short walk. Owner greeted us with the order, highly recommended, authentic ambience... fun time with a great cocktail menu..

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Love the music which is at a perfect volume. The seating inside is cozy and the outdoor tables are perfect. Our first visit there the waitress brought some water for a man who was sitting having a drink and had his dog with him. 
The service is spot on. Your needs are attended to without being intrusive. The old fashioned, I ordered w Maker's Mark, was one if the best I have ever had. The Gin Ricky was also very easy going down while refreshing. The flatbreads are $13 and hearty. They also have cheese and meat plates and other items. 
After our first visit I thought about it everyday for two weeks until I got to go back. 
This is a great little spot that is well paced, well staffed and one of our new top choices when we are out.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Lounge restaurant. Great flatbread and cheeses. The service was friendly and quick. We were pretty drunk when we entered and this was a good place to get something to eat.

name: the-north-point
review_text: A really good gastro pub in Portland's old port. We had an excellent spinach artichoke dip and the Havana Cubano flatbread sandwich. The drink menu and beer selection was pretty good as well. A must stop.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
Tired the Rubin stuffed flatbread, as a seasoned taster of Rubins Ill describe it one word.

slamming!

Michael Oberther
www.clientcyclemarketing.com

name: the-north-point
review_text:
great atmosphere and delicious tacos. found this restaurant on a whim without checking out the reviews and found it to be a fantastic restaurant off the beaten path from the regular "tourist spots". 

drinks are a 8 out of 10. food is 9 out of 10. atmosphere is 10 out of 10. service is 8 out of 10.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Great place to go for a cocktail.  I got a Strawberry lime daiquiri & my friend got a very small but potent drink. Interesting music and very relaxed.  Great outdoor seating area though be careful you are right on the sidewalk. Being right next to the Regency a lot of the hotel guests were there enjoying themselves a bit too.

name: the-north-point
review_text: I love the look and feel of this place. If it is possible to fall in love with a rest room, I am enamoured with theirs, love it! We didn't try any food because honestly I was shocked at the prices of the beers! Definitely more than I'm usually willing to pay for the same beers that I can get  elsewhere in the city for $3- $5 less. I am hoping to check out their happy hour soon though, I am sure I will fall in love with the rest of this adorable little place.

name: the-north-point
review_text:
I've been here twice, and both times were great. It's a small darkly-lit place with a quirky yet classy feel to it - like they went to the garage sale put on by the wealthiest family in your town and bought a bunch of random items repurposed as decorations. At first I was creeped out by all the rooster statues lurking above the bar - but then I grew to love them. And you will, too.

Get any one of the pressed sandwiches - you won't regret it. I've tried three, if you count the portion I sampled from my friend during my first visit. All top notch and delicious. Otherwise the menu seems to have a good selection of restaurant/bar food and a cheese plate that I didn't quite understand. I highly recommend getting the Old Fashioned, if the amicable and chatty bartender who looks like Skeet Ulrich is working. They were among the best I've ever had.  They have a full menu of signature cocktails that I would be happy to try on subsequent visits.

During my first visit, my friend and I were sitting at the bar next to the owner. It's really interesting when you hear the thought that goes into a restaurant concept. Everything from the decor to the menu choices to the swizzle straw colors. He's fascinating - and also owns the new steak restaurant Timber.

Before you leave, make sure to check out the bathrooms. They have a wide assortment of hilarious old timey serious-looking portraits with funny superlatives assigned. Definitely entertaining when you're doing your business.  

The only thing preventing me from becoming a regular is that the food and cocktails are a bit pricy - but that's only because I'm a cheap bastard. I'll probably still show up once a month for an Old Fashioned and a pressed sandwich.

name: the-north-point
review_text: This was a wonderful little stop duirng an old port afternnon adventure. The ambiance is very date night, perfect for conversation. There is even a sidewalk patio. We chose to sit at the bar. This was a great choice to get excellent serivce and ask plenty of questions about the menu and cocktails. The bartender was bubbly and enthusiastic. The cocktails were delicious. I got the summer sangria, which had a nice rose wine and hint of sweetness from the fruit. The pulled pork flatbread was delightful, pakced wiht coleslaw, bbq and plenty of gooey melty mozzarella. The prices above average and the other hinderance to more frequent stops.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Went to North Point while stopping through Portland for the day. Got in and ordered quickly, but two sandwiches took almost one hour (!). Given, when we got the food it was great, and the atmosphere with all the chickens and quotes on the wall with antique photos gave it a fun touch.

name: the-north-point
review_text: The drink menu is to die for!  pleaseeeee try the pear martinis! Shelby - the bartender - is the best!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Great little bar in Portland!  Their cockstails all sounded amazing, I want to try the bloody mary, but my stomach wasn't feeling it.  I had the elderflower cocktail, which was SO GOOD- even my bf loved it.  The staff was nice, interior was really interesting.  Bathrooms were big and clean (I live in NYC, this is a big deal to us!).  Wish we could have stayed later, but he already wants to go back next time.

name: the-north-point
review_text: Decor is both nice and funky.  Great vibe and atmosphere, helped by the cool music. Friendly and helpful service. Tasty food and quite possibly the best cocktails anywhere. You can't go wrong at The North Point!

name: the-north-point
review_text: Atmosphere is super cool here! I just want to take people that don't know anything about Portland here because it feels so unique. With that being said, the food is great as well. We ordered only apps and drinks, but well worth the visit!

name: union
review_text:
We came here for brunch on a Sunday and I absolutely loved every part of my dining experience here. My server was extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive. The ambiance was on point as well- It's a trendy and spacious spot with lots of windows which brightens up the room during the day time. 

We were given a regular breakfast menu and a brunch menu. They had an entire section for eggs (I love anything w eggs). I ended up ordering a beef hash that came with an egg, while my friend ordered the omelette. Both were extremely good. The beef hash was very different from any type of beef hash I've had before. And much lighter than any beef hash I've had (most hashes I've had were extremely heavy). It did seem to come with significantly more beef than potato though. 

I'd highly recommend giving this place a visit if you're in the area or looking to try a new restaurant!

name: union
review_text:
I ventured out this morning with a few other humans to try Union for the first time.  We made reservations ahead of time and they gave us a cozy table in the back, perfect for the baby and little boy we had with us.  The waiter was extremely attentive, giving us lots of tips on the menu, that paired with the gorgeous decor and view of Congress street we knew we were in for a stellar time.

Pros-
1. Food was excellent!!!  I had the lighter fair with cheddar cheese. The winter berries in the omelette was genius.  The jam was scrumptious and fingerling potatoes perfectly crunchy on the outside.

2. The restaurant is stunning, fresh flowers on the table and really cool lighting.

3. Kid friendly to a point, they didn't have changing tables in men's the bathroom but they offered my husband a place to chance the baby. They had a bunch of stuff for the kids to play with to keep them entertained.

4. Waiter was attentive and friendly

Cons-

1. Only one the drink prices were out of this world $5.00 for a cup of coffee is insane.  I don't care that it's local and unlimited, the mark up seems to be a bit extreme.  That is more expensive then fancy restaurants in Boston. I can honestly say I was shocked when the bill came and that was price. $4.00 for small apple juice!!!!! The rest of the food was reasonably priced. 

Overall-we will return but will not order drinks

name: union
review_text:
A few weeks ago, a few friends and I decided to meet up at Union for some pre-dinner cocktails. Having never been to Union before, I was excited to experience their venue, as I have walked passed it numerous times.

Upon entering, Union has a modern, American-restaurant aesthetic with wooden floors, modern lighting fixtures and contrasts of black throughout the venue. Union has an expansive bar to sit at with some couch-like bar seating, and a variety of other table seating. On a Saturday night, the bar was definitely popular and busy, which I am assuming is due to Union being in the same building as the Press Hotel. It seemed as though people were coming in to stop for a quick drink before they started making their rounds around the city. 

However, my friends and I opted for the open couch seating by the bar and were quickly greeted by the bar waitress. Our waitress was incredibly attentive and provided AMAZING service. I ordered an extra dirty martini, which was made to perfection, and a couple other friends ordered from the cocktail menu and when they came out, they were presented nicely.

After some time by the bar area, my friends and I figured we might as well stay and try some of Union's dinner options. We were seated in the dining area and again, were quickly greeted by our waitress. Perusing the menu, Union certainly highlights seafood options, which makes sense due to the tourists that stay at the hotel, but they also have a few other protein options beyond seafood. I ended up getting the truffled pot roast, which was served in a small cast iron skillet with vegetables, broth, and some grated horse radish. The flavor profile was amazing and everything was working together nicely. My only negative was that the pot roast was slightly fatty. My friends enjoyed their dishes which included the filet, the scallops, and the salmon.

I ended the night with one of my friends and I sharing the chocolate dolvino, which was a decadent chocolate pudding with pieces of chocolate fudge-like pieces in it. It was incredibly good!

In general, I think Union has a lot to offer. Why not five stars? I think their prices are exponentially inflated for what they are offering. If they brought the price points down on their options, I think they would have even more success, but regardless, I will be sure to be back, even if only for some pre-dinner cocktails and/or dessert.

name: union
review_text:
Phenomenal service. Everyone in our party had allergies. The sous chef Heather came out and worked with us on the menu and she and Chef Josh was easily able to cater to everyone. The restaurant itself is elegant with dim lighting to set a relaxed mood. The staff was amazing. Super friendly and extremely accommodating. Our server Megan was especially friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and helped us with the drinks. We ordered off the restaurant week menu.  The bar made me a Cosmopolitan and it was delicious. I had the haddock and it was light and fluffy and the broth was incredibly flavorful. I finished off the meal with a deconstructed cheesecake. It was outstanding. 

I highly recommend this restaurant most especially if you have allergies.

name: union
review_text:
Very good food, great service and a complimentary dessert that I would marry if it was 1) legal and 2) my husband allowed it.

I've always wanted to come here and when the stars aligned for my birthday and we had a gift card, I knew it was time.

We started out with the cheese plate for $18 which seemed a bit steep for what we got but the cheeses were delicious. I especially liked the cheese.from Fuzzy Udder that looked like brie but wasn't. At the same time, we also got the artisan bread that came with whipped lardo and Casco Bay butter, both a little salty but equally delicious. Did we need all of that? Of course.

For our main dishes, I got the buttermilk fried chicken which came with hen of the wood mushrooms, spoonbread and some dill pickle cauliflower. I am NOT a mushroom person but I decided I was going to try everything. They were delicious and didn't have the slimy texture of most mushrooms. My chicken was very crispy and had a sweetness to it that I really liked. My husband got the sea scallops that came with a succotash and crispy pork shoulder. He cleaned his plate so I'm assuming he enjoyed it.

Finally we got dessert because it was my birthday after all! The chocolate budino sounded amazing so we ordered that. Its a rich chocolate mousse with a chocolate torte and some cream. I could have licked the bowl when we we're finished. It was probably the best thing we had all evening. Even better, it came out with a lit candle and they gave it to us for free!

The last thing I'll mention is the service. It was wonderful. Our waiter was attentive without hovering and was knowledgeable about the food. He was really great and wished me a happy birthday a few times. I really recommend visiting Union.

name: union
review_text: Great spot inside the Press Hotel. Not too crowded at lunchtime. Started with the brussels sprouts, which were awesome, and the clam dip which came spread out on a plate with a pile of thin twisted fritter and chive powder - wow! The frisee salad was pretty standard but good and the white bean soup had a nice flavor to it but had lamb in it that sunk to the bottom. I would have preferred it without the lamb. We were sadly too full for dessert but would for sure like to come back for dinner and a treat another time.

name: union
review_text:
Food tasted good, but the portion sizes were very small for their steep prices (thank goodness for that bread and butter that comes with dinner). 

Our octopus was cooked well and we enjoyed our drinks, but it's one of those restaurants where they focus on the plate decor instead of the quality/ quantity of the food. Pretty, but not enough.

name: union
review_text:
My extended family surprised me with a 50th birthday party here the other night.  For whatever reason, this restaurant has never been on my radar but I was very impressed nevertheless. Obviously, I was not part of the planning, but my sister said the restaurant and the event planner were very helpful and good to work with. As the recipient of the festivities, here are my impressions.

Our waitress was excellent.  I made a deliberate effort to  remember her name so I could publicly acknowledge her, but alas, a martini and a good bit of Cabernet Sauvignon ruined that.  Nevertheless she was a perfect blend of attentive and timely.  She always seemed to be there when you needed her but was not intrusive or overbearing.

The food overall was excellent however the complimentary bread was quite boring.  Nevertheless, things improved quickly from there.  I had the veal carpaccio which was plated beautifully and was a wonderful contrast of textures.  Veal might be a touch too bland for the dish, but it still was a pleasant experience.  I chose the truffled pot roast for my entree.  Some members of my family expressed their surprise that I did not pick something "fancier" but I had a good feeling about this.  I was definitely right..... beautifully tender meat and a truffled jus that was fantastic!  

Everyone I talked to in our party enjoyed their meals.  Even my finicky daughter loved her chicken dish and even tried the mushrooms that they were sautéed with.

The best of the meal was that my father picked up the tab for the whole meal, which judging by his facial expression was painful.

name: union
review_text:
Very nice dinner at Union! A friend recommended Union, so we were looking forward to it!
Hip place, nice menu!  Kim had the Bolognese, I had the cod, both very good! Excellent service!

name: union
review_text:
Lunch here is sunny with great service and tasty noms. 

On a lark, I went here on a business lunch and it's the perfect venue for such an outing. I could see it being a cosy place for two friends sharing a lunch break also. During the day, it does not strike me as romantic but at night, it could be. 

We ordered the truffle oil potato chips with ranch dip for an appetizer and they. are. rich. Do not order these for "something light."  They are incredible and tasty; excellent balance of salt and creamy if you use that homemade ranch dipping sauce. A table of four will polish them off, but for two people, it's a challenge. 

For lunch, I got the burger which comes with lettuce, tomato, onion, bacon, cheese, and "Union sauce."  It was a great burger, moist and fresh and cooked well. The English muffin as the bun was the let down. It took away from what could have been an outstanding burger! It was dry and flavorless. Give us a pretzel bun or Kaiser roll or just a sesame hamburger bun and it'll make all the difference. The Union sauce was unknown but it complimented the meats/cheese/veggies well. 

It comes with a salad (which after the chips I should have gotten) or fries. I opted for the fries and THEY ARE FRENCH FRIED FINGERLING POTATOES!! Cooked and seasoned absolutely perfectly, I was so happy to have gotten them--despite my fried food overload. 

I ordered coffee too. It's good. Have no idea if it's Sanka or Tandem or CBD or what, but a good cup of joe is a good cup of joe, ifyouknowhatImean. 

Our server was delightful. I'd give her a shout out but I can't remember her name. Very attentive-never let our water deplete! A+++ for that. 

That English muffin bun fiasco is the only thing from giving Union a fourth star. I'll be back though as there were plenty of things I wanted to try on the menu.

name: union
review_text:
Came to Union for brunch while in Portland, Maine and loved it!! The restaurant was beautifully decorated and very modern. 

We ordered the eggs Benedict and the cornbeef hash and the cleansing juice, and all the items we got were amazing!!! The juice was fantastic and so unique, I would highly recommend it. It was very flavorful and gingery. 

Overall a great restaurant in downtown Portland, in a great location, with a very delicious brunch menu!

name: union
review_text:
Huge foodie and was super excited to try this place. But I left disappointed. 

Started off with the "local favorites" seared tuna. $18 for 4 pieces of seared tuna with not enough sauce and too much garlic oil on the slaw. Too many competing and contrasting flavors, dish didn't know what it wanted to be. Skip. 

Then had the braised lobster with corn fritters and Summer corn chowder. I basically chose this restaurant for this dish, because these are three of my favorite things to eat! Shouldn't have gotten my hopes up. Lobster was cooked perfectly, but the corn fritters were extremely salty and dry. Also no corn kernels to be found! I've found that the best corn fritters often have actual pieces of corn in them. Dish left more to be desired. 

Boyfriend had the crab pasta, which was the best dish we tried. Wish I had ordered that instead. But it came with mint on top, which was very unsettling. 

Ended with the deconstructed whipped cheesecake. Definitely the best part of the meal, would highly recommend! 

Decor is beautiful, service nothing to write home about. There have to be better restaurants in Portland.

name: union
review_text: The food is fresh and delicious. The portions are generous. The service is impeccable. Must visit if you are in Portland

name: union
review_text:
Nestled on the first floor of the Press Marriott Hotel, this very pricey restaurant has unusual and tasty dishes.
The Lobster Bisque loaded with mostly potatoes, vegetables and crackers is worth a try. I would have preferred more Lobster in it. The Liver Pate Appetizer was interesting but not spectacular.
We ordered two Chef Signature dishes. One the Cod Dish and the other Pot Roast. According to my husband the chef,  the Pit Roast couldn't have been prepared better!
The Cod dish was interesting and the clams and nik Chou were delicious. 
The desserts are quite unique as well. I would recommend the Apple Brûlée which was light and delicious! Top that off with a capuchin o! Yum!

name: union
review_text: Went to celebrate my aunt's birthday it was everything she expected. The service was amazing from the waitress to the valet parking. Food was deliouse. As a starter we got the Burratta absolutely amazing! I got the slow cooked lamb shoulder and my aunt the salmon. Not a huge sweet person but thr dessert was sooo good

name: union
review_text: Fantastic birthday meal here. Service was stellar. We started with two dry ciders, very good. Shared an appetizer, the poached duck egg. Executed to perfection. Smoky and buttery and decadent. For dinner, the sirloin was soft and succulent, great use of Hen of the Woods mushrooms. Flavor was on point. Other dish, the Hake was fantastic too. Great baby clams, perfectly cooked bok-choy, house made Chinese sausage, kim-chi. Just a great flavor combo. Lots of Umami in the broth the fish sat upon. Only disappointment was the gelato sold as salted caramel but tasted more like butterscotch. A small difference and didn't change the fact that this restaurant's food quality and cost were great. Definitely recommend and would return for sure.

name: union
review_text:
Definitely one of Portland's Finest and now jumping up my top 5 in the city for good, reliable COMFORT FOOD... from pot toast to their amazing fresh pasta with bolognese sauce... trust me... it's like none other. 
Our waiter, Randy explained how the pasta is made with little 'nooks' in it ... I think we would think it's 'irregular' but the chef has this thing about keeping the sauce sticking to the pasta while you gain full flavor... MASTERED! 
There is a very unique texture to this dish and trust me, you'll go back for more or you'll try hard to make not so perfect pasta for this very reason. 

Appetizers are creative (shrimp and hominy) will be a great start or try the brussels... in s category completely of their own. Huge Brussels sprouts fan here so I love to see what a chef can do with them... these guys nailed it.

Union has climbed my ranks of awesomeness and with the food scene getting better by the day in Portland, this is one you won't want to miss. 

Cheers! Thanks guys! Great Grub!

name: union
review_text:
Trying to diet in this city is very difficult! The good in Portland is so good but not always health conscious. I've been coming to Union for breakfast on weekends because I can get a very good dish of eggs, with wheat toast and turkey sausage that is very dry and not dripping with grease.

Today, our server Bridget even offered to replace the potatoes with berries for me. Her demeanor the entire meal was absolutely delightful. It's always good here but today was really exceptional.

name: union
review_text: I absolutely love this place. I go just about every other week for brunch and everything is amazing. My favorite is the huevos rancheros, because of all the different flavors included in one dish. I also love the muffins and bacon. This is a very nice restaurant with lots of details. 10/10 would recommend going to this place.

name: union
review_text: Came here for a Sunday brunch and we were immediately seated. We ordered the corned beef hash, crab pasta and the seafood chowder. The pasta was quite good with plentiful crab meat pieces. The corned beef hash was okay and nothing really stood out. The biggest disappointment was the seafood chowder. For $14, I expected a bit more. But what we got was a bowl of mainly fish pieces, ginger and some potato. There was literally no chowder or broth. The bowl was small too but even then it didn't taste appetizing to finish. Overall, the environment and decor seems nice but for the price maybe go elsewhere for brunch.

name: union
review_text:
Absolutely fantastic! Such a great addition to the Old Port. We popped in late Saturday and were able to be seated within just ten minutes even though we didn't have a reservation. I had probably one of the best old fashioneds ever, perfectly balanced and sweet. The crab pasta I had for dinner was absolutely amazing. So pretty and tasted beyond what I thought a pasta could taste like. My companion really enjoyed his swordfish special and said it was the best he had ever had. 

Two things that keep this from being a five star review: The first is that the dessert I had was honestly "meh". I had the Union M&M's standing for macarons, madeleines, and meringues. While generous in amount (two of each dessert), each item tasted like it was store-bought and not all that unique. The madeleines were very dry and had no taste to them, while the macarons were hard and crunchy instead of light and airy. Definitely wouldn't order this again. 

The second is that a few days after the dinner went through on my credit card, I noticed that the total of my bill was slightly higher than what I wrote down on my slip. It was just a few dollars more, so nothing that's going to wipe me out, but it does seem a bit dishonest that the server would think its okay to add more money to her tip, when I didn't write that amount down. Maybe pay in cash next time to avoid being swindled. 


I definitely will be back to enjoy the food! But ask to make sure the desserts are fresh and make sure your tip is what you left!

name: union
review_text: On my recent visit to Portland, I chose this restaurant based on reviews on Open Table when looking for a place to dine. It also was located in our hotel, the Press Hotel.  The restaurant itself has a contemporary feel. There's a dining area and a bar area. I was underwhelmed by the service received at this restaurant.  The young gentleman serving us seem like we were a bother.  As a waitress in my younger years, I notice good service and I expect a server to approach the table and introduce himself. That did not happen.  I was very surprised as we received nothing but special and courteous treatment from the staff members of the hotel. My husband and I started with a couple cocktails from the bar and ordered two of the appetizers. The seared goat cheese and the roasted carrots, both were delicious.  I was, however, disappointed that the carrots only had six colorful petite carrots on the plate.  I ordered the scallops for my dinner and my husband had the special fish of the night. He enjoyed his entrée. I loved the fennel that was served with my three scallops. They were perfectly grilled and tender. Again, the food was good but the service was lacking. I had no refill on my water until after I was finished with my meal.  I expect more from a restaurant that charges these prices. I expect to be waited on by a friendly and attentive staff member who introduces themselves, which did not happen. For my last night in Portland, I wanted this to be a special meal and that is why I chose Union.  The dinner we had at David's restaurant in Portland was so much better as we were treated wonderfully and waited on attentively. I think Union could learn a thing or two from David's management on how to train service staff.  It really does make a difference for the all-around experience while dining.

name: union
review_text: I HIGHLY reccomend the chef's table at Union for a special occasion...such a delightful and delicious experience! We just did the 5 course chef's tasting menu for my birthday. The chef (actually sous chef, Bri) lead us through a personalized menu (no meat for me/no dairy for my man). The food was outstanding...creative, thoughtful and local. The whole kitchen team was spot on. Thanks a million for making my birthday so special!

name: union
review_text:
I truly want to love this place.

I just can't seem to make it work, though.

If I was from out of state and was coming to Portland, there's a good chance this is one of the hotels I would end up at. And, who knows, maybe I would check out Union for breakfast (which I *still* hear is amazing years later, and am *still* going to try one of these days) or a cocktail and love it. But... as a local who knows some of the great locations throughout the city for food, drink, and service, this place continues to underwhelm me. Despite the many times I've now been here, I always leave wishing I had chosen a different bar. 

+/- Cocktails 
During the winter they've got this fig and walnut concoction that might be one of the best in the city; unfortunately, they're pretty strict about only making what's on their current menu. Recently I had a $14 cocktail that was 2/3 full and tasted of watered-down lime juice (it was even greenish in color). Frustrating since I bought something that was supposed to be bourbon, apple brandy, and cinnamon simple syrup. My friend's cocktail tasted like a warm melted chapstick. They both were bad enough that after one sip I asked her if she wanted to go to a different bar. I would have liked to talk to the bartender about our drinks, but... 

- Service
At my latest experience, the bartender wasn't personable or attentive at all. At least not to us. We ordered two rounds of drinks, and both times they seemed to come out staggered (we're talking twenty or so minutes between her drink and mine arriving). Beyond that, he wouldn't look at us when taking or delivering our orders - he was fixated on a large group of business men just behind us. Weird thing to note, I know, but it's weirder to be "talking" to someone who's looking past your shoulder at other people. And when explaining our drinks and food, he literally walked away mid-sentence (multiple times) to take care of someone else. So... not feeling especially wanted here.

- Food
I still can't wrap my brain around that cheese plate being almost $20. Yes, it's definitely more ample and balanced then it was when they first opened, but I've had cheese plates at nearly every place in town, and have had just as good or better for far cheaper and more plentiful. It's definitely not worth the price tag.

I'm so sorry, Union. I just don't get it. I don't know if it's me. If it's you. If it's me plus you. I will absolutely give it another go, though, because I'm determined to make us work... but first, I just need to get the taste of this lime drink out my mouth.

name: union
review_text: Made a reservation for 11am brunch. Arrived a few minutes early. Waited 10 minutes, had three different hostesses talk to us before we were finally seated (and there were multiple tables open). They all seemed incredibly confused. Ordered granola and milk, as listed on the menu. The granola arrived with no milk and no spoon. Had to ask for milk and then was charged extra for it. Server removed the charge but indicated we were wrong even though granola and milk was an ITEM ON THE MENU. I give up! Food good but won't be back.

name: union
review_text:
Visiting Portland for a few days, we wanted to end the trip with a nice sit down dinner. Based on the reviews on here, we easily picked Union to eat at.
Coming from New Jersey, we are used to heavily packed restaurants around dinner time. But there was no wait at 6pm. There were a good amount of people at the bar and a few tables filled. 
The food is amazing. The house made bread was great. I'm a huge fan of the free bread anywhere. We had the crab pasta as an appetizer, and that did not disappoint at all. My friend and I both ordered the salmon dish and were nothing but pleased. It was delicious. We didn't talk the entire time because of how good it was. Well portioned. Cooked well. The flavors were balanced well. As my friend put it "exquisite." I don't want to call it perfect, because what do I know about food, but it was very good.
We felt that we were underdressed and there was no fuss about it. The service was phenomenal. Monica, our waitress, was beyond pleasant and absolutely wonderful to have. 
Portland is a wonderful area and we will be back for sure in the future with friends and we will make sure to stop by union to eat again!!

name: union
review_text:
I'd actually give this a 3-point-something. It was better than OK, but nothing great either.  I'm not sure what exactly seemed to bother me about this place, but it felt like they didn't live up to their expectations. 

For one, it's restaurant week, and they are listed on the Maine Restaurant Week website. When they called to confirm the reservation, and restaurant week was inquired about, the man on the phone said it was the "chef's surprise." Oh? Maybe I'll surprise the chef with anaphylactic shock in return. Ok, well, no big deal; one can always ask more questions upon arrival. 

Upon arrival, the table wasn't ready. Fortunately, I am always happy to drink my night away, so I asked for my numbing-concoction-of-choice: Maker's on the rocks. Had I not spewed out that decision at the speed of lightning as I always do, the bartender didn't come back around for a while. Granted, he was busy, just not very personable. Maybe I wasn't there with the right person to enjoy myself. There were couples to my left and right who seemed to be sexually active with one another, so I guess I should just be happy for them. 

When the table was ready, we closed out and moved.  Our waitress was really friendly. She didn't mention restaurant week, but I asked for menu items, and she did deliver. I thought they paled in comparison to all other local restaurant-week menus because there was only one (as opposed to three) options. I think they are a little misleading to say they partake in restaurant week, but then once you arrive it's "we always have a tasting menu available."

The cheese plate was eh. I tried the three cheeses and only didn't want to barf on one of them.   One was cheddar-like and the others were very potent varieties, which aren't my taste. The parsnip soup I didn't partake in. The brussel sprouts were great, and my favorite part of the night. Meal: I had the pork shank. It was fine. It was luke warm and under salted, and I could never quite get my waitress' attention, so I gave up and ordered another drink. Other dish: Scallops. They were good, and quite oppositely salted compared to my dish.  Had to say no to dessert, so I can't judge that category. 

Meh.

name: union
review_text: Went for brunch on a Saturday and was quite impressed. French toast was one of the best I've had and the Brussels sprouts appetizer was tasty and original. Overall definitely one of the better brunch/breakfasts I've had recently. Would return to try lunch/dinner in the future.

name: union
review_text:
We tried to get into Eventide Oyster Co., but were seated outside with the narrow tables - didn't think we could eat comfortably with 3 people!

So, we ubered over Union as our Plan B.  It is so beautiful inside -  clean and refined.  My friend and I ordered the seared tuna app  and the salmon curry!  So so so delicious!  My other friend ordered the lobster roll and the avocado toast.  Both were to die for!

The best part of the meal was our waiter and bartender Isaac!  Our conversations with him was like our dessert.  He recommended a ton of places we plan on patronizing the next time we are in town.  He was the Alexa of Yelp.  

We will definitely be back at the Union!

name: union
review_text: Visiting from San Francisco. It's hard to top good food with where we hail from. Hanger steak was excellent, Hake amended for me as a gluten-free option was out of this world (spicy and exceptional sauce that I used my spoon with)...chocolate Budino and deconstructed cheese cake was excellent. Love the atmosphere of bustling lobby couches and a great bar with dinner tables interspersed.

name: union
review_text: Red flannel hash was delicious! Corned beef and beets was a nice combo and I might have to make this at home soon. Good coffee. Nice space in downtown Portland. Service was friendly. Kinda pricey but the food was very good.

name: union
review_text:
Delightful! 
GLUTEN FREE accommodations were excellent and we will return. 
We were searching for a place that was new to both of us for Maine Restaurant Week. We opted for Union at The Press Hotel and are so glad we did! 
We both chose to do the "surprise" 3 course MRW option. The cocktail I ordered was very well made and exactly as I'd asked for; it WAS pricey at $14, but delicious.
The staff was incredibly accommodating and polite, knowledgable and answering my questions sufficently.

name: union
review_text: Had breakfast.  There were 6 of us, sat at the high top by the window. Service was very good.  They were able to accommodate gluten free diets. We had the avocado toast, omelettes, lighter fare egg whites.  Food came quickly and was delicious.

name: union
review_text:
Solid breakfast. I love their hash with fingerling potatoes and beets. Topped with two perfectly poached eggs. Coffee by design coffee. 
We started with cantaloupe served over cottage cheese. Sprinkled with grape nuts and pistachios. Yum. 
My only hang up is that the bloody Mary's are served in a tall skinny glass. Hardly anything there and very pricy.

name: union
review_text:
Located in a swanky hotel, Union is a rather formal dining room in a otherwise fairly casual Portland food scene. 

And so it comes as no surprise that service was impeccable. Our waitperson was very efficient, accommodating and knowledgeable.

5 star for service.

What was less than stellar was the food. Given the high star rating and beautiful interior, i was expecting similarly amazing food.

The best things?
- zucchini crab cakes -phenomenal, fresh and not at all oily
- salad - ask delicious and fresh
- burrata - super creamy with a little jolt of weirdness with the presence of raisin like fruit
- salmon - very fresh and well seared 

Okay, not great
- corn with potatoes - this didn't work for me. The corn was light and fresh but the potatoes tasted starchy and mushy and so than texture didn't complement the crisp corn
- pot roast - disappointing; lacked flavor and salt. The root vegetables were bland
- cookies -these "house made" cookies tasted like cheap store bought pecan sundies and chips ahoy and Costco madeleines.
- house bread - this is obviously very rustic but was a little too hearty. Felt like I was eating super high fiber spelt bread
- tofu pesto risotto - okay, probably my fault for ordering such a dish but I wanted to try something different. This was a fail - why tofu at all? Wrong texture. Pesto was made from arugula which made it unbearably bitter without the fragrance of basil.

So the 4 rating reflects superior service(5) and solid tho not spectacular (3) food

name: union
review_text:
We had drinks and apps at Ink Well, the bar at Union/ The Press Hotel. It was a little disappointing that after 7 of us were sitting in the lounge foe 20 minutes, I had to go to the bar and ask the bartender is someone could serve us drinks and if we could order food.... the response was "of course we can serve you, we were waiting for someone to let us know you were ready"...... 
well... the apps were wonderful, drinks good.... I just feel at what is one on the most high end hotels in Portland ......you should not have to go to the bar and asked to be served....

name: union
review_text: Beautiful inside. Fantastic offerings. Food was amazing . Gluten free options available

name: union
review_text:
Woooow such a treat to enjoy a meal here at Union! While I usually stay away from hotel restaurants (they tend to be over hyped with less exciting menus) I loved Union. Every bite was delicious and perfectly balanced and I wish I lived closer to Portland so I could come back here. 

The braised lobster featured a velvety cream broth that somehow made the lobster taste even more lobstery! This was one of my most favorite meals in Portland, hands down.

name: union
review_text: We went to Union for brunch on a Sunday. There was no wait. It's inside a hotel which we didn't realize until we got there. Good food, nice space and good service. We got avocado toast with bacon and a benedict. Both were pretty good. Coffee wasn't the best around. The thing that threw me off was the price. I think it was overpriced. Food was good but not worth the price.

name: union
review_text:
Stopped in to try the new appetizer and drink special menu...and wow! A crab roll (as in not lobster, and totally fabulous), sliders, charred octopus, sangria, beer. Delicious, affordable and such a great spot to perch and watch, by great staff. 
I can't wait to go back.

name: union
review_text: Located in the Press Hotel, this was one of the best breakfasts I've had.  Everything is fresh and perfectly cooked with just the right seasoning.  The maple sausage is amazing, and you have to try the homemade jams.

name: union
review_text: Terrific meal, great staff, nice menu including cocktails and mocktails, and beautiful spot. We brought some cupcakes to do a mini gender reveal, just the two of us, and they were super gracious with plates and even some complimentary cookies to enjoy along side. A perfect place to celebrate our upcoming boy!

name: union
review_text: Super good breakfast place. English muffin and blueberry muffins were amazing. Waitress could've been friendlier but maybe she was having a bad day.

name: union
review_text:
Popped in here for a snack and drink. The atmosphere was great- bar is kind of small but it's cozy and there are seats at the bar, couches and assorted table seating.

There wasn't much in the way of cocktails on the menu but they seem to have a decent variety of liquor. We just stuck to beer tonight and the selection was good.

For the snack we ordered the chicken liver pate. I'm not a huge liver lover- I've had amazing liver toasts in Italy and had horrible experiences elsewhere so it was a toss up but it was the best thing out of the options given we had plans to get cheese and charcuterie elsewhere later tonight. The chicken liver pate came out on a thick piece of grilled bread that was cut into thirds and had a side of mushrooms and a runny egg. The pate was chilled but with the warm bread, egg and mushrooms it was perfect. Even my boyfriend who is completely anti liver couldn't help trying it and was pleasantly surprised.

Great experience. The entrees on the menu look pricey for Portland but judging by what we saw come out- we'd definitely come back to try this for dinner next time.

name: union
review_text:
Oh where do I start... I have wanted to come here ever since they opened. I met a friend here for drinks and an appetizer after work on a Wednesday. I ordered a drink that I honestly can't remember what it was called, but it was made with rhubarb and something else and it was hot. The description sounded delicious the product was anything but... it tasted like melted crayons. My friend ordered a lime flavored drink, the Old Orchard I believe. It literally tasted like watery lime juice. Our drinks didn't even come at the same time, it was very odd service. Our bartender really seemed extremely disinterested in us. No eye contact, no smile, no friendly bartender banter... nothing. 
My second drink, a Dark and Stormy, was good, but it's hard to mess that up. My friends 2nd drink was an extra dirty martini  she said it was just eh. 
The $18 cheese plate was delicious, but not even close to worth the price. 
I think that next time I'll try the Inkwell instead.

name: union
review_text: Good food - uneven service. Had there burger and it very good. Served on a muffin. Had the homemade chips as well - they were great. Water was slow to he refilled. One server kind of hovered to take the plates as soon as you were done. Not necessary.

name: union
review_text: My family stopped in for brunch yesterday. There was enough variety on the menu for everyone to find something they loved, including the kids. Lovely atmosphere, great service and delicious food! I loved it.

name: union
review_text: First time in Portland and this place was recommended by a bartender at Bull Feeney's. I am so glad we listened. The eggs benny with lobster was to die for. Delicious brunch cocktails also.

name: union
review_text: The three stars goes to the awesome bartender since the food was mediocre at best. I had the thanksgiving 3-course meal. $55 to get tendons that were as hard as fish bones in my turkey. What if those tendons got stuck in my throat? My server/bartender was very attentive and quickly asked the kitchen to explain. The host was pretty awful, too.
