review_text: We have been wanting to get here for some time on one of our trips to Portland, glad we finally did!  The reviews were pretty good, so it sets the expectations pretty high. Enjoyed our dinner very much, and very good service!  Nice wine list as well, and beers from Maine Brewing Co!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
I'll start with saying that the Back Bay Grill was not actually my girlfriend's first choice for our anniversary dinner, but that we came away from the experience more than happy with my decision to surprise her. We had looked at several places in the Portland area and debated about where we should go for several days until I read about the ambiance here - patting myself on the back for this one. 

To be completely honest, I would have given Back Bay four stars (our food was a bit on the salty side) but the service was so absolutely genuine that it would be dishonest of me to give anything less than a five star review. This place knows service, so keep up the great work. 

Dinner: Rare filet with baby carrots and some sort of magical potato concoction, Seared scallops and slightly sweet delicious risotto. 

Dessert: I don't remember exactly, some sort of mouse with carmelized bananas and little Oreo type cookies, they dressed it up with "Happy Anniversary" in chocolate which is always nice. A+

Well done ladies and gentlemen, well done.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: I went to Back Bay Grill with some colleagues for some drinks and appetizers recently . I was amazed at how plump and delicious the mussels were. I've never seen Mussels that big! Very good food and the service was excellent too!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
This place is near our home, so we were delighted to try it soon after we moved in.  We've been back several times since then.  

I can not say enough positive things about this place.  First, the location, while being in Bayside (my neighborhood), it still feels romantic and clean and comfortable.  The staff is magnificent.  We usually sit at the bar for dinner and drinks and Evie (spelling?) is a terrific bartender, very helpful and friendly.

Everything I've had has been fantastic, from the bread, the soups, the main courses and of course desserts.  The scallops are tremendously flavored and everything feels as if it were painstakingly cared for.  A definite go to!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. Small with a quiet and quaint atmosphere. The attention to detail by the staff was amazing. Food that made you not want to talk but just enjoy the superb quality and craftsmanship. Give this place a try and you won't regret it. I will definitely be dining here again!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: I was in Maine for a mini vacation and was looking for a nice place to eat. This restaurant was referred to me by the receptionist at the hotel I was staying at. When I arrived I was greeted by the hostess and seated towards the front of the restaurant. I was really impressed at the attentiveness  and kindness of the entire staff. I ordered the Hudson Valley Seared Foie Gras and the Lavender Marinated Duck Breast (something I was so looking forward to) and it was delicious. If you come to Portland you really shouldn't miss out on coming here.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: I had my engagement dinner here this past December, and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Everyone was extremely gracious to us and treated us so well. The atmosphere was great, very cozy feel on a cold winter night. The food was delicious. We both got steak dinners and they were cooked perfectly and had so much flavor. I want to thank the staff for going out of their way to make our engagement dinner special. We will be back!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Glad we finally made it in for dinner.  Never have heard much buzz about this place.  We walked in and did not have a resi.  The staff accommodated us at a table by the bar.  Would have  enjoyed being in the dinning room, but hey we were walk ins.  Bread service was nice(although I prefer oil to butter).  The local muscle were plated nicely.  They were good, but no Street and CO.  The beef tartare, woo woo wawa! Awesome, is the best word for this app.  Steak was great.  The lamb, was simply done right.  Creme brulee, was more than decent.  Waiter was knowledgeable and not a lameo.  A great spot to have a nice dinner, call ahead though.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: My husband and I chose to come here while on a visit to Portland since it is rated #1 on several websites. The smoked salmon appetizer was very good. My husband enjoyed his rack of lambs, but my pappardelle came out very watery and flavorless. It has been subbed with short rib instead of braised lamb for the night, not sure if that was a contributing factor. I mentioned this and immediately they made me a new dish; this time I chose the tomato fettuccine. WOW! This was incredible and it came out very fast after the issue I had. My husband and I both agreed that it was one of our favorite pasta dishes ever. The truffle flavor was amazing. We ordered the white chocolate ice cream and "chocolate spaghetti dessert." The ice cream sort of just tasted like vanilla but it was still delicious, and the chocolate part was super decadent. They ended up giving us the dessert on the house due to the mix-up which we were appreciative of. This is definitely a high-end, well-done restaurant (albeit in sort of a sketchy area). We would come back!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Everything we ate here was absolutely delicious.  From the smoked salmon to the crab cake to the filet to the pappardelle with pork, every dish was beautiful, perfectly seasoned and expertly prepared.  We were too full for dessert but got a perfect little lemon cake bite on the house to finish things off.  The service was completely flawless to boot.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
Flew in from the west coast, hosed off and headed over. I had high expectations...they were far exceeded. Foie,  tartar, scallops, duck...all spot on. Hands down the best duck and scallops we have had in the past few years. Definitely the best tartar I've ever had.  Huge egg yolk, anchovies, and great pickles with the tartar. 

Now for the service. Absolutely the best we have had in recent memory... Or ever. Honest opinions on dishes, friendly, not rushed, charming and knowledgeable. It was as good as it gets from the greeter, servers to the excellent bar tender.  The bartender even came over and talked us through some wines with a no nonsense tasting. The waitress was not only efficient,  attentive and knowledgable, but extremely friendly and engaging.  The staff even put together a list of a must eats for the rest of our stay.  I don't recommend restaurants often, but when I do...

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: What a disappointment! If this is the best restaurant in Portland, the city needs some new chefs. Very ordinary food and overpriced! The meal started with an amuse bouche which featured soggy pastry and a bitter goat cheese. Then we had the fois gras.appertizer. The toast was very good but the fois gras was a tiny portion and the size of the toast made that very clear. For the main we had a heavenly scallops dish. It was very good. But the bill was outrageous for the amount and quality of the food.Such a disappointment given the rave reviews.Too bad, So Sad!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
My favorite restaurant in Portland, hands down. I enjoyed every second of this experience starting from making the initial reservation, to the host putting on my coat when we left. 

To start, we walked in and were surprised at the small space, but not too small that we were turned away. The distance from the tables to the kitchen was just close enough that we still felt like we were in our own space. The host was extremely welcoming. He even called me twice to confirm our reservation because of the fluctuating weather we had been having. I found that to be very gracious and not annoying. 

I was pleasantly surprised at the price of their drink menu as well. Their meals are a little bit higher than the norm for Portland (AND WORTH IT, but I'll get to that next), but the drinks were a pleasant 8-15 dollar range. 

We started with the mussels as an app (SURPRISE!). They were wonderful. They even split the app into two dishes for us. The homemade bread and butter was also just enough. One more slice I probably would have said it was too much, but then again, it was melt in your mouth bread, so too much is still ok. I ordered the scallops with risotto and roasted beets and my bf ordered the stuffed chicken leg. MIne couldn't have been better, so simple, yet incredibly sophisticated to taste. His chicken was stuffed with an herb sausage that he said was also delicous. We opted out of dessert, as we normally do, but we did notice the aray of sweets that were offered; from cakes, to brule, to several hot toddys. 

The service was top notch. Not once were we greeted without a smile, whether it was to take our order, ask how our meal was or take our plates. 

I can't wait to return, which I hope, is ASAP, like tonight, or tomorrow, or maybe they'll open to make me breakfast.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
We had a wonderful dining experience!

We started with the Maine Head Lettuces, made with Thyme Crouton, Parmesan and Garlic Dressing.  It was large enough to share, unique and quite tasty.  

For dinner I had the Hand Rolled Pappardelle with Braised North Star Farm Pork, Pancetta Soffrito, Leeks and Parmesan.  It was quite tasty!  

My wife had Lobster served over Risotto and Chard with an herb medley that was quite tasty.  

We generally don't eat dessert and we are hard to please, but decided to follow the waitresses suggestion.  It was an amazing Chocolaty Cake with Ganache and Blackberriies with a nice crunch.  We loved it!

I recommend making a reservation.  We will definitely return!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner on a recent trip to Maine for fall Foilage. We chose this thanks to Yelp reviewers and were glad we did. We made a reservation and were seated upon arrival. Service was excellent! We had the beef tartare and foie appetizers - both were so good! Steak was perfect. I had let them know we were celebrating a ten year anniversary and our dessert was beautifully decorated to commemorate our occasion. Highly recommend you visit this great restaurant!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: First time visit for my anniversary. Over the top service and food as well. It's nice to go to a restaurant where the service is amazing and they genuinely care about the patrons. I will go back every time I am in Portland. Lobster was amazing!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
I don't post reviews very often but felt compelled to after eating here.

The food was excellent and the staff was even better. 

My wife ordered the mixed green salad and I ordered the Maine Head Lettuce to start and both were very tasty. For entree, my wife ordered the seared scallops and I ordered the pappardelle. Both were excellent. I don't even really care for scallops all that much in general, but after having a bite of hers, I almost wished I had ordered them for myself.  For dessert we split creme brûlée and white chocolate ice cream and both were awesome.

The staff, especially the manager, couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Everyone was very friendly, polite, and consistently checked in with us to make sure we had everything we wanted/needed.  They went above and beyond the normal service level I would expect at a restaurant.

Needless to say, I highly recommend eating here!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
I'm not sure how I've eaten so many great meals in Portland over the years and somehow not made it to this spot.  Perhaps because it's not in one of the more frequently travelled to (for me) neighborhoods.  Regardless, I am very happy I finally had a chance to have a meal at this gem.  My wife and I made reservations to sit at the bar on relatively short notice, which works fine for us (immediate beverage service :)).  It also gave us a great view of the open kitchen and the rest of the staff.  All I can say is that the staff at Back Bay Grill including the cooks, bartenders, servers, host and even the guy hand drying glasses are restaurant professionals.  Things were running like a finely oiled machine.  

Might be worth noting that this restaurant has one of the most expansive wine lists I've seen in Portland.  I'm certainly not a wine pro, but there should be something to please just about anyone.  We tried a few cocktails as well and they were delicious.  The bartender was very friendly and happy to talk with us as we ate etc.  

We started off with an order of mussels which was huge and plenty to split with two people.  We were both huge fans of the popcorn with truffle oil and after devouring it all we were like damn now bread too!  My wife ordered the filet which is usually my go to, but I made sure to secure myself some of hers and can say it was a delicious steak.  I almost never order chicken because well its just chicken.  However, the bartender had suggested it to me and I was not disappointed.  The dish was packed with flavor and left me more than pleased.  

Seeing how we were already being gluttonous we also indulged in several desserts and while the specifics escape me none of it came home with us.  In case the rest of the review doesn't make it clear, I loved this spot, would suggest reservations, and can't wait to go back!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Wow! Five people at 6:00 PM on a Saturday night. Excellent follow-up to confirm our reservation and request to get in a little later. Outstanding service! Four people regularly cleared dishes, filled waters, and attended to every request, quickly! First course mussels were the best my husband ever had! Prime Rib extremely tender and cooked to perfection. Salmon presentation and preparation outstanding! Scallops were tender and delicious! Caramel ice cream was full of flavor and the creme brûlée was perfect. We had very high expectations and we were not disappointed!!!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: We all know the food here is excellent. The service is even better.  Walked in and the friendly host took our coats and let us know our table was being set and we would be sat in minutes. We sat at the bar, Evie the Bartender quickly struck up a relaxed convo and earned our trust immediately. My date wasn't fond of the cocktail menu but knew she wanted a drink with prosecco. Evie asked the right questions and made the perfect cocktail.  I look forward to visiting BBG again soon.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
Suffice it to say, I'm not impressed with the city of Portland ME.  Neither am I of any of their so called fine dining establishments.  Seems to me that most of the folks walking around this New England enclave are there just to pose!  I believe this is where the term poser started.  People posing as wealthy when they are not. And, restaurants posing as fine dining when they are not.  The Back Bay Grill is one such establishment.  Nice white linens adorn the tables clad with sub standard utensils.  My cafeteria in college had better dinnerware!
Food was Meh at best--- given the price of entrees I'd have to say poor!  You'd think you would get fresh seafood at such a place.  NO, we did not....all frozen.  Can get that crap out here in Colorado!
Find a better place to go that is worth the money.  Sorry Back Bay Grill we will not be back anytime soon.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: As I write this review my friends are saying "I need this restaurant to be next to my house" because it was the most incredible experience ever!!! The food was to die for and the service was beyond what I had ever anticipated. Literally every piece of food was perfection, drinks were delicious, service was perfect. Could not ask for a better evening I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant and am jealous of anyone who gets to eat here because I wish I could be!!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
One of the best restaurants in Portland, by far. Adrian is the best owner I have ever met and he is a wonderful business person, dad, and always makes you feel welcome. He remembers your name and so do all of the waitstaff (they're really great too). My family and I come here for every big celebration because they always make you feel special and welcome. 
The food is FANTASTIC. My grandmother has a lot of allergies and they are always willing and excited to make something catered to her needs. The crab cake is one of my favorite dishes and the salads are always delicious. The menu is constantly changing, but I always go for the pasta and am never disappointed. You need to come here. 10/10 would recommend. You really can't go wrong coming here if you want an upscale dinner that will not disappoint you. Everything is delicious.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Amazing amazing amazing. Wonderful little place just outside of downtown. Distinct flavor options, and honestly one of the best filet mignon's I've had in a very long time. We all had something different from the duck to scallops, and everyone loved their meal. Varied wine list and we sampled every dessert. Get the chocolate marquise for something fudgy and a glass of fonseca port to match. You won't be disappointed.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Outstanding!  Every meal was excellent and the service was exceptional.  A must for fine dining in Portland, Maine!  Great way for us to end our trip on a high note.  Enjoy!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
My new favorite place. 
Last night was our first visit. My wife had poached lobster app and salmon entree. I had crab cake app and Scallop entree. All were perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. Evie serving us at the bar was attentive, detailed and made a wonderful martini. 
Just a great night. 
Looking forward to our next visit.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
MY BF and I made reservations early in the week for a Saturday night and could only get an 8:30p seating but took it anyway because we had been dying to go-I asked if anything opened up earlier could he please call. 

On the day of our reservation Adrian (who is awesome!) called around 12:30 and said there was a 6:00p (too early) or a 7:00 at the bar.  We took the bar and I totally recommend doing so, sitting next to the open kitchen is so fun! The truffle popcorn was odd but my sage and gin cocktail was perfect! The bartender who served us was brilliant and beautiful, so sweet! 

Our starters of crab cakes and duck prosciutto...YUM...We had the lamb pappardelle, salty but unctuous and yummy and the scallops...cooked perfectly.  

I think we got some brandied apple dessert but I was too full to enjoy it! our total for 3 drinks, 2 apps, 2 meals and dessert was $160 with tip.  The area is a bit shady away from the downtown area but being off the beaten path is totally what makes it worth the trip.  I would absolutely go again.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
We loved this place for excellant food & service!
Place was booked when we called for a table, so we asked if we might sneak into the bar and eat. They reserved the bar for us! Our girl at the bar, Evy, ryms with chevy, was great, and the food was the excellant.. We stayed in Portland for 2 weeks and Back Bay was the best on our visit

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: This place is awful!!! Portion sizes are disappointing along with the taste of the food. Awful! And wayyyy over priced.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: My friends and I had reservations for Back Bay on Friday night. We picked this place because of Yelper's recommendations. When you enter, there's a feel of old school cigar lounge. I ordered the saffron and white wine mussels which were SO good. That sauce was ridonkulas! We had to request extra bread so we could mop up that sauce! I ordered the salmon. It was okay...it sat on a bed of pasta with roasted red pepper and a white sauce. The salmon itself was a bit dry and bland. We decided to skip dessert but they still gave us complimentary shortbread cookies with a dollop of chocolate ganache which were pretty yummy. I might come back and order a different entree.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
To echo the other reviews here, I had the beef tartare and it was incredible. My girlfriend had the crab cake and she was also quite happy. The crab cake is a good size with a lot of crab meat. There is also a light panko crust. However, despite those things, the sauce to go with it was a little bland.
For cocktails, I had the burnt orange rye something or other which was amazing. She literally burnt the orange in front of us. My girlfriend had the Spring prosecco (with gin, cucumber and lemon juice) which was also good but if you don't like gin that much the flavor does come through. It was quite refreshing though. 
We sat at the bar and the bartender was extremely friendly and professional. The only reason we didn't give 5 stars was that the crab cake wasn't out of this world. We would very easily go back though, especially for the service.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: Love this place. One of our favorites for date night. It's calm with great service so you don't feel like you're in an assembly line like some other places.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: The food was absolutely delicious -- from appetizer to entree to dessert!  It was our anniversary and they set aside a nice table and treated us very well.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: great ambience and such service with friendly really great staff. they love their job. You know it. They bend over backwards for you and accommodate your every want without being stuffy or pretentious.  We went here before going to a play. Hubby had 2 ways of lamb. One, was a sausage and one was a boneless lamb chop. With yummy potatoes and spinach. I had 3 appetizers. Now, the  place is super expensive and the appetizers were tiny,but so worth it. I wasn't stuffed I was so satisfied. My first appetizer was gnocchi and spinach. Then I had a warm squash salad with goat cheese. Last, foie gras. They gave us a sample of a new recipe at the start and end of the meal. Beats and basil with goat cheese and hazelnut chocolate mint truffle. Tasty. We still had dessert. Hubby, the Creme Brulee and I had Bread Pudding. Fantastic!!! the owner is great and I loved our waiters cause my husband loves to kind of tease folks, sort of, and the waiter played along nicely!!

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: 3rd time here. Always great food and service is exceptional but our server this time was a bit disappointing. Very robotic and didn't recommend drinks or even spent a minute on the menu with us. At an establishment like this one would expect a "tour guide" as a server but instead we got a cab driver.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
This place was amazing! Having just moved to Maine we decided to settle in with a celebratory dinner, Craig's selection was Back Bay, great choice!

We arrived a bit early because we wanted to grab a drink at the bar.  Our table was not quite ready, which obviously was fine because we showed up early.  We stayed at the bar for a little bit, bartender was awesome, very sweet and made great recommendations.  I don't totally remember what I started with (writing this review, way late!) I do know it was a whiskey drink that was really clever and tasty.  I think Craig had a beer.  

When we moved to our table we started with scallops, they were incredible.  Craig ordered a chicken dish, which made ordering chicken out worth it.  And I had a tuna dish, it was amazing.  Sorry I don't have more details, I started this review months ago and just never finished it. 

Its awesome, you should go.  It is a romantic little place, cool ambiance, great service.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: My wife and I went for our anniversary and loved it.  Fresh ingredients and great wine list. I ordered an Oregon Pinot noir. First bottle was corked and they replaced it without any drama. I'll definitely go back when I'm in the area.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
Went there for a special dinner last night , and were  not disappointed, tho not the best food we had in Portland . The staff were very attentive ! And the food was "good" but not "great ".
 The wines were reasonably priced and good value  which we enjoyed
The steak tartare was fantastic, as was the foisgras., the lamb not the best I've had , and the duck also wanting a little..
Overall a unique dining experience in Portland, and one of the best you will have.
 Highly recommended

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
The food was amazing at this restaurant!  I've visited Portland, ME twice and by far this is one of the best restaurant I ever been to.  Never had sweet corn ice cream before and it was very unique.  Creme Brulee was delicious.  Service was great and they gave sampler's for appetitizer and also for desserts. 

Highly recommend this restaurant.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: One of the best meals I have ever had!! I had the cod. It was perfectly cooked. My husband ordered the duck and it was perfect. And the steak tartare appetizer is simply amazing. A definite must have. Evie was an amazing bartender/mixologist. She was able to create unique cocktails that perfectly satisfied my taste! I have only been here once but would love to be a regular.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text:
The food was great, but we sat at the bar and the staff was rude and simply not what one would expect at a restaurant of this caliber. The bartender had a terrible attitude and was just not very nice.

 They also kept opening the door and window to air the place out and it was really cold. One would think that a restaurant with the reputation of this place would have adequate ventilation.

In one word: underwhelming. Not going back.

name: back-bay-grill
review_text: How perfect can you get? Back Back exceeds all expectations. We celebrated our 48th anniversary here and it truly was the best dinner we have had in Portland. No small tasting plates. Well prepared food. Lovely presentation   We met the owner. Everything done with care and love. Go. You will mot be disappointed.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I'd been meaning to get here for a long while. Ever since I moved to Portland years ago really. Yet I never seemed to find the time. Always somewhere else to try. Always something else to do. Why place a college dive bar anywhere near the top of my list? And so, the years flew by. 

Today however, I gave it a try. I know one of the bartenders and have been promising to come try for a while. So as we waited for my bike at cyclemania, my wife suggested today as the day. I agreed. Now sadly my bartender friend wasn't working, but it was still an awesome time!

We got there right at opening. Got seated right away, and ordered a drink. I tried one of the many beers on tap, and my wife had the one cider on tap. Kids had water and lemonade. My beer was delicious, is was the RFR, and the cider was also very good. Lemonade our daughter said was really good. So, drinks, check.

Next came the order. There is an EXTENSIVE menu. The bartender I knew recommended the wings, but I'd heard a lot about the cheese fries. So, I ordered chili cheese fries, my wife got the loaded pulled pork nachos, the oldest chose a bacon cheeseburger and the baby got some chicken nuggets. So... the food was ALMOST perfect.

The burger was awesome. Well cooked and very flavorful. The chili fries were amazing. Deliciously meaty and cheesy and sublime when dipped in sour cream. The highlight was the nachos however, or I should say the pulled pork. Do yourself a favor and get everything covered in this pulled pork. So. Friggin. Good. Like addictively good. It's been a couple hours and I'm still thinking about how good it was. 

The only disappointment was the kids chicken nuggets. It was clearly frozen chicken nuggets, like the ones you get at hannaford, and a few fries. I mean, it's ok by the standards of a 15 month old, but the waitress said they were amazing, and that she ordered them all the time. Just, seeing how good and freshly made everything else was, this $8 nuggets and fries was a huge let down. 

The service was awesome. The waitress was attentive but not overly hovering. Which how slow it was, I am sure it was hard not to hover over her only table. She was there when she needed to be, and not when she didn't. 

The restaurant itself is super cool. A hodgepodge of wall signs, photos, news clippings, beer signs, etc. there is is something to look at everywhere you turn. Provided quite a bit of entertainment while we waited for the food. Which wasn't long at all. Only about 8 minutes. Legit. Not exaggerating. If you're in a hurry, this is a place to come. 

Bathrooms, cause it's important, seemed clean and well kept. You can't underestimate the benefit of a clean bathroom. Especially with kids. 

Finally, cost. Cost us $60 for our meal. The only thing we thought was overpriced was the chicken nuggets. Not worth it, don't order it. Aside from that everything matched its value quite well. 

We are excited to go back and try some more menu items, all with pulled pork of course, and some more of the tap specials. I am sad I waited so long to come here. It was delicious and awesome. Very family friendly and fun.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I love burgers.  Burgers and fries.

I am done ordering burgers from here and that means I may never come back.
The burgers are a nice large size which is helpful since I have to cut the whole black and charred bottom off of every single burger I have received.
Hey cook! That means your griddle is too hot!
My friend who has lived in Portland his whole life told me that the only reason to go to The Great Lost Bear is to get the nachos... so there you have it.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Visiting from out of state, met a friend here for lunch.

Great beer selection - 

Got a full order of the dirty wings. Delicious.

Would go back again!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Family early dinner before the Jeff Dunham show. My daughter and her boyfriend, who has never been to the Bear, enjoyed a wonderful fantastic meal. The Canadian Burger I ordered was delicious and it came with fries. My wife ordered the Open Face Haddock sandwich and she loved it, devouring it all. My daughter decided to get the Lewiston Steak and Cheese. She loved it and I am going to love it too.  It was quite large and she doesn"t eat leftovers so it is lunch for me tomorrow. The big hit of the evening was the Mother & Child Reunion. It was a fried piece of chicken, loaded with cheese with a fried egg on top. Hey, is there something wrong with that, an egg on a chicken sandwich! We all agreed that the bread on all the sandwiches was soft, gooey and delightful. My family and I will definitely come back and perhaps we will order desert first.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Overall, my experience here was not as great as I had hoped it would be. I had heard about Great Lost Bear before and was told it was a must visit while in Portland. We went on a Monday night, so there weren't too many people there. The bar area was huge and they have many great beers on tap, which was a plus. The food was just average. I ordered the angry bird sandwich, which was a bit deceiving from the menu. It was super spicy, and I can normally handle spicy foods! My husband's burger was massive, but soggy and falling all over the place. All in all, a good bar spot at best.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Excellent selection of craft beers with over 80 beers on draft. The Rodeo Burger was delicious and cooked to perfect however assembled very poorly and made for some excessively messy eating. Certainly not the place to watch a game as it has one television in the back. All in all, a very good pub and a great place to go with a group of your closest friends.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: The people that work here are the best reason why they are five star. I've been coming here since I was a child I could brag about the restaurant but the only reason you need to know are the employees are great.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Split a pulled pork sandwich-flavor was just right. Love the "Chip Fries!" 
My dads Fish and Chips was over cooked, hence the four stars but..the environment in Great Lost Bear was just right. Throughly air conditioned for a humid Maine Summers day. Love the decor and free WiFi.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
The Great Lost Bear has an extensive menu which I can appreciate!  I'm a picky eater surrounded by friends, family & a boyfriend who will eat ANYTHING.  They have items anywhere from your traditional cheeseburger to burritos to haddock and tuna sandwiches to BLT's etc!  I've always been a fan of their veggie chili and the Mac & cheese!  So good!  

Last night I tried the Ensalada bowl with an edible bowl - it was pretty good.  Lacked chili which would have made it taste better - I liked that they added spinach into the mix of greens.  The bowl it came in - not so good... I thought it was overly fried or baked or however they made it.

Not only is the food menu extensive, but the beer list has such diversity with so much to offer!  IPAs, lagers, white and wheat beers and a few different mixed drinks and wines as well.  

I will recommend something on the dessert menu - the big Mason jar filled with a chocolate brownie-cake thing and ice cream and fudge and nuts!! Yum!  Usually too much for one person but it would be perfect split between two!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This is such a gem in Portland. First of all, the beer selection is simply outstanding... second, this place has mastered comfort food. The fact that I force myself to make the 10 min walk here instead of driving allows me to avoid any guilt in ordering something like their pulled pork Mac and cheese, any of their nachos, wings or a delicious sandwich. My personal sandwich favorites (so far) are the Rachel and Kansas City cheesesteak. The menu will most definitely have something for everyone, even the vegetarian or health-conscious. And on top of all that, the environment here is just so fun. The decor is extremely interesting and unique, and you always have something new to look at.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This restaurant has too many items on the menu... from my personal belief, when you have too many things going on, you can't focus on making every single item good. They just all have to be... edible. I got a pulled chicken burrito served in a rolled flour tortilla. Salsa and pico de gallo were questionable to my taste buds.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
The Great Lost Bear is one of those places that truly embodies Portland's aesthetic. A little bit hipster. A little bit rustic. A whole lotta beer. 

The thing that is great about the Great Lost Bear is that there is something for everyone. With their extensive list of beers/ciders/meads on tap (that are consistently changing, our waitress said they change their beer list every two days!) and their never-ending menu, there is something to please everyone. The beer menu never shows the exact price of the beer, but they have nightly specials for their beer on tap, so be sure to check that out!

As far as the food, it is good. Nothing spectacular as others have noted. The other night I ordered the Rodeo Burger, and it was decent, but nothing I would specifically return for to get again. However, the nachos are incredibly good. Like so good that I dream about them. I particularly like the pulled pork supreme nachos but any nachos you get will be amazing. So do it up.

Reading through some of the other reviews, I noticed a lot of people take note on the service. Honestly, each time I have gone to the Great Lost Bear, the service has been great. The staff has been incredibly generous and attentive each time. I don't know if they have upped their service game, but I haven't experienced lackluster service. 

Definitely some place to check out if you are showing someone around Portland, or you are just meeting up with some friends for drinks and a bite to eat!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I absolutely love this place.  The food is amazing!  I've always got to get the fried veggies and the wings.  I love that all of their dressings are house made.  The ranch and blue cheese are delicious and makes me want to buy a jar of each one.  
They have an amazing beer selection as well, so you can find something you will enjoy.
The outside area is great in the summer/warm days.  
If you haven't been here you must try it out, or else you're missing out on some delicious food!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
This place was recommended to me for a place for craft beer lovers with a family. The Great Lost Bear was perfect. The food was amazing. I got the Almighty Cheesus Burger with egg and bacon. It and the fries were amazing. Our kids got the nuggets and fries. The quality and quantity were awesome. The beer selection is amazing. Our server was great. We left very happy.

Very family friendly!!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
If I order vegetarian, it doesn't mean I hate food.

I came here for the first time...And likely the last time. Passing by so much and hearing people talk about it has made it seem like one of those local things that I need to hit up, but now that I have, it's not a place I would recommend. 

We came here for the variety that makes it a good place for a diverse group of food eaters, but I should have been warned, a place with no specialties is probably a place I should avoid.

I ordered a veggie burger and others ordered cheesesteaks, burritos, fajitas, fish and chips...Theres a lot of variety. The food came out fairly quick but the first thing I notice was the burnt patty on my plate. It was probably 10% burnt on the surface. To me, that tells me its a patty made with low quality ingredients. I took one bite and another pity bite, and couldn't eat anymore. The patty had 0 flavor, tasted like mashed rice and beans, and it was not seasoned, juicy, or anywhere near edible. I have eaten a lot of crappy things, but having ordered a plate that was gonna cost $11 couldn't even force me to eat it. The fries looked promising, but holy cow they don't have salt or anything back in that kitchen of theirs...It tasted like parboiled potatoes. The batter was done nicely though and I could eat them with the S&P, but again...I feel I got ripped off with $11 fries.

The others in my group seemed to enjoy their meals...The cheesesteak was dry but the other food seemed fine.

Service was actually pretty good and our waitress was quite attentive. It does seem like this place is known for being a good drinking place, but thats not a relevant reason for me to ever come back either.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
As a former Philadelphian, don't be fooled--the Philly cheesesteak isn't a "regular wit whiz" as we say. It IS a tasty combination of meat, onions, peppers, and a really unique cheese sauce--like not a runny, oily cheese sauce, not a processed cheese spread, but a homemade thick creamy sauce with a little tang. So that was new and delightful, but not the greasy meaty treat I pictured. That said, I would order it again--just don't expect it to compare to Pat's, Geno's, or Dalessandro's. Consider it a "gourmet steak sandwich" more than a Philly cheesesteak. 

Did I mention the cheese fries?! They cut these huge swaths of potatoes and fry them. Then smoother them in real cheese, not processed cheese goo. They aren't cut like steak fries, more like medallions of tater. Heaven. Delectable. 

My pals got the boneless wings, half order. I cannot imagine one human consuming a full order. Seriously. And I can eat a whole pizza myself. I mean, these seriously are flattened whole breast cutlets, fried and sauced. Ridiculous serving sizes. And tasty to boot! (see photo, sorry for the bad lighting)

I saw the mac-and-cheese but it was gone before I got to sample it. I think the speed with which my compatriots ate it attests to its caliber. 

The waitstaff we had was a young woman who honestly felt like a friend by the end of taking our order. Genuine, funny, a little sassy, and fast at service. Kudos to GLB for hiring awesome servers!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I would give this place another half star cuz the beer selection is great. Our server seemed stanoffish at first but turned out to be great they were pretty busy but we didn't wait for anything she was efficient and just the right amount of attentiveness.  The Buffalo Cauliflower was great! A special sweetness about the Buffalo Sauce! Chicken Nachos were great too with nice fresh crispy peppers and onions and a ton of broiled crispy cheese. So 2 for 2 on excellent apps...Then our meals came and were just OK. I like the idea of the fries but as someone else mentioned pass the Salt??? I also love the atmosphere with one exception...Turn the lights on and Clean the friggen  place! By no means do I need a pristine place but the pictures are dirty. As a passer by we will probably try some place different next time through.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I feel like I break up and get back together with GLB each year. I decide to give it another chance, I'll have a good experience, then go back a second time and remember why I had sworn it off so many times before... and thus the cycle continues. Sounds dramatic, but people want to love a neighborhood staple like this. Unfortunately, the food and service can totally ruin the location and vibe. They definitely have lots of food options, their menu is huge. Some things are great some not so much. If you keep your expectations low, you'll never be disappointed here. I often suggest sitting at the bar, here I suggest sitting at a table. Usually friendlier/quicker service at a table.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
We rolled into town an hour or so before our friend finished up his work day so we headed down the road a bit to the Great Lost Bear for a beer.

They have a bunch of interesting beers on tap. After studying the beer list we made our selections -- which we thoroughly enjoyed.

The bar tender was super friendly and provided us with some bumper stickers, a beer list and to-go menu when she learned we were out of state visitors on our first trip to Portland. The gentlemen sitting next to me observed this and struck up a friendly conversation as well.

We didn't get to try the food since dinner would be served at our friend's house that evening, but I'd certainly give lunch or dinner a try the next time I'm in town.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Delicious pub food with a ridiculous beer list.

To be honest, the amount of trinkets on the walls, the lengthy menu, and the way our table was uncomfortably situated, made The Great Lost Bear a rather overwhelming and anxiety-inducing experience.

Fortunately, after putting our order in and getting a few beers, we were good. And the food being tasty also helped. We got the Bacon Cheese Fries to start since we were all starving and wanted some fried goodness to accompany our beers. It's pretty standard, i.e. fried potatoes, cheese, and bacon - hard to mess up.

I ended up ordering the Fried Haddock Roll Up with a side salad (y'know, balance), and it turned out to be pretty good. Everyone else also seemed to enjoy their meals. More importantly, they ordered theirs with fries and the cheese sauce on the side. The cheese sauce. Holy moly. Get the cheese sauce.

The Great Lost Bear is simply a casual, fun restaurant that you can just chill in with your friends over good beers and pub grub. Worth the visit if that's what you're looking for.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I've been here a number of times since my last review and have still never been disappointed. Last Saturday night we waited over and hour for a table, never seen them that slammed before but no big deal. Once the food came the waiter realized he had forgotten to put my order in. I was frustrated at first but he came back and told me they rushed the order and only charged for my beer!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Very unique restaurant which is filled with old kitsch. The menu is overwhelming with all the options for burgers, wings, salads, veggie options, etc etc etc. I got the taco salad which come in a fresh tortilla shell, Romain lettuce, guacamole, vegan chili, salsa and cheese. I don't recall a dressing but it didn't need one. Can't wait to go back and try some more.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I'm here visiting from New York and my sister had recommended The Great Lost Bear and I'm so glad she did because I cannot stop talking about the Sweet Thai Chili Chicken Sandwich. I was nervous when ordering it since I don't usually go out of my comfort zone, but wow, I'm so glad I did!! So good! Our waitress, Norma was an angel. Made the experience that much better!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great hearty food with decent portions, lively atmosphere and friendly service. Really good food selection. Between the three of us we had a cheeseburger, a pork burrito and the vegetable tempura wrap, all with fries. No complaints!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Love love love the wings !!!! Highly recommend both the dirty wings and the pb&j wings !!! So good and both are so crisp. We also tried the nacho, which you get a giant serving of- we barely put a dent in. The spanakopita, was good but I've had better. The Mac n cheese, also really good. But let me emphasize how good the wings were again, we went back a second day in a row to get more and got the same flavors... get them !!!! Also, they have a good beer selection! I love being able to get beer flights and sample them first!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
So I have the biggest love/hate relationship with this place. Each visit is unique in you never know what you are going to get food wise, server wise and time wise. I have been here and had someone take my beer and food order almost immediately, and have also been here and sat very impatiently for 20 minutes before someone even bats an eye let alone takes my order. Extremely hit or miss. I will say that the servers are all very nice and friendly. No one has ever been rude that has waited on me. If you belly up to the bar, you will get the best service in my opinion.
Overall, the Bear has a lot of fantastic qualities starting with their amazing, ever changing, lengthy beer list featuring a wide variety of styles, flavors and origins. 
The menu is decent with an overwhelming number of choices in all categories, but you can always find something you want or are craving. 
I find one thing that is fairly consistent is the deliciousness of their Thai Peanut veggie burger or tempura veggie roll up and the amount of vegetarian dishes they offer.
My favorite app is the teriyaki grilled mushrooms-they have a nice crispy, grilled outside, but are soft and tasty inside. My husband who loathes most things mushroom even enjoys them. His favorite meal to get here is any of their burgers or cheesesteak sandwiches. 
As I mentioned, these are some of the things that make the Bear one of my favorite places. If you can get over the inconsistencies with service and time you may have to spend waiting- it is a local gem that does not involve a trip into the old port or downtown area.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I've thought about this a bit more and I'm upping my review to 3 stars based on how solid the food is - though I do hope they can improve their service without sacrificing the fun vibes.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I've visited the GLB many times over the years and gave it another shot today. The beer list deserves a 5 star, but the food is more of a 2-3 star. There was nothing wrong with my burger, but it also wasn't great. Not a lot of flavor, too many big pieces of onion made it very difficult and messy to eat. The baked beans are yummy! It's quite dark in here restaurant, with lots of "stuff" on the walls. I felt like I was coming out of hibernation when I left and was able to see the light of day.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Do not recommend 
Wish I could recommend this place but I just can't. I thought with the cool vibe and the wide menu selection (and great reviews) that we would be pleased. The food - okay. Good enough that I would have been willing to try it again. But man...MAN...is the customer service terrible. Uninterested or extremely wait staff are the reason I won't be returning. Is the food okay? Sure. Is the service good? Nope. Is this place in a convenient location? Nope! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere more centrally located - this place certainly isn't worth the extra drive time.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I just love this place! The atmosphere, food and beer selection, which has many local craft beers, are awesome! 
Years ago, when my son attended college in Portland, we would go to visit him about once a month; he always suggested the Great Lost Bear for lunch, "Dad, the place is great with the best food and brews!"

My wife and I recently met him there for lunch, I couldn't wait to sink my chops into their Bacon with Swiss Cheese burger! I was also looking forward to ordering a 'Flight of five Allagash local brews!'

For starters we ordered The Terriyaki Mushrooms with dipping sauce', the portion is very generous and the taste is outstanding!

I ordered the Bacon Burger with Swiss Cheese, minus the bread, and a salad. Again, delicious!

With my lunch I ordered a Five Flight of Allagash beers. I felt like a kid in a candy shop when our server brought those over! It had been hot outside and I was thirsty, so that may have added to the excellent taste of each one of those offerings, but man, it was like a 'nectar of the gods' going down my parched throat!


If you go, try the Five Flight of Allagash Beers!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Had dinner here with my wife, it was okay, the food was average, nothing to rave about, atmosphere was pretty cool, Its not a bad spot to grab lunch at or have a beer at the bar...

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
If you can maneuver your way through this nightmare of a parking lot and find your way into the dark abyss that is GLB, you're in for a good time.

Great Lost Bear is the local spot for big portions, plentiful beer selections, and a watering hole for friend meet-ups.
Get their Portobello mushroom burger (the best I've had, period), and peruse their plethora of whiskey options. Sit outside on the cute patio for an authentic picnic feeling meal, or sit at the bar and people-watch the ever-busy GLB.

The only thing here is that it seems grungy. I wish I could just empty it out, GIVE IT A SCRUB, and put in some cleaner items. I always feel like I should wash my hands during and after I visit.

That being said, once my hands are sparkling clean, I enjoy digging in to the heartiest and most caloric meals in Portland. Rally up your friends, take an UberXL, and enjoy this joint.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Food is just "meh". They should really cut the menu in half and focus on quality. Even the beers they are famous for are wrong. I ordered a flight and the got 3 of the 5 beers either in the wrong order, or wrong completely. Not worth the :45 min wait on a Saturday. Sorry, I REALLY wanted to like this place.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Thank you Theresa (the manager)for hearing our story down memory lane! We loved telling our story how we were married at The Great Lost Bear 7 years ago!!! Super service Jason, thank you for you kindness and professionalism. We loved the food; generous portions and great quality Loved the beer selection. Atmosphere just fun!!!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great beer selection. We both had burgers - French fries were super tasty and different !! Good vibes - would 100% go back

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Ugh, no!  Food is not good & service is even worse.  We sat outside on the deck and our server, Jason, was so bad that I had to go to the bar and order a drink.  He never cleared our dirty dishes, so gross.  It was not busy, so that was not the reason.  He was just inattentive & uninterested in being a good server.  I got a grilled chicken cesar salad and the chicken was so over cooked that it was actually hard around the edges.  Awful.  The sangria was good though.  I've been one other time & was not happy, will not go back.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: BEST chili ever. Large beer menu. Friendly staff everytime. Unique menu items. Some of their burgers are a bit boring, but I've gotten their chili a bunch of times, and the open faced tuna sandwich was was reeeeally good. Love their fries too!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: August 2017. Came here after a day of brewery hoping to celebrate a friends bday. No reservations but go in since it was only about 5 pm. We sat in the way back on a nice big table. There was six of us and very hungry so we were excited to try this new restaurant. I had a key lime pie martini which was good. Basic but good. My friend had a chocolate martini like drink but she was given another drink by mistake. She ordered a salted chocolate pretzel martini when noticed there was no salt. After waiter but salt on rim she realized was wrong drink. Tasty but wrong drink. My husband ordered a beer. Make that four beers because every beer was sold out so he ended up with the fourth on his list. The waiter said, "oh well you know Saturday night haha." Its 5:00 not 9:00 man. No excuse. For a super crowded parking lot you think this place was good to go to. We then ordered food. We shared a order of peanut Thai chicken wings. Seemed very much like they were covered in peanut butter. Bad decision. I ordered the spinach feta pie which was okay. Husband got a steak and cheese but not impressed. My friend ordered a healthy open faced sandwich but it was the wrong order again. Plus when she mentioned it the waiter said he would take half off the price which he didn't. The three other friends liked their burgers and crab sandwich but the rest not so much. We drove a long ways for good Maine food and this was not good Maine good or beer. Won't be back.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
If you are looking for a restaurant with an extensive beer selection, then look no further than the Great Lost Bear. This place has a great selection of beers on tap!

I have come to the Great Lost Bear several times now. This place is great if you are looking for a pubby place where you can relax, have a drink, eat some food, and not worry about noise level or having to leave right after finishing your meal.

The food here is pretty average. Everything that I have had has been decent, but nothing has ever been OMG delicious. The menus is VERY extensive, which sometimes cautions me given that it requires so many ingredients for the kitchen to have and may not be changed out frequently. However, given the popularity of this place and how many people they have coming in and out, I think it is okay.

Most recently I ordered the blackened pepper chicken wrap which was pretty tasty. The portions here are pretty good and the prices are also fairly reasonable.

We also got an order of the pulled pork super nachos which were actually really good. I have had the nachos a couple times here and they have always been the best part of my meal.

I highly recommend coming to the Great Lost Bear if you have a big group of people and are just looking to have a fun night. The staff here is very accommodating and does a great job of accommodating larger groups when needed.

The bar is also a great hang out place to just have some drinks if that is all you are looking to do!

After all, it is meant to be a pub and not some fine dining place and based on their service, prices and atmosphere, I think that they do a great job of properly servicing their clientele.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: One of my favorite little spots. My boyfriend and I had our first date here and we come back every year on our anniversary to get beer flights and celebrate! The beer selection is large and always changing and we always find a new beer (or three or four) to sample when we visit. Really good vegetarian selection as well!!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Went their for lunch with fiancee and gradnparents had good veggan option they all got Mack and cheese I got veg wrap with penut sauce it was gr8 and beer was gr8 gr8 service definitly reccomend but a man looked at me in the bathroom was weird also had to poop and stomach ache right aftwr but still good and reccomend!!! Also no parking!!!!!! available today

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Was just in town for a weekend away and found out a friend from home was also there. He looooooves GLB and invited us to meet him and his relatives out. One look at Yelp led us to believe we were in for a treat but I gotta say, I wasn't as smitten as most reviewers. 

The parking lot is a nightmare but whatever, it's a hazard of city life so I am not deducting stars for it - just know it when you go. 

We were seated quickly despite the huge crowd and instantly excited for the beer list. The food menu is expansive and so it was tough to decide on what to get but I settled on a wrap - never a bad choice when enjoying a few beers. The sandwich was okay, no great shakes.

While the food and beer were okay, the state of the restaurant itself was a massive turn off. It was DIRTY. Sticky tables, nasty floors, and a bathroom that was growing some sort of biological weapon. Absolutely gross. I don't care how busy you are, regular cleaning HAS to be a part of a restaurant's daily schedule. Eiuw. So gross. I definitely won't go back and would recommend that others be prepared.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I've lived in Maine for 40 years and the GLB has been open for nearly that long. I've been here too many times to count, but this is my first Yelp review of the place. 

I was one of a party of four that ate here on a recent Thursday night. They don't take reservations, but the friendly hostess told me over the phone to expect only a short wait for my arrival time of 6:00 pm. She was right; we were seated within 10 minutes. A waitress quickly appeared and took our drink orders. 

GLB is well known for its superb beer list which focuses on beers brewed in Maine. I chose Bissell Bros. The Substance, an IPA. It was served very cold and tasted great. One of our party had the Allagash White, which he loved. 

GLB has a large menu of casual appetizers and entrees. Think burgers, hot and cold sandwiches, chili, nachos, etc. This is not fine dining! I had the fish and chips. I'm not a fan of their bear fries, but the haddock was nicely done, tender and moist, with a very crunchy crust that had very little oil residue. The serving size was very generous; I took some home. My companions had salads, grilled portobellos on spinach, and buffalo chicken on a spinach salad. The waitress mistakenly brought cajun chicken on a spinach salad. When the error was pointed out she readily offered to bring the correct order. 

Everyone enjoyed their meal and took home leftovers. No complaints about the service or the quality of the food. Go for the beer but the food is quite good too.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Advertised pints are only 14 ounce glasses, 12 ounce with a short pour which is what I always get.  Enjoy!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Five star beer list balanced by 3 star food and service equate to my rating for TGLB. Many locals rave about the burgers here - I'd rate them as a safe bet but far from memorable. Extremely worth the while if you're in it for the suds though.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
For the longest time, I would always be excited to go to GLB (maybe it was the beer selection). But time after time, I was disappointed. It has never been 'bad' per se, but never as good as it should be. The cheese sauce they use on a lot of items is a prime example - it is far to grainy and floury and definitely not cheesy enough. That said, I have enjoyed a handful of meals here.

Also, the restaurant could use a very deep clean, and maybe some freshening up. Feels very grungy, but not intentionally so.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
So so great!!
They have a huge selection of beer, which has a good mixture of types of beer, local and not, so it's fun to get a flight! I even loved having my first glass of mead.
The food was good too - my vegetarian friends had a lot to choose from and my gluten free friend and I were even able to split something. 
The best part (aside from the atmosphere - so many cool things on the walls) was definitely the service. We had a big group and were not easy. We first had beers at the bar and the bartenders split all those checks, and then they sat us at a huge table and the server split checks for us again! On top of that, I left my debit card there and they mailed it to me (and I'm not even from Maine)!! 
Highly recommend this place. The food itself isn't super noteworthy, but the atmosphere, the beer, and the service is definitely worth it - especially for how cheap the food is!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great place to eat and good food.  Huge portions!  The service has always been excellent.  I highly recommend trying g the appetizer mushrooms as well ...delish!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Once a month hangout with some of my favorite friends. Sharing stories and having a few laughs. Great to sit out back. 

One friend thinks the Brats are to die for!  Two orders. 

Thursday's is a bonus. Get free tickets for various prizes. Never win. But the anticipation is worth it!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great Lost Bear is awesome, the staff is nice, they have an amazing on tap beer selection, and their menu literally has everything. I absolutely love coming here and trying new flights and appetizers. Hands down the best thing on the menu is their buffalo Mac n cheese. It will change your life. ONLY downside to this place is that their parking is pretty much a nightmare. I recommend ubering here or getting a ride.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I'm a vegan and there are some great choice of restaurants near and around Portland that have great vegan food.  However this is not one of them.  Not sure how you mess up vegan chili bc it's just like meat chili but without the meat.  This was the worst chili I've ever had.  I'd take frozen over this chili.  Disappointing.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This place has been here for years,y mother grew up going to this place.  Management completely re-did it. The establishment is huge, it's decorated with many trinkets and knick knacks which gives it a fun "kitschy", "garage chic" vibe.  The menu is HUGE, so you will never get someone complaining about the food here, there is truly something for everyone on this menu.  The restaurant is traditionally American food but there are other menu options such as tapas and curry.  Also, the portions sizes are huge which is always a plus when you get a bang for your buck.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
We had a great time at this restaurant! The hostess gave us great tips on breweries and bars to try out while we waited for our table. Our waiter, Stewart was super friendly and helpful. We had about a billion questions about beers and food and he patiently answered all of them! 
The food was very delicious! I highly recommend the blueberry wheat ale!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Huge local beer selection, also a huge menu. Menu is a little overwhelming. Food we decided on was good though. Bar service was attentive. Burger was a little over cooked. Overall good place

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This place was everything I could've hoped. An amazing selection at a bar that lets you do tasters and doesn't mind a ton of questions? Good vibe for both myself and my mom? Nice, knowledgeable staff and an extensive selection of local brews? Like any mega beer fan knows, if you're in the Portland-area, this is a must stop.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Incredible beer selections. Very friendly wait staff.  Very good food. Definitely will be back.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I love the Great Lost Bear for what it is - but it's so inconsistent that it makes it hard to give it anything above 3 stars. But it's a Portland institution

The beer list is fantastic, as most people know. 70 beers on tap! The cider list is meh, but that's okay - they focus on the beer anyways.

The burgers and nachos are delicious, as are the wings. But don't stray too far from that. I got the Tuna Melt and it was GROSS. Just wasn't good. The service is also a little iffy - they're not trying to impress but - but sometimes they just seem mean.

Go to GLB if you're looking for good burgers and beers but don't go for the service or much else

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
So I had been craving a burger for about three days straight, and you know what happens with that- gotta scratch the itch! I ordered a bacon cheddar burger and it was cooked perfectly and everything I had been dreaming about for those three days! I paired it with a Rick's Maniac cider and it was a Match made in kinda-sorta-dive-bar-but-better heaven. 

This place is awesome! Over 80 beers on tap, good music, and friendly bartenders. It's the type of place you want to get snowed in with your friends during a Nor'easter and have yourselves a day type of place. I will be back to Get Lost!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
My most recent visit here was about 6pm on a Friday night. My husband and I brought our parents there for a meal with us and our son. (His folks were visiting from out of town.)

Despite several of my warnings, they didn't understand just how GIGANTIC the portions here are in reality. The food is of an amazing quality and for portions that could easily (well) feed 2 adults from a single plate, the prices are incredibly fair.

The menu is both varied and sizable. It accommodates gluten free (like my mother in law), lower fat/calorie concerns, vegetarians...everyone has a good range of choice. 

There is a healthy variety of drinks to indulge in as well. I believe there are both daily food AND drink specials. The staff are knowledgeable and I've never met one who wasn't happy to answer any and all questions.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Been here a few times. No matter your diet you can find something on the menu that appeals to you. Menu is ridiculously big. Great selection of beer and the run a special everyday. I went on a night where 16oz were same price as 12oz. I've ordered wings every time. They are very good, which is a lot for me to say because it's my favorite food. Service is good, very attentive when needing another beer or whatever. Very cool atmosphere, there's old posters and shit. Cool joint right outside downtown.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Dinner and drinks out with my family started with a waitress that was unfriendly and could barely be bothered to wait on our table of TEN. We got to hear about how busy she was, where else she had to be, and how many tables she had several times.  Apps were good but dinner was not. My thai chicken wrap had zero flavor,  even with two kinds of sauce on it. My fries were soggy even though I ordered them extra crispy. The spanakopita was dry and awful. But maybe the worst was the steak fajitas that were not cut AT ALL and had first sized chunks of steak in it yet were served with no knives. When we complained, offense was taken and no attempt to rectify the issue was made in any way. I have given this place ITS LAST CHANCE.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This is a fun local spot. We visit frequently. They have good food for cheap and a huge selection offering anything from burritos to burgers to Thai style veggies.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Shoutout to the handsome young man who stepped up to the podium at the front intending to get me seated about half an hour ago. 

In reality I marched my indignant self over from my office building because El Corazon had just been delivered to my workplace via 2 Dine In and they had forgotten sour cream and guacamole.

I had every intention of paying for these sides but this sweet boy came out of the kitchen a moment later and passed them off to me free of charge. He said it was the funniest thing he'd heard all day and simply asked me just to pay it forward.

While passing an older man stepping into the bank on my way back, I noticed a dollar bill skidding across the sidewalk that he had clearly just dropped from his open wallet. At first I thought I would just keep it since a dollar is so little and this man was likely more financially stable than me. Given the simple but meaningful kindness that had just been bestowed upon me however--I let go of my assumptions in these trying times and notified this gentleman of his recent loss.

Doing the right thing isn't paying it forward of course so I'll still be on the lookout for an extra way I can help return the favor but my perspective had definitely been positively influenced in a world where everyone wants something for something else.

By the way--the Great Lost Bear's steak fajitas are WAY better. Not just lip service--I mean it. I got to pick where we went for lunch on my birthday and that's what I chose. 10/10

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: This is an adorable restaurant with a lot of life! We got the buffalo fries with cheese dip on the side. So good! Nice and crunchy shockingly. I also ordered a mead and because it was the last glass they had, they gave it to me for free! Very classy of them

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
just came from the Great Lost Bear. My meal was exceptional but i ordered carefully. i'll start out with my dates complaints. he ordered jalapeno poppers & that's just gross, he kept complaining that he was sure they didn't make them there. i didn't have one, i'm not wasting calories on that.
he also had the taco salad bowl thing. that bowl thing is like, made of butter & what was going on inside looked sloppy but he mixed it all up like a pig & was sick from eating all the poppers first.
i had an open face haddock sandwich on rye, it comes with swiss cheese & that's fine but not necessary so i peeled like half of it off. since i'm weight conscious i also skipped the rye bread on the bottom. i think under the fried haddock was a combo of tartar & coleslaw, it was great.
what was really wonderful was the fried haddock. i never order that anywhere anymore cause too little fish inside vs. too much batter, not in this case. the batter wasn't aggressive & it was kind of dark. also, i swear, there may have been a little cinnamon in the batter mix. i won't forget this. on the menu i noticed that they made a big deal of how fresh & special their fried haddock for this sandwich is, that's what i mean by order carefully. so glad i took the chance.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Second time visiting here.  Food is consistently tasty and good. We had the pulled pork nachos, they were very good.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Service was a little slow. Was there for several minutes before someone finally came to the hostess station. My son's soda was flat and after 3 attempts, he settled for a glass of water. Beer was hit or miss. Food was good and waitress was very attentive.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Great beer selection and old school beer bar vibe. Solid food too. We had the haddock wrap, fajitas and wings. Wings were A+, everything else B+. Only major downside was a delay in our order, but this was only our first time there, so hard to say if that's a regular thing. 

Beer- 5
Food- 4
Service- 4 
Overall- 4ish

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
BEER, BEER, BEER, BEER, BEER
Humongous, juicy burgers
Bacon mac & cheese

~A Great Lost Bear Haiku

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
While visiting Portland, I came in with some of my family and we ended up staying almost three hours because they couldn't decide what to eat. We sat outside but our waitress was friendly enough to move us inside because it got a little chilly.
The food was good, but the extra plus was me ordering an extra large sundae, which I almost finished myself. That was pretty good too.
I would definitely come back the next time I'm in Portland.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I love the GLB!! On the appetizer menu you will find the most amazing, delectable, mouth watering, plate of cheesy greatness! The buffalo chicken mac and cheese really is the best thing ever! The rest of the menu is pretty great, too!  I have enjoyed being there with my family out for lunch just as much as when I catch a happy hour drink and bite to eat. They also have an amazing beer selection! 
Always a place I recommend to people new to the area!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: From start to finish an amazing experience! Wait time when we put our name in (a bachelorette party of 5) was about 30 min, so we got a drink at the bar and quickly got sat on the patio! The server Jason was attentive and easy going considering we were  very talkative amongst ourselves. Being from Boston myself and two other girls we interested in the local perspective and local dives and such that would suit our normal interests at home. Teresa, a hostess, was extremely accommodating and helpful putting us in the right direction. All in all, our first night in Portland after sitting in 5 hours of traffic, absolutely no joke, this was an amazing end to our stressful day!! Kudos to the management and owners for finding people who can uphold the reputation that's found its way to Boston mass!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
We've been here a half dozen times, and it's an easy call. Pretty much everybody likes it. 

My wife loves this place - because there are about a hundred things on the menu that she would be willing to eat...that is, of course, assuming that she didn't ALWAYS order the PB&J boneless wings. She says they're second only to Samuel's. 

I don't blame her. They're legit. 

Great beer selections, very relaxed environment, and mostly great food. I've had a half dozen things now; the cheesesteaks are top notch, burgers very good, fajitas decent, chicken sandwich with eggs in between grilled cheese sandwiches overwhelming, buffalo cheese fries AMAZING, and the Monte Cristo meh. 

Service is consistently okay. Parking sucks, but so does parking anywhere without a proper parking lot (there's is tiny). 

We'll keep coming back. We used to have a favorite TGI Friday's back in the day (in San Diego). This place is way cooler, but fills a similar kinda void for us.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great food, It's to bad.  Service is slow, and sitting in a Spider Web area is not acceptable.  There were webs in that area for month as we ate their in between.  Just don't look up, the food is great !  Love their wings, had to take some home.  Great place !!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Really dive-y. The floor was crooked and everything kept sliding off of our table. The food was really meh and greasy. Not worth the stop.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
The GLB.  What can I say about this place?  That I've been going here since I moved to Portland.  That I love the weird giveaways they do on Thursday.  That their endless supply of local beer on tap makes for a great night out.  That their nightly beer special is almost always a winner.  That there are certain things on the food menu that I absolutely love (like their fried chicken, nachos, or taco salad) and there are some things I will always stay away from (like anything with sprouts).

The Great Lost Bear has been a staple to almost anyone who has taken a class at USM and needs a place to relax and imbibe after an evening course.  I have written more papers and worked on more collaborative projects in the Great Lost Bear than in my home.   The Wi-Fi is the key element to making this a tried and true, post grad spot.  Sometimes the service is AMAZING, sometimes the service is ok, but overall, it doesn't really matter unless your pint glass is empty.  

I love the patio in the summer and the dark booths of the bar in the winter.  All in all, a locals standard spot for sure!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
The Great Lost Bear is a part of what I think of as "old reliable" Portland.  It was here before I got here and i've lived here for 25 years!  It is often crowded and noisy and parking is sometimes ridiculously difficult to find, yet there are certain times in life when only the "Bear" will do...
1.  You have a bunch of relatives coming in from out of town and you want to take them somewhere they will like, but won't break the bank.  Sit in the dining room.
2.  You want to have a completely private conversation with some friends and order some BBQ chicken nachos.  SIt in a booth along the back wall of the bar.
3.  Dammit!  You want to get out of the house with your toddler and order a burger and a beer without disturbing the other diners.  SIt in the dining room.
4.  You just really want a giant order of loaded nachos and a flight of 4 different beers.  Again, try to grab a booth along the back wall of the bar.
5.  You happen to be a person who loves french fries cut in the shape of oval disks and homemade cheese sauce on your burger.  Sit anywhere.
6.  You like to try a lot of different local beers and maybe meet a new friend.  The bar.

In my experience the service in the bar area is consistently friendlier and more attentive than in the regular dining rooms.  The Great Lost Bear is overall, a fun, local dining experience that quite frankly works for all ages.  Dress is casual and the price point is reasonable.  If you are in town looking for a place outside of the Old Port, definitely check them out!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Good food, great ambience! Glad I finally checked this place out. Only complaint from our visit is I wish they didn't serve water with straws in them. A waste when most people can sip from a glass!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Our waitress was a sweetheart and the food portions were very big. I got the veggie fajita and Im very satisfied

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
I loved going here when I was younger. Last night, we went with another couple to have dinner.  

Had Mac and cheese which was good, just not bit by the time it was served. My wife had fish n chips which were ok. 

I also got boneless chicken wings which seemed to be over cooked if not burnt. 

Overall it's OK.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great place to hang out! I had the fish n chips and they were battered very well. The selection of beer on tap was huge as well. I would definitely go again!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: If you have lived in Portland for more than 10 minutes, you've likely been here but I'll review anyways. GLB is a great meeting place. Lots of seating, amazing food, and the beer selection is diverse. One of the only places to consistently enjoy some local brews like Bissell.
