My favorite is a chicken Caesar wrap made special with fries. The chicken is so delicious, not like most places that use frozen processed chicken with pained on grill marks. The staff are always friendly and accommodating to my off menu request. Since I rediscovered, I go about twice a month and am never disappointed.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
They have an extensive menu with numerous vegan/ vegetarian options.  We got tthe fried vegetables which were very tasty.  Someone in my party got the BBQ Mess in the mason jar.  It was so tasty she said she would order it again.
 The staff were very friendly and attentive.  Would recommend this restaurant highly.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: I've been going to the GLB for years it's where my wife and I have our anniversary dinner every year. It's the best, there's an option for everyone. Top choices Veggie chili nachos, anything buffalo and anything Thai.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
1 hour wait. An hour wait for food. Including a kids grilled cheese (we asked to be put in ASAP) never brought my child a drink. Never checked on table. My burger was burnt when I asked for Med. 

My husband had haddock which was amazing and the buffalo fries were good too! 

Family before us waited 1.5 and dinner didn't come for over an hour for them too.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
An absolute must for anyone living in/visiting Portland. Took my family there for beer and burgers and I've been thinking about it ever since. The hamburgers are amazingly tasty. Highly recommend the bacon cheeseburger. 

Burgers have a remarkable chargrilled taste and somehow- I know this won't sound believable- actually came out a perfect medium temperature. Anyone who orders hamburgers knows how uncommon it is to get the temp you ask for. 

They also have about 80 taps, all of which are brewed in Maine unless otherwise denoted. Great selection. Can't go wrong with Allagash or Maine brewing company. 

Service is also excellent, quick, and friendly. We traveled from Ohio but I hope I'll be able to return sometime.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Absolutely amazing! My cousin, brother, and I stopped by the night before my cousin flew home to California and fell in love with the place! 

As soon as we stepped in we were greeted with big open arms and got sat in about 10 minutes. (They were pretty busy). It was a little cramped, dark, and loud, but it made the restraint feel so grown up. Ya know?? 

Our waitress was supppper nice and got our food out really fast! I forgot what kind of burger I had but it had chili and a fried egg on top. It was so good! I will definitely be coming back here again. This is my new place to get burgers!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great neighborhood restaurant with an extensive beer selection. Unique menu and fun decor.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: If you're looking for somewhere with a parking lot, huge beer selection, and delicious food look no further. They're wings are great, friends veggies are yummm. And they're beer is awesome. Atmosphere is great. Definitely a favorite for Portland locals.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: this place was absolutely amazing!! not the quickest service, but the food was certainly worth the wait. the atmosphere was also really unique- definitely a must in Portland!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: A Trader Joe's clerk suggested we eat here and so glad she did. Wide selection of beer, enjoyed the locals brews (Shipwreck, Alagash) and the food menu is massive. I had the haddock open faced sandwich, which was a generous crispy fried portion atop of cole slaw, tarter sauce and sliced tomato on a rye slice of bread, served with a side of cole slaw. The hubby had the bacon cheddar burger and the kiddos had the Mac-n-cheese. We. Split the buffalo wings appetizer, large wings generously coated with spicy sauce and served with bleu cheese dressing. Our server was on point, friendly and made brew suggestions. Great place to enjoy some good grub.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: Great food and beer selection. This place has the usual pub fare and then some. Always been a great place to eat. Only downside is parking and if you order a side salad instead of fries with a burger it's super small, but I can't dock points because the beer is so fabulous and the food is too.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: What a great time my husband and I had at this fun place. Our food was so delicious.I had a tai wrap and my husband enjoyed a burrito. A wonderful shout out to Andrea our sever. She certainly  seems to love her job and her customers.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Here'a the breakdown:

Beer: check. They got it all. 

Food: check. The menu offers everything but the Kitchen sink.

Service: no complaints

Atmosphere: Great. Good for families.

Price: def reasonable for what you get.

Any negatives? Well I suppose you could note the parking can be bitch but honestly parking is a bitch at every single place in the city of portland

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
Been a fan ever since I was a little kid. My dad & his friends refer to this as their "Portland office", and growing up I'd accompany him here often enough, he's been coming here since the 70's. 

Over the years it's turned into more than just a great place to get a beer - their food is amazing. I'd suggest trying their cheese steak's & their dirty bird wings. Salads are huge. Their mason jar dishes are incredible - both the cake & the BBQ hot mess, just watch your waist size because they are addictive.

This is by far my favorite pub in the US, second to none. I've lived all over, travelled a lot & I have yet to find a place that nails every aspect of what I enjoy. I'd give it 6 stars if I could.

You can not find a better selection of beer at a bar anywhere in Maine. Constantly rotates.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
This is a good lunch spot. And the 3 rating isn't an implication that this is a bad place, it good. It's just kind of  local place to refuel. It's  nothing fancy,  and nothing for a foodie. You're not trying to impress anyone. Ask yourself:  Have you at least been in a relationship with the girl you met on Twitter for a minimum of one year? Bring her here. Or maybe you're a hangry girl and you just want to stay in your sweatpants all day.  Here.

...Or if your boyfriend just arrives in town and he still makes you slightly nervous so you kind of want a drink at lunch,  here again. You know, just hypothetically speaking, of course.  

What's great here is that no one gives a shit, workers or patrons.  No one is dolled up; no human being visiting here needs access to a mirror to feel comfortable.  It's dimly lit, so who gives a f***? No one is particularly friendly or personable. The waitress didn't tell us her name, but I'd say her name tag would probably say "Ain't nobody got time for dat"  if she had one. She had no time to wait for answers, you either asked her directly for something, or she was on the move. Often times she kept walking as others would ask her for things. She seems like someone who would literally bark at someone who wasn't moving on a moving walk way, so in that light,  I can appreciate her.

Anyway, It's a cool kind of seedy place. You can pay with bitcoin and everyone looks like they drove in from the mountains. There is a voodoo feeling of weirdness all around. You might actually want to buy a station wagon with wood panels by the time you're done your meal. And you'd have to imagine that at any given time,  at least one wanted person from a murder case 20+ years ago is dining here. Cold case a la mode vibe.

 ...But you get your food, it's filling, and you can enjoy that no one gives a shit. The menu is big. The people watching is amazing. Your whole experience is enjoyed without a single f*** given.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text:
They accommodated the shifting needs of my large group with so much grace. We made a couple unusual requests that they handled in a way that made me feel at ease and respected; above and beyond. 

"We got you" they said. And they had our back.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: On the evening before Thanksgiving I had the pleasure of returning to The Great Lost Bear which is a restaurant I have patronized for many years.  We had two servers this evening whose names are Randy and Dave.  Apparently they work as a team every Wednesday night.  Randy has worked at the GLB for about twenty years and Dave told us he's been there for about half as long as Randy.  Both of these guys are knowledgeable about every item on the menu; they are personable and charismatic and it was a joy to be served by these two gentlemen.  Our dinner was delicious and served promptly.  We asked Randy a lot of questions about the various beers GLB has on tap and he totally knows what he is talking about.  In fact he let us sample a few different selections of interest and took the time to guide us in choosing several different craft beers, which was both informative and f-u-n.  Portland has a plethora of restaurants; some are old and many are new.  Yet, what I love about the GLB is how they've preserved the integrity of the venue; the ephemera on the walls is second to none and one of the many reasons that gives the GLB character.  The Great Lost Bear will remain my "go to" restaurant whenever I am back in Portland and has my highest endorsement.  Hats off to Randy and Dave for the passion you both display in serving the public!

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: We found this using Yelp. Oh was it awesome. Split the fish and chips and had left overs. The ambiance of the place was very enjoyable.

name: the-great-lost-bear
review_text: We both ordered burgers and they advertise Certified Angus Beef and deliver a delicious burger. The roll was a bulky roll but it was like a mix of brioche and Kaiser. My cheeseburger was plain, just cheese and beef cooked medium but I enjoyed the white American cheese and you could tell they actually use Certified Angus Beef and not just claim that they doThe Portobello burger was the same way just topped with a nicely grilled cap. The fries were sliced rounds but good. We didn't have any drinks but they had lots of specials on the board. Atmosphere was chill and laid back and a good mix of both bar patrons and families dining. I dig the paper straws too, it shows they care about sea turtles and dumping plastic. They also have a kitchen open late on Sunday which is nice when your flight gets delayed. 5 Star!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
What a great experience! Tom, the door man, when I left literally gave me the shirt off his back! They didn't have any t-shirts to sell me, so he insisted ....

Great conversation with locals and the dirt buffalo wings were great. Thanks to Jeff for the good drinks!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
While we were in Portland; my need for great Italian didn't stop. We accidentally went downstairs and this place looked great. They sent us upstairs as there wasn't a seat to be had and we also had reservations.
Upstairs was a bit more open floor. The waiter informed us of their "Sunday $10.00 bottle of wine deal." How could one say no????
Eggplant parm and chicken palm were fantastic and the Gorgonzola past was also a hit. What a great place! Oh we also heard about downstairs being the depiction of a speak easy. Might need another visit.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
After a long drive and working all day sometimes all you want is to sit down, relax, watch TV, eat good food and be with "regular" people.  Tomaso's connected on all of those for me.

I had the dirty wings which were outstanding, Citizen cider which never disappoints and one of the locals bought be an outstanding glass of Old Forester Bourbon which was a perfect night cap for a long day of work.

This five star rating isn't because the ambience was spectacular or the linens were pressed perfectly or because the presentation was superb. This five star reading is because Tommaso's is a place I had never been to before yet felt like a place I had been going to my entire life.  The help was great, the wings tasty and the locals welcoming.

Well done!  I'll be back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: My son-in-law was intrigued by the look of Tomaso's Canteen when we were walking by and none of us could think of a reason not to stop into this dive bar.  So glad we did. Fairly small, but we were able to snag a table. Lots of very happy locals enjoying libations and music from the juke box.  We were delighted to see that they had Maine Beer Co.'s elusive Dinner on draft and we each ordered one. We shared Brussels Sprout and Wings and were impressed. Maybe was the best stop of our weekend in Maine.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
My new favorite bar in Portland. Came here over the summer on a whim with a group of friends but we were not hungry so we didn't eat. But I fell in love with their atmosphere and beer list that it has now become a go to when I am in the area. Their beer selection is incredible. They have so many cans from craft breweries and always an awesome local draft list. 

The last time I visited I ordered food and they had great chicken wings. The place has a steady stream of people on a Friday night but we were able to grab a table for four by chance. The server was nice and always was there when we were ready for another round.

Overall, their beer is worth stopping here for anyone who wants lots and lots of options of what to drink. I will definitely keep coming back!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Simple yet sinfully good. Everything is made to order tastes homemade nothing fancy but all very tasty. 
The staff is pretty cool here they speak their minds and make me smile. I tried coming here a couple of times and couldn't get in the door. Finally tried again around mid afternoon on a Saturday and was able to get a couple of seats at the bar.

The bartender was welcoming and took and fulfilled our beer order right away. He was working the entire pub!! Crazy but he was efficient and kept his sense of humor.  He was serving beers and mixing drinks including a customers order of an old fashion!! Wow.

The food came pretty quickly. I ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was perfectly homemade. The hash browns (not smothered) were cooked well but they are plain. A little ketchup and I was a happy camper!

My friend ordered the haddock fish and chips and it looked delicious!! He said the batter had a nice flavor as well, the chips were definitely handcut. I'm getting that the next time I can get in.

The selection of craft beer cans is impressive. Be sure to check out the menu that's a mounted chalkboard above the bar stools. If you sit before looking up you'll miss it. 

I recommend this place for a simple yet delicious meal and some pretty amazing craft beers.

Parking is street or garage nearby. 
I will definitely be back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
After deciding not to make a reservation on our last night out Portland and deciding instead to just find a casual dinner whenever we got hungry, we searched yelp for a spot. 

Tomaso's is definitely more of a college bar spot but there were more mature patrons in the small establishment well. With space for only about 20-25 people, they turn the tables over quickly. 

We ordered the Tomaso burger, which was an andouille and beef mixture topped with bleu cheese and a bacon, tomato, onion jam and sitting on a bed of pickled cabbage. The bun was a toasted garlic English muffin. We also had a rebel chicken sandwich with sriracha ranch on a honey buttered ciabatta roll, a side of fries, and mutha cluckas, which were bacon wrapped jalapeños stuffed with pulled chicken and cream cheese.

Both sandwiches had a bit of a kick to them and were surprisingly quite good. I kept saying that I was glad that we couldn't see the kitchen as the place looked dingy and run down and I was really glad that they served the food in disposable containers. But, with that said, nothing kept us from destroying those sandwiches!

There was one server, one bartender, and one chef as far as we could tell. Service was good and very efficient. It's a good find for a quick meal and a drink.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Great bar. Could use more Como La Flor tho. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j8egJRjJh7A

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
I've been to Tomaso's a few times.

Pros: 
Parking
They have public restrooms
The food is absolutely delicious
Music is bumping 
Serves alcohol till 1 am 


Cons:
Trash service
Shady location
Rude bartender(s)
Small portion sizes
Takes way too damn long to get a drink (20+minutes when they're dead) 
Pretty pricey(wouldn't mind if the people who worked here weren't incredibly rude)
The bouncer at the door always asks for my ID after I go outside to smoke a cigarette( which he watches me do -great I get it's your job but as a paying customer who's usually there for over an hour RUDE) 


All in all Tomaso's has stellar food! Hence the only reason why I gave three stars. If my rating were based on service I'd give 1 Star. I wish I could but the food is just too good. Good drinks too. But the service is an absolute shit show the people who work here are nothing short than bitter and rude which I really don't understand as I work in the service industry and treat others who also do so kindly.. good for locals or the people who live in the neighborhood but DO NOT go out of your way to go here. The food is great but the portions are small (obviously so drunk people will buy more) service is a nightmare.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: When the order came to our table they were missing one of our meals and when we asked for it they blamed us for the mix up and never apologized. The two Mac and cheeses that arrived on time and the one we waited extra time for were ice cold. As they were very busy a simple apology was all we were looking for. We will not be returning.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This place would get four stars if it was bigger. But it was so so so tiny that it took ages for my party of three to get seats next to each other. 

Those onion rings are tasty! Get them if you like onions, fried food, and parmesan cheese because they rooooooock! 

Got the BBQ boneless wings. They were cooked too long in the fryer and under-sauced. That said, I would be interested in trying the bone in wings because the table next to me had 'Em and they looked incredible. May edit this review to add that extra star if they taste as good as they looked. 

It's a must-visit place in Portland, and if you don't mind the snug fit, get the freaking onion rings!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This is the kind of place that is so small, it's not even worth trying to get in unless you get there when it opens.
And that's why I LOVE IT.

One thing I feel Portland sometimes lacks is grungy, salt of the earth, city-vibe bars. This bar HAS ALL OF THAT. It is literally the size of a canteen. They have taco specials, killer fried cheese and apps, and a vast beer selection.
Get here early for a seat. Or just stand in the little doorway and feel blessed you're even in here. It's divey, it's BEAUTIFUL, it makes me feel like Portland is indeed a city.
I love to come here when it's -10 degrees outside and only a few locals are wandering the streets. That's when you have the best conversations with bartenders and strangers alike.
Bring one or two friends (not your party) and enjoy. Also GET THE FRIED CHEESE BLOCK. You'll thank me.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Tomaso's is the definition of a dive bar. I could get onboard if it was a little cleaner. But it's small, warm, sticky, and overall dirty. It's the sort of place that you're nervous to eat the food at. However, I did it the wings and I did survive! They weren't very good though. I also drank some cheap beer. I will say they played awesome music and I loved singing along to it and watching others try to dance in the tiny bar.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
- the food is good.
- cheap beer.
- staff is abrupt & dismissive.
- place looks unclean & gross.
- small bathroom.
- huge beer menu.
- lots of tv's.
- great music.
- parking.
- limited seating.
- rough neighborhood.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Love this place, the new menu is solid. Love the rebel chicken II. Also, the crispy boy beer selection is on point. One of my new go to spots in the Portland area. Cheap eats and good beer, love it

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Don't listen to Kitty T below, she's probably a yelper that complains about everything. As an out of towner, we came in to Tomaso's and were immediately greeted by the bartender and when I couldn't pick an IPA he recommended one for me. It's a small local spot that's amazing and I would tell all of my friends to stop in here on their way through Portland

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Good vibe, pretty small place. Tuesdays they have $2 tallboy Tecates and tacos. Rebel chicken sandwich was recommended by the barkeep and sounded great on paper but pickle brined chicken tasted rubbery like it was raw/undercooked but it was fully cooked. Hmm. Taco specials were pretty good (shepherds pie and burger taco) but they mixed one up, that's fine. On flour tortillas with mixed shredded industrial cheese, so adjust your expectations. Sausage sounded promising, they make it in house. 

Not sure I'd return for food but good drinks and cozy bar area with nice classic rock music playing. Not too loud too.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Lunch with a colleague. Frozen garbage that I cannot believe I paid for. I felt like I was eating at a bowling alley. Absolutely disgusting.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: I would love to give this bar a 0 star. I'm giving this review because I think that all tourists should know. Avoid !! I have never been so disappointed in a bar in my life. This is a must avoid bar. If you are in Portland go anywhere but this place. Honestly anywhere down town will do. The customer service is hostile and the Mac and cheese is watered down. Literally water Mac and cheese. Avoid at all costs. Skip this place the bartender is rude to anyone who is out of state. Avoid avoid avoid !!!! Tourist beware !!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Great dirt chicken wings could be spicier for my taste. A divey bar vibe win a large beer selection. Nice place to watch the game and very reasonable prices. The burger was pretty good but their salad and rebel chicken sandwich was not as fresh or we flavored as I would have liked. Friendly and attentive staff. Will be back for beer and wings and a good place to wait if you're in the forever line at Duckfat.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: I really wanted to love this place, it's so close to our home-base. The fish & chips were the worst I've ever had. The whole mess was so overdone, there wasn't anything to eat. The waiter never asked how was everything? He saw that I couldn't eat any of it, but didn't care. We will be back to try again, hopefully sitting at the bar, and ordering anything else other than the fish and chips!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This is a classic Portland dive bar...bar seating and about 6 or 7 two tops...It's just a great aura if you're into just beer and grub atmosphere. The menu has several beer and shot specials with old school beers like Schlitz, Miller High Life, PBR, and a few others. Decent wings, served up several ways...I had the Pooh...roasted garlic and honey mustard sauce, which was very good. The roasted Brussel Sprouts were also good, as was the roasted pork roast, covering crisp deep fried sweet potato fries, covered with mushroom gravy. A hearty and well prepared dish. 

Solid four stars....it's a must try if you are local.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Came here to grab a beer while we waited for a table at Duckfat. It took a while to get seated and get our order in.  But once we settled in, we enjoyed the casual atmosphere. The beer was cold and cheap. It was the perfect thing to pass the time.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Food was delicious. Waitress was horrible. Super rude and literally wrote the book on how to be the worst waitstaff ever. 
Step 1: Ignore your guests  
Step 2: Lie about the menu  
Step 3: Force guests to ask three times for water then get mad when they keep asking because they are thirsty  
Step 4: Lose their money  (don't pay cash here)
Excellent food but until they hire someone who cares about their job, guests will suffer. I hope they do because it's definitely a hidden gem.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Been here a couple of times in the past year while up here for business. It's nice to be able to go out and eat for less than $1,334,123 per meal. Great food as always. Good selection of beer. Don't come here if you want to be "wined and dined" but if you want some good ass food then come on down.  Not sure why people say the place is dirty or in a sketchy area....these people must be prudes. Very safe area and very clean. No need to look further, if you want a burger and beer then this is your place. I've heard the wings are great....never ventured away from the burger.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Nice small dive bar with a large selection of beers and all sorts of drinks. The bartender was super cool and knowledgeable and told us to order the hot wings which were honestly so amazing! Extra crispy and packed with flavor they were coated in the buffalo sauce and the carrots and celery were clean and crispy! Soo good. Definitely recommend coming here for drinks and food also. Really cool and really clean dive bar!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
It is rare for me to give a bad review but the service was bad and the $2 taco's were not worth the money and that is saying something.  The server (shaved head and beard) working tonight was annoyed that we wanted to order food with our drink order.  When we told him we would wait on the food order, he said "Just go ahead and order".  The dude was angry from the start.  When another table asked him how he was doing he said "Shi**y".  Quit if you hate your job that much.

Even at $2, the taco's were sub par.  All we had was tacos so I cannot comment on the other items.  I feel 3 stars is generous but as it was my first visit, I do not want to give it a lower score, even though I think it deserves it

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: So glad we stopped at this little hole in the wall neighborhood eatery and bar. Don't judge a book by its cover on this one. Place is small but delivers huge with its food, craft beer selection and price. Staff are awesome, friendly and prompt with their service. Food is crave worthy, hot and fresh. We got the Pooh wings and tai chili wings and were some of the best I've ever had. I got the cheeseburger sub which eats like a steak and cheese with the meat chopped up with onion, peppers and cheese. So delicious...will return for sure!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Went in on a Wednesday. It was pretty slow, which was great. Definitely a dive bar, a few regulars sat at the bar with us. Large selection of craft beers. They had a burger deal going on which I took advantage of. Great bar to grab some good inexpensive food

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Just happened in to this little joint and it's fabulous! Bar tender fun with a great wit! Very good selection of craft beer on tap and really great chicken wings. Busy, lively vibe... will be back to explore more of the menu!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Went in here on Taco Tuesday not realizing how busy the place gets and was told I had to try the Tomaso Burger.  The food and service here is very fast and the staff is really friendly. 

So when the burger came out it looked amazing and was just dripping and oozing with yummy goodness. The first bite was great, it was a very rich and savory bite. As I kept eating the burger the flavors were getting a little rich for my liking and I was really craving more cheese on my the burger it only came with a little bit of blue cheese crumbles. For me it was a little too rich and I'm not sure I will get it again. 

After that I had one of their 2$ tacos, the haddock one. It came out in 60 seconds, not kidding. It was good but the after taste was so spicy me kind of over took the taco, but it was 2$ so I really can't complain.  

This place got so busy and it was a great crowd of people there. Other delicious bites on the menu are the sausage sandwich that they make IN HOUSE (say whattt), the dirt wings, the buffalo haddock sanwich, and lastly BUT most importantly the cheesy bacon fries...outrageous food! Love this place

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Great food, great friendly service.  Small upbeat atmosphere with a dive bar type of feel (not in a bad way).  The wings were pretty damn good (I got the boneless ones because I was feeling too lazy).  Brussels were cooked fairly well and had a hint of Dijon in them. Added a nice little kick.  Finally the burger (double with onions, peppers, and jalapenos) was pretty awesome.  Bun was toasted perfectly, would have preferred med-rare but it was still full of flavor.  Prices are very reasonable.  The beer list was good and a lot of locals but a little on the small side.  Overall happy with this find.  Two thumbs up!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: What a great spot. I'm in Portland alone for work and wanted a restaurant with some energy and tv's to watch a game. Taco Tuesday was a great touch. Exactly what I was looking for.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: An absolute hole in the wall with the BEST WINGS IVE EVER HAD!!! My friend brought me to Tomaso's and after talking to the waitress, I decided on the 'Pooh' wings (lemon, honey, garlic). Holy !&@$!!! They were absolutely incredible. The chicken wings were meaty, and the sauce was absolutely killer. I will definitely be going back for these. 5/5!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This place is a bit of a hole in the wall.... it lacks ambience, but that's what's cool about it! The menus is awesome! Foodie meets pubbie. They were killin it on the jukebox too... old school hip-hop all day! Bang for your buck, some of the best eats in Portland!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: A diamond in the rough! Nothing fancy, plastic silverware, small menu, but amazing food, quality and experience! Definitely would recommend! Definitely would come back here! Everyone in our party of six said the food was incredible!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This place made me smile as I walked through the door.

I used to frequent Sangillo's before it was shut down and purchased by the successful, dive bar owner, of "Samuel's".  I love the quaint dive bar appeal of Sangillo's and I think Sam did a great job embodying the essence of trendy and divey.


The walls are covered in chalkboard paint with the specials written across.  You can find a shot and beer here for very cheap.  With the rising number prices in Portland, Thomaso's has combatted the expensive tapas style dining that is popping up in so many Portland establishments.  

We had a Sierra Nevada for 3$ during Saturday Liquid Lunch time.  My friend had a Cliff Island Coffee, sweet and SUPER strong for 9$ (a bit pricey, but normal for Portland). 

We also had buffalo shrimp to share and a famous Maine Red Hot Dog wrapped in bacon, breaded and deep fried.  The breading on both was fluffy and light.  Next time, I would order the  buffalo sauce on the side because it caused the breading to get soggy.  

We also split an order of cannoli.  It was 6$ for 2 and they were fabulous.  I'm pretty sure they had a coffee liquor in the filling.

They also offer the Samuel's fabulous and locally famous dirt wings. I feel as though these wings are some of the best in Portland.

I will be visiting this place again.  It's divey, fun, affordable, and off the main strip, so parking is easy to find.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: We love tomaso's. Unfortunately, we don't get down here a lot, but it's always great when we do! It gets very busy because it's so small so be prepared to wait a little bit for a seat! The food is fantastic and they always have a lot of great combos/daily deals!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Between the happy hour specials, local beers and tasty grub, you can't go wrong stopping in this place. The food is delicious-especially the wings! Usually I tend to go with a brew, but the few cocktails I have had here have been tasty and strong. Huge upgrade in style, food and class from the days it was Sangillo's, yet it still maintains that neighborhood, hole in the wall, dive bar feel. Love the mermaid logo and the old fashioned decor as well.  Do yourself a favor and stop by!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Great atmosphere,  drink arnt very strong, portions are moderate, food is ok, I will not ne back!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Located next to the Hampton Inn we came to watch the NHL playoff game and sat at the bar. Cute little bar that serves bar type food. Bartender and service were great.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This place is very tiny. BUT! The wings are outstanding. My boyfriend and I got the buffalo style and they were SUPER spicy but delicious. The waitress was nice and pretty attentive considering the amount of people she was tending to. There were several drinks that I'd like to try if I go back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This is a complete and utter dive, with a bouncer sitting at the front.  No kids (which is a good thing).  It feels like you're walking into a biker bar, and people look up when ya walk in.  Luckily, everybody was friendly, and we found two seats at the bar.  Fun selection of shot and a beer; like a shot of Jack Daniels and a PBR.  This is old school dive bar style at its "finest."  No fancy drinks, just solid real world slugs of booze and beer.  The food, however, is outstanding.  Best chicken wings I've ever had, with a smoky, charcoal flavor and super tender meat.  Every other dish we've had (I won't make a list) were just as A-rated.  Great food, plus hole in the wall decor.  AND they are open late, which means great post-party snacking!  Don't be intimidated by the exterior; these cats know how to pour a drink and cook up some flavorful grub.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: My fiancé and I have been here a lot. Food and beers are always great. We love the atmosphere. But the service is ALWAYS terrible. We always end up waiting so long to be acknowledged and the server has an attitude almost every time (usually server with pony tail and glasses). Our most recent visit we came in and wanted at least 10 minutes and he actually greeted and got beers for two tables who walked in after us. Once he finally came over to us we wanted to order our apps with our drinks and he told us that he could only take drink orders cuz there were other tables that also needed to order food..... we just closed out the tab and got food somewhere else. Very disappointing as regulars/Portland residents.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Friendly staff, cozy, good fries, great beer selection. Very casual and a good place for happy hour with a friend or two (not more).

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This place was great! The wings were so flavorful and cooked to perfection. The ranch had horseradish in it, interesting. The burger mixed with andouille sausage was probably the best I've ever had in my life! Some of the best pricing we saw in Portland while visiting also.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Fantastic wings....2 dollar  taco Tuesday was simply great and that blackened fish tacos were delicious.  2 dollar Miller's 11 to 5.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Was in on Sunday and got charged $9 for a Crown and GInger. Pretty sure I got charged the "tourist" rate. It's a real shame too because I think otherwise I really would have really dug this place as it seemed to be more about locals than tourists. Maybe they want to keep it that way. Who knows. I won't be back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Cool bar. We had a bunch of appetizers; Brussel sprouts, fried okra, boneless wings, and cheese fries. Everything was really tasty (even the okra and I don't usually like it). My favorite were the boneless wings. I only gave 3 stars, because with the prices I would have expected larger servings. Also, they have a great beer selection, but it is also a little pricey compared to other spots. Service was ok, the bartender was our server and he was really nice and as fast as he could be (it was super busy). All and all I would go back, I would just be more likely to eat before going and only have 1 or 2 drinks.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Most underrated bar and restaurant in portland. Litty titty.

Great specials,  delicious food.

Munjoy dinosaur.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
On our recent vacation to Maine, we were in desperate need of a happy hour. Found this sort of dive bar and it did the trick. Awesome perk was the happy hour specials on drinks and food. $1.50 hot dogs were great - the toddler ate two and didn't fuss about it!

Partner and I got drink specials - both were ok, especially for the price. He ordered the taco Tuesday deal and said it was great. I got some onion rings - those were heavy and rich, and then the Monte Carlo sandwich which was too heavy and difficult to finish. We came on a shift change, and our first waiter was awesome chatting with us and the kid, the second seemed annoyed by the kiddo. He made friends anyway per usual, but it was a downside. Overall a solid place worth checking out!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This place is kind of amazing! It is a simple little hole in the wall place with a very friendly and attentive waitress. We just stopped in on a whim and couldn't be happier that we did. They have some great beers and good music. Great place to hang out and drink some good beer! Did not try any of the food unfortunately but it also looked good.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Love it. Not the tourist trap that most places are. Homes prices and food and beverage.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Look don't get me wrong I move this place, but anyone who calls it a dive is lying. Its a hipster bar pretending to be a dive bar because its so small. I mean they have jello shots! The food is excellent, love the Brussel sprouts and Mac&cheese with bacon. Lucas the bartender always seems to be the only one around and serving, but I love him and his snark anyway. Would also say as a warning if you go when its this negative 20 degree weather the walls are cinder blocks and don't provide a lot of insulation. All in all would recommend for a quiet Saturday or Sunday afternoon drink, wouldn't stay to late because seating is so limited. But its a great place to start your night or just hang out in.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
I had gotten so many "suggestions" to check out Tomaso's but never ended up going as it was always a Friday or Saturday night when I thought of it and I figured they would probably be packed!
So...when an opportunity presented itself to check out Tomaso's for lunch on a random Friday, I jumped.
I was able to find street parking easily and upon entering noticed that while they were busy, there were still a few tables to choose from.
Our (amazingly helpful) waiter came over pretty quickly to take drink orders.  There were a bunch of beer specials listed under a special table note entitled "liquid lunch".  The beers on that list ranged from $3-5 bucks each.  Pretty sweet.  The food menu was both listed on paper and on a chalkboard above the bar.
After asking our waiter for suggestions, we settled on the mozzarella ball appetizer, a haddock wrap with fries for my friend and a cheeseburger for me.  There was no issue at all with asking for the fries to be well done.
While waiting for our food, I was able to get an opportunity to take in the vibe of the place.  I really liked the mix.  This was definitely not a hipster hang, yet while there were clearly hipsters in the room, there were also old time Portlanders and a few people who looked as though they may have spent the last 40 years sitting on a downtown bar stool.  
The food arrived pretty quickly.  We both loved the flavor of the mozzarella ball app, but found it crazily small for $8, especially for a place that is known for a good value.  The cheeseburger, on the other hand, was $7 (with cheese) and was very, very good.  My friend loved her haddock wrap and the well done fries were perfect!
We ended up hanging out and talking for so long, that we ordered a dessert to share.  A Key Lime pie, made in house for $6 which was quite good.  We both loved it and considered ordering another one.
All in all a VERY positive experience, I will definitely return for lunch!  I still might check ahead on a Friday or Saturday night as it is a small space and probably does get packed on the weekend.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This place is awesome, with great grub. My only hope is they soon get an even bigger place. On a saturday afternoon the place was packed, yet with excellent service. They have tons of food and drink specials, including happy hour, weekend liquid lunch or taco sundays for $2. There is a jukebox for your listening pleasure in this divey casual bar.

They have food special that changes on their chalk board and we had the pleasure of enojying the dog in a poncho. My only regret is not ordering my own or some to take home. It's a red hot dog wrapped in bacon, dipped in beer batter and fried to perfection and served with honey mustard. The chicken parm eggrolls were yummy, packed with ground chicken, parmesan and spice with marinara for dipping. The suasage quesadillo was the classic sweet sausage loaded with peppers and onions, often found in the hand of country fair goers, but wrapped in a warm torilla with melted cheese. I wish I had room to try one their dessesrts, like fried cheescake, however I had already eaten so much I almost had to be carried out.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Cheap beer, tasty food, good music. What an awesome little hole in the wall.

What's great about this bar is that the location is still downtown but just hidden away enough that you'd have to be in the know to hit it if you're from away. We will totally be back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Love! This is my idea of a perfect bar. It's not divey, and also not uppity. For instance,  a person like me,  who likes intoxication-by-martinis is totally acceptable here. Plus, there's a juke box, hallelujah! I haven't had the food, but it looks pretty good. Oh, and service was really friendly,  I could become a regular, easily.

I'm definitely a fan.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
I had only been to Sangillo's a handful of times, mostly at the end of a long night to finish off with some heavy pours at wicked cheap prices or a two dollar jello shot but Tomaso's keeps alive the spirit of cheaper beers and spirits!

The inside is completely redone. Not much more in the way space on the floor because really how much can you do with less than 400 square feet of space but they have tried to add more seating and more stools (and they are in working order!) The bar is awesome, with a modern design and liquor easy enough to spot. 

I did not try a lot of the food but did have an onion ring. Perfect hand cut rings, a good even amount of batter vs. onion, dipping sauce with slight a slight zing. 

Plenty of cheaper domestic beers and craft beers are abound. They seemed to have at least one craft beer that was on special. 

The only knock is that it will fill up fast with people trying to get in. This bar is owned by the same person that owns Samuels down on Forest Ave. Once again doing a great job at identifying the market and catering to the locals.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Great deal on taco Tuesday.  The haddock tacos were so so and I did not like the wings at all. Chicken Caesar salad was very good.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Tomaso's is a fantastic little bar with affordable drinks and food. The food is delicious, they even serve sausages made fresh by the owners, and it comes out quick enough to stop in for lunch during your break! Tomaso's is run by the owners of Samuel's so the old port is now blessed with those award winning dirt wings. They are constantly changing the specials so every day is a new eating and drinking experience.  

They also have great beer + shot specials like the Adult pb&j which is a PBR tall boy and a shot of jack for just $8. They also have a list of locally themed cocktails like the Munjoy Mule which is their spin on a classic Mule, this one features locally distributed Ice Pik Vodka which is incredibly smooth. 

They are open and serving food and drink until 1 am every day, which is a gift to every last caller in the Old Port!! 

I suggest you stop in at any point in the day or night as there is always a group of friendly and/or entertaining customers there but if you are out on a week night looking for a lively bar this is a great place to stop in because it's seats are often filled with locals just getting off their shifts at nearby bars and businesses.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Best of the dozen Bloody Mary's I tried while in town over the weekend.  Beer selection extensive.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Usually a great experience .tonight about 40 minutes for a hot dog/fries to go order. Not cool

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Was back at Tomaso's for the Pats game on Sunday - again, the food did not disappoint - the Mozilla is NUTS, the Dirt Wings are delicious and the Bacon Double Cheeseburger was outta this world.  Wifey went straight for the Irish Breakfast shot and beer combo, while I stuck with the local Maine beers on tap - Bissell Brothers, Maine Beer Co - YUM!  Bartenders are super friendly and so is the clientele - always spark up a good convo with the patrons there.  WE LOVE TOMASO'S CANTEEN!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Do get the onion rings, bone in buffalo wings (well done), burger, gosh just try everything! Also enjoy their rotating (local) beer list!!! It can be crowded but is one place in Portland where the patrons are kind and will acknowledge the purse that whacked you in the back or stepping on your toes. Super friendly and attentive bartenders who'll strike up a small conversation even if they are busy. Sister bar to Samuels with the same mission of great service, great food and a place that will be your new go-to. I just love Tomasos!!!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: 3.5 actually... small local feel. Hipsters inside. Grabbed some bar snacks to hold us over from brunch to dinner. The food was good, drinks were average.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Really nice dive bar. Great service. Clean bathrooms. We had boneless wings which were great and a few beers while waiting for a table at Eventide oyster co. A must!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Good service, despite it being a Friday of a holiday weekend. Brussel sprouts appetizer and "dirt" seasoned wings were great. We enjoyed the draft beer selection. Cozy and loud atmosphere.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: You can count on a great time here! Can you say Jell-O shots? If not, plenty of beer and awesome cocktails. Didn't try food here. Casual and low key atmosphere.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Tomaso's is my favorite place to get greasy pub food. Fried chicken sandwiches, dirty wings, steak and cheese, mac and cheese, french fries- you name it. All delicious and pretty cheap. 
They also have some good cocktails, a surprisingly decent but smallish wine list, and of course a number of beers. They've got a great happy hour and some weekly specials that look good too- like Taco Tuesdays!

The place is tiny. This is not a place to bring a large group. We typically go on weeknights or in the afternoon on the weekends so we've never had a problem finding seating at the bar or one of the few small tables. 

This place is not fancy, no need to get dressed up- but wear layers because the temperature seems to fluctuate wildly. 

If you're into sports they always have a game on the T.V.s and some good tunes playing in the background. 

There's something for everybody... unless you're on a diet. Don't come here if you're on a diet.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Dog friendly, their breakfast sandwiches are served on an English muffin and just delicious and their Rose sangria was amazing. All around great place

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This place was great. Very relaxed and atmosphere with good (not too loud) music, good beer selection, and very tasty food options. They also make accommodations for people with various food allergies.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: We really love this place.  Dirt wings are SO good.  Great happy hour specials, cozy environment, attentive staff, reasonable prices.  TINY place but worth the wait if you cannot sit right away!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Best bar in the Old Port-ish area.
Great food, atmosphere, and drinks.
Ask the bartender for a Sangillo's night cap!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: So glad we decided to check this place out.  Had Cliff Island Coffee cocktail.  But the main attraction for me was the Brussels Sprouts.  Cooked with bacon & dressed with dijon, cranberries & almond slices, they were sooo good that I will definitely push to return.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Tomaso's Canteen is a wonderfully SMALL, affordable, and cozy update, the exact opposite of what Sangillo's Tavern used to be: a dodgy, run down dive of ill repute, where most Portlanders were afraid to venture inside, and where every night you'd have about a 20% chance of accidentally getting into a fistfight.  Based on the squeaky clean 'rustic modern' interior - and the new class of patrons who now frequent this place - I'd say those odds have dropped down to about 3%.  It's a great addition to this part of town, which is mostly surrounded by trendier, more expensive restaurants.

When we went around 6:30pm on a Tuesday night, the place was hopping.  Thankfully 'hopping' here means busy, and not patrons crawling over you at the bar to get a drink, obnoxiously loud music, and servers trying to push through you in a crowd to get to a table.  Luckily my friend snagged me a spot at the bar just before I arrived - otherwise every other seat was taken. 

The bartenders are attentive and friendly, and they make their drinks STRONG and fast. I ordered an old fashioned based on positive feedback I had heard.  This ended up being more of a working man's old fashioned (READ: mucho bourbon plus sugar, sans the Angostura bitters). The simplicity was refreshing.  Plus, the bitters just take up the space where more bourbon could be added. The have divey drink specials to offset some of their pricier cocktails, and they seem to have a pretty solid happy hour.  We also ordered buffalo shrimp (served in a classy martini glass!) and bacon cheese fries.  All very good, although maybe a $1-$2 more expensive than they should have been?  My friend ordered a burger, which I tried.  This was also very good, and well priced to match.  

If you visit, keep in mind that seating is limited; it's probably best to show up during off-peak times, as this will maximize your odds of getting a seat.  I'm not sure this place can hold more than 25-30 people.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Great bar. Loved the beer and shot. Bartender was good and tentative. The menu for brunch looked great.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
This is a small, simple, amazing bar, aka my favorite kind of bar.

I loved the buffalo shrimp and the burger was pretty flavorful and tasty, although I might try a different sandwich the next time I go.

There is not a ton of space, which is totally fine, but might mean you are waiting or need a second option on a busy night.  The space that is there is clean and well kept.  

The service is friendly but not overly assertive.  

Overall, a must try and I will definitely be back.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: I can't help but echo Leah W and Tony W's reviews... Tomaso's is fabulous!  My friend and I had a great time chatting with some of the other bar-goers. From out-of-town cops to local line cooks, Tomoso's seems really friendly and welcoming. And our bartender, Adam, was terrific. He wasn't even thrown off when I asked him to make me a custom cocktail using Maine Craft Distilling's Blueshine. The drinks were strong (believe me) and reasonably priced especially by Portland standards. Yes, the space is small but it works - as does everything about this gem.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
A great find!  After determining there was a 2 hour wait at Duck Fat, my husband and I came across Tomaso's Canteen.  The place looked slightly sketchy from the street, but since we were starving we took our chances.  I am so glad we did!  We ordered hamburgers, side salad, french fries and two brews.  The prices were very reasonable and the food freshly prepared and delicious.  

*Hamburgers - 5 oz fresh ground-chuck hand made patties, cooked perfectly to order.  
*Side salad - nice size portion of fresh mixed greens, very tasty.  
*Fries - hand cut potatoes, nicely seasoned and delicious.

While it gives off a sketchy vibe from the street, it is very clean and welcoming once you step through the doors.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
A friend and I decided to check this place out.  I was pleasantly surprised that it still had a bit of the Sangillo's vibe to it.   It still feels like a place where everyone belongs.
We got the buffalo shrimp which were great!!  Nice portion size and just the right amount of spice.
The bartender was super welcoming which in my book makes all the difference in a small neighborhood place.
Definitely on the repeat visit list.  I can't wait to make the trip with the group of high school girls I use to go to Sangillo's with!!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: The Portland "sweet spot". The outside is gritty enough to keep the yuppies away. Inside is the bar you want it to be. 90's grunge, tall boys, and a menu reminiscent of college dorms. You want to tell everyone about this place but that would ruin it.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Nice vibe!
Good drinks, great wings!!!
Port lands best kept secret!

Stop in and give it a try! You won't complain!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Found this place while staying nearby at the Hampton Inn. It's located right next door. After looking it up on Yelp I knew I wanted to check it out and it did not disappoint! Such a cool spot with a strong hipster feel! I love the rotating craft beer CAN list as well as the different take on bar food that their menu showed. I got the chicken Parmesan egg rolls and they were nothing short of amazing! They paired perfectly with my pint of local Austin Street Brewery beer and the World Series game on the tv. The bartender fit the bill both in personality and hospitality. They also have great music and a full bar. I will be back soon!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: So glad we stopped in!!!! Clean bar with a comfortable atmosphere is such a rarity in Portland and Tomaso's Canteen nailed it! Beer is reasonably priced and the food is wonderful. I ordered the full order of wings and boyfriend ordered a house salad. Portion sizes are huge and worth the price. We'll definitely be back!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Friends server. Great beer selection both draft and cans. Awesome food. Had the buffalo shrimp and a single burger.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Tomaso's is one of my favorite bars in Portland. They have an extensive drink menu, as well as awesome food, all at good prices. The weekday deals are amazing. It's a great place to chill out and spend some time watching a game or just catching up with friends in a casual setting.  I've been going to Tomaso's since just about when it first opened, and it's been awesome to watch it go from a quiet best-kept-secret, to a bustling popular bar. I just wish I could always get a table like I could last February!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Tomaso's is one of those places you didn't realize that you needed. The menu is creative if not a bit niche, lots and lots of meat dishes with nothing really available for the vegetarians. Luckily, I don't really hang out with many vegetarians. Our bartender was a real sweetheart, too, who was happy to make a recommendation (or five). Everything I ate was awesome and I love that it's kind of a sports bars since I love me some sports. I'll be back...

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: This is the perfect local bar with a cool, contemporary, and casual vibe. The place is tiny but arranged very smartly with a long bar, several tables with seats, and several TVs to watch sports. The food and drink are all super reasonably priced with a good number of selections. Just a great, chill, unpretentious vibe with friendly bartenders. I will be back all winter at this cozy spot!!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Cozy little joint for locals or tourists alike! Best wings in the country!! No joke! Staff is exceptional, laid back and welcoming! I get to Portland 4 times a year only always a must stop!!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Stopped by here for a quick drink before heading over elsewhere in Portland. There is a decent beer selection and the waitress was very informative as to what her favorite was and the different beers available for the day. The bar was pretty lively and although seats might not always be immediately available, people cycle through pretty quickly. Be sure to check out the karaoke/song selection machine by the door!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: The waiter was really amazing with suggesting alcohol for us ! the music and atmosphere were pretty nice ; they had some reggae music going on and the food was pretty good we had the hashbrowns and the buffalo wings which were spicy e ouch for us! also the bloody Mary was one of the top spicy bloody Mary's that I've had! Hidden gem!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: I have been wanting to check out this place for a while.  I was hoping my boyfriend would like it as much I thought he would. I was wrong. We LOVED it! The staff is so down to earth and pleasant. The beers on tap were great and even changed while we were there. The food is simple, yet creative.  Not fancy, yet not heated up in a microwave. I got the cheese fries with bacon and the bf got the mozzarella balls. Holy cheese fries! Holy bacon! SO good!! We didn't even realize it was taco Tuesday so I tried one of the chili lime chicken crunchy tacos. Wow! I could've eaten three of them (without the fries!). They were playing 90s mainstream and underground hip hop which was perfect enough to keep your foot tapping, but not too loud so you didn't feel like you were in a club. With their four strategically placed tvs, just the right amount of tv where you still feel like you can have a conversation. We got there a little after happy hour so it was quiet when we arrived, but it got very busy after 5 pm. We will definitely be belly up to that bar again! And soon!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: We popped in late afternoon Saturday for a couple drinks and loved it. The bartender and servers were great, super friendly. Drink prices were awesome and it was right across the street from our hotel. The food coming out of the kitchen looked really good too. You can tell it's a popular place where the servers know the customers, lots of patrons were being called by their first names, and because it's so small it gets quickly mobbed. If you're in the area, you should pop in for one (or more).

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Any port in a storm. Eventide said plus one hour wait. Came here. Nice crowd. Nice service. Greasy bar food but quaint.

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Love this place!! A dive bar atmosphere with delicious food and a great beer/alcohol selection. What more could you want in a casual hangout spot? Stop by on Taco Tuesdays...2 tacos for $3 and $2 Tecates. All of the staff members are very friendly and attentive regardless of how busy it is. This is a small space so you might have to wait for a table or belly up to the bar, but trust me it's more than worth it!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text:
Great bar run by great people. Not a ton of room but $1.50 loaded hot dogs, jello shots, low priced beers. 
One of my favorite spots in the city

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: To call this a dive bar would be a bit insulting, but the prices will make you think you just made it to local bar heaven!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: To all of you standing in long lines at nearby trendy restaurants, "Step away from your line and cross the street to Tomasso's Canteen"!  It's an adorable, dive-type bar with a wonderful vibe and great food and drink to top it all off. It was a breath of fresh air, with knowledgable and super-friendly service. The fish and chips my husband ordered were the best he's had, we loved the brussel sprouts appetizer...to die for, and the fish tacos were delicious. Even their calamari had a neat twist...some dusting of cheese and a vinaigrette base with red onions in the bottom of the basket...totally different take, very nice. Give them a try...you'll be pleasantly surprised at the quality of food, and will love the relaxed atmosphere!

name: tomaso's-canteen
review_text: Awesome, laid back place. Fish and chips are excellent. Staff are chill. Seven thumbs up.

name: local-188
review_text:
Came here on a chilly late spring Thursday night with some co-workers and clients. I was pleasantly surprised to find that Local 188 has plenty of private off-street parking, a nice bonus for this neighborhood.

The parking also helps given that the interior is surprisingly large - with a good sized, corner bar on the left facing the street and a large yet cozy dining area. The open kitchen and dark wood makes the space feel more intimate and the size helps with noise and space.

The host and server were both friendly, and the food was all delivered quickly and plated quite nicely. We went with a selection of tapas due to our large mixed group size, though I'm definitely going back to sample some of the dinner-sized dishes as many of them looked great.

I'm not a mussels fan but our table raved about the size of the dish and quality, and the ones I did try -- the pita and goat cheese croquetes - were both above average, with fresh light flavors that worked well together.

Drinks were perfectly made across the board (I got a rye mule that I recommend), though we could've received a bit more regular check-ins there. 

Finally, while I wasn't overly excited at the desert menu selections, our entire group ordered the Crema Catalonia so I joined in. The menu describes it as "vanilla custard, earl grey, orange confit, fennel jam, lemon poppy shortbread", and while it was a fresh, lightly sweet and nicely portioned finish to the meal, I do recommend they make their menu description a bit less clever and a bit more direct. You're receiving a small cup of custard with a fennel jam layer on top and an earl gray-infused layer on bottom alongside two thin lemon poppyseed wafers. 

All-in-all this is a place with a sizeable, mixable menu, a warm atmosphere, and friendly service. I'll be back again to try some more cocktail options and see what their meal portion menu has to offer.

name: local-188
review_text:
Yet again, Portland's long lines indicate popular brunches with accuracy. 

The inside of Local 188 is larger than I expected because Portland restaurants are notoriously tiny. It's got charm but I honestly can't identify the style of the place. Maybe classy grandfather chic?

Get an iced chai latte. It's lightly spicy and a great way to start out brunch here. 

The sausage and biscuits main dish is so hearty, perfect for a rainy autumn morning. Sausage is less Jimmy Dean spices and more modern breakfast sausage in flavor, but there's gotta be a half pound of meat in that dish. The two biscuits are dense, moist, and incredibly well suited for the gravy they swim in. Two thumbs up. 

The special of the day was an ham, mozzarella and green onion omelette/scramble. Also megatasty.

name: local-188
review_text:
Well, count me as disappointed. Local 188 was my favorite brunch place for years. A cool bohemian vibe with great egg scrambles, drinks and free parking, this was my go-to brunch spot. $5 mimosas were a Portland bargain and the long waits were worth it.

Fast forward to 2019 and things have changed. Hot Suppa is clearly the king of brunch on Congress St., and Local barely even has waits anymore. Now I see why. Those $5 mimosas slowly crept to $6, and then $7 over the years. Now it's $9 for a mimosa and $10 for a Bloody Mary, which is perhaps the worst value in the city (though the Bloody's are excellent). And the mimosas have pulp, if that's not your thing.

But worse than the downgrade in drinks is the food. Most dishes come with home fries, and my scramble came with an abundance. Four. So did my companions'. Four home fries!!! Did the chef or server eat the rest? I figured it had to be an off day until some friends went a day later. They got three home fries. I'm pretty sure this isn't the Great Famine. And the scramble itself was far smaller than in the past and ordinary. Only the thick english muffin with the perfect raspberry jam was satisfying. 

I just can't recommend Local anymore. The drinks and meals are overpriced for what you get. Portland still isn't a great brunch city, but you can do better.

name: local-188
review_text:
Popped into this restaurant for dinner in Portland. I came specifically for the seafood paella, so I can't speak to the tapas here. 

The seafood paella: IMPORTANT: THIS DISH IS A 30 MIN WAIT. We were seated right away, and even though there were only a few customers, we were told right away that the paella is a 30-40 min wait. I was ok with that since there was nothing else I wanted on the menu. I'd say it was worth the wait since we weren't in a hurry. I'm not sure if you can call ahead and get the order going before arriving at the restaurant. 

The dish came out piping hot with lots of mussels, clams, but few scallops, shrimps, and pieces of dish of the day. The scallops, jumbo shrimps, and white fish were absolutely amazing. Mussels and clams were small and shriveled. The rice was cooked well. For $39, the portions were more than enough for 2 people. 

The space: Beautiful, spacious, but very dimly lit. Definitely a romantic atmosphere conducive for fancy date nights. 

The service: Very friendly, no complaints. 

The wait: Tuesday night in September, only a few tables were occupied. Again, at least 30 min wait for the paella even with the few customers. 

Overall, would recommend if you're into paella. Not sure what the tapas experience is like.

name: local-188
review_text:
We started by waiting 45 minures for a table.   That was our choice so that's ok. Then we waited 10 minutes to order. Ok.. then waited over an hour for our food. Not ok. I asked the waitress about our food and she snapped, "it's obviously busy today. " Going downhill fast. 5 of us got our food and the 6 th waited another 10 minutes for her order. Unacceptable. 
The food was average at best, undercooked to be accurate. The service was completely indifferent. 
I would never go back . Too many other good places nearby. Vote with your feet.

name: local-188
review_text:
I have been here three times in the last year, the first time, the male bartender made an amazing drink for me based on my love of rum and fruit. I was sold. The whole night was amazing. I left feeling like I had a great experience. 

The second time was a month ago and the same thing! Amazing drinks. Friendly atmosphere. Comfy. Wonderful experience. 

The third time tonight was also consistently amazing. I highly recommend this place. Tonight was the first time I have ever eaten here. We had the Montadito, Potatas Bravas and Roasted Chicken. 

I didn't expect the Montadito to be as delicious as it was.  The boyfriends pick. He picks well. Blindly though, he knows very little about food. Haha. 

The Potatas Bravas was good. We asked the bartender what she liked and that is what she said. I would have loved if the potatos had a more salty crust and if the garlic aoili had a maple flavor in it.

Could have just been me but the whole meal lacked a sweetness that I expect in December. 

The roasted chicken was good as well but I personally would have added a sweet flavor which I think they tried to do with the apricot tomato salsa which wasn't my fav. I noticed after that I had none of the carrots on my plate which might be why I felt like this was missing something. 

But honestly. Everything looks delicious. I saw and smelt the Risotto and that looks SO epic. I also saw the gnocchi and that looked really yum too! 

I will update my review when I do brunch which I heard was banging!

name: local-188
review_text:
This review is for brunch only.

For the positives:
- We got a table outside which was so lovely on a nice sunny morning
- Good location and easy to find parking
- Brunch burger was delicious

For the not-so-positives:
- Service took forever
- The breakfast sandwich was on the same bun as the burger so while eating it, I really felt like I was missing out since my dining companion had the burger lol...served on their biscuit, this would have been A+
- There was a gentleman at the table (for 4) next to us...he may have been the owner, but was being a bit bossy to the server and made me feel awkward

I think I'd come back for dinner and even for brunch (but ordering something different!!)

name: local-188
review_text:
I am tempted to list the 188 reasons I love this place but I honestly don't have the time plus who wants to read a review that long?

How about top  six reasons? 

1. The food is delicious.  By that I mean yum yum yummy.  Everything we ordered was done right.

2. Service was warm and inviting.

3. Menu is inventive and full of interesting choices.  You can order a main dish or eat more in a tapas style.  I adore sharing dishes so always opt for tapas and the dishes had decent portions and were reasonably priced.  The menu items were creative but also well executed (see item 1 above).

4.  Atmosphere can accommodate an intimate evening with a "special" friend or a more casual night out with friends.

5.  Cocktails!  Lovely selection of interesting and yummy cocktails.  I couldn't drink them all (yet) but they all looked positively scrummy (I may be watching too much Great British Baking shows....).

6.  I hear they serve a fantastic brunch.  I haven't actually tried it yet, but I love me a good brunch.

name: local-188
review_text:
A solid 4.5 stars! I loved all the different small plates, and my mint cocoa! 

Although I do wish they offered some other non alcoholic drinks! Like maybe some kombucha! I think it'd be a great pairing.

name: local-188
review_text: Pretty good food, beautiful drinks for brunch. Their breakfast paella is fun and flavorful- could use more spice but a great meal and takes about 20 mins. Their service is overall very unorganized and slow. Took forever to be seated despite many many open tables and we were asked to leave the bar area even though nobody else wanted to sit there. Their corn beef hash is not as tender as I'd want and their eggs and legs are ok only because of the grits and biscuit side. The chicken itself isn't crispy enough. Overall good experience, beautiful dining area, delicious fruity drinks try the honeysuckle but only go if you're not in a rush.

name: local-188
review_text:
Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

Atmosphere was cosy and classy.

Staff were friendly and seemed to actually enjoy their job. All the smiles!

The wine and food. Wow. Yummy bread with oil for a simple yet elegant starter to munch on while we chatted and sipped our wine. The house paella was worth the ~30 minute wait (we were warned). It was so freaking delicious! 

I am extremely impressed with this restaurant. Highly recommend!

name: local-188
review_text:
In the past, I had only been to Local 188 for nightly cocktails, however, recently my husband and I tried Local 188 for their weekend brunch. 

Want to know the best thing about brunch at Local 188? No. Waits. (typically...). Because Local 188 has an abundance of seating, they are able to seat people regularly without a wait, which is something that I can appreciate. We went to Local 188 around 9:30am, where every other place else had extensive wait times, but we were seated right away. 

As we were seated, we were greeted by our waitress, who was incredibly friendly and nice. My husband and I got a bloody Mary while our friend got the mimosa, all of which were appropriately priced. $8 for a bloody? Sign. Me. Up! Their menu provided a lot of great, unique options, as well as some original staples. My husband got the huevos rancheros, I got the winter scramble, and our friend ordered the breakfast sandwich, but he asked for it on a biscuit instead. 

My husband and friend loved their meals, while I seemed to just like mine. In the winter scramble, there were chunks of butternut squash with egg and cheese. It was good, but I just wish it had a little more oomph to it. However, the bloody Mary was really well-made and had a nice kick to it. 

We will definitely be back to Local 188 for their brunch options, and it's a great place to skip the long waits of other brunch places in the area!

name: local-188
review_text:
One of the best places I've been to:
- Funny staff.
- Lots of tables.
- Great street view.
- Dim lights make quite an atmosphere.
- The best food and fanciest menus I've seen.
- Their chicken is to die for!
- Very good food prices.

name: local-188
review_text: I cannot say enough amazing things about this place. The food was some of the best brunch we have ever had! The place was pretty busy, yet service was really attentive. I got the breakfast sandwich and home fries, cooked perfectly on the thickest English muffin. He got the corned beef hash that was packed with flavor. Everyone should order the ricotta fritters they were insanely delicious. We left feeling so full and happy, a must return!

name: local-188
review_text: Delicious dinner and even better when there are fun non-alcoholic options! Andy took care of us; the service was warm and welcoming and the recommendations were perfect! Will be back the next time we are in the area!

name: local-188
review_text:
I don't wait in brunch lines. I just don't. I get hangry and then impatient, which leads to rapid food consumption. However, I paced myself. I loaded up on blueberries and coffee to sit in line at local 188 for brunch. It even rained on us. 

But totally worth the wait. We got the bacon breakfast sandwich and the mushroom goat cheese spinach scramble. We both went silent when the food arrived as we Hoover vacuummed the deliciousness. Good value and price for brunch. It's worth the wait.

name: local-188
review_text:
Loved this place. Went here by accident due to the very scare parking situation. They have their own parking area in the back. 

This restaurant is huge! It's also very homey, with sofas for seats and old varied mugs, giving this place a very authentic living room feel.

Loved their food, price was decent. Waitor situation was interesting. We didn't have one waiter assigned and took awhile to get water to the table, but overall solid low key food experience.

name: local-188
review_text:
Dear Local 188,

Thank you for being a dream restaurant for Saturday breakfast for families! I almost don't want to write this review for fear of word getting out... but here goes.

To all the parents out there: Picture this, it's Saturday morning and you don't want to cook breakfast, but your two kiddos are hungry and cannot possibly wait in line for breakfast. You hop in the mini-van and drive downtown while you debate your options, and remember there really is no debate. You pull into THE PARKING LOT and have no trouble claiming one of the open spots. Your crew of 4 skip up the path to the front door of Local 188 where the host greets you and seats you immediately. They have two highchairs ready and offer paper for the kids to color. There is almost instantly hot coffee in your mug and soy milk available, as preferred. You have plenty of leg room, and while there are a few others dining, it is quiet. You place your order and are quickly served eggs with local veggies and the best homemade English Muffin with a side of jam and hollandaise (savory & sweet, please). Your kids are still entertained, your coffee is refilled (twice), the jam is slightly sweet and the hollandaise perfectly creamy, and you are humbled by how easy Saturday breakfast can be. One note: you'll notice I did not use the word brunch, as we eat solidly in the 'breakfast' zone.

I can promise other moms out there: the combination of free off-street parking, plenty of seating, and a simple yet delicious menu provides the perfect breakfast for families. I also appreciate that there are vegetarian options, the big bathroom with a changing table, and the causal, laid-back atmosphere. Yes, it's hipster, but Local 188, you will forever have a place in my heart for family breakfast.

I've been for dinner/tapas too (before kids) and while not the most memorable (maybe I'm just tired), it was a crowd pleaser! Deviled eggs, yes please.

name: local-188
review_text: I was a bit underwhlemed by Local 188. I went with the paella and it was too much food with too little seasoning. The menu is rather expensive and rather small. I might go back as evidently the brunch service is popular. But I was not blown away.

name: local-188
review_text:
Brunch, people.  Seriously.  We love the brunch here - every time we're in town, we make a point to brunch out here.  Today was no exception.  The food is fantastic.  We had the mushroom scramble special, which included an amazing english.  What's the big deal, its just an english, you say?  Nope.  Epic.  Also had legs & eggs which is a confit, then fried chicken thigh (yes, really), little pot of cheesy grits, coupla eggs and a delicious, flaky biscuit the size of my head.  I needed a moment alone with that biscuit, lemme tell ya.  And then, in order to ensure weight gain, we shared the blueberry pancake.  Are you picturing a delicious stack?  It's not that at all, but roughly 1Kx better.  It's a pancake-y, cornbread-ish cake, baked in an exuberantly buttered little skillet, then anointed with blueberry compote. (i was watching)

If you can, try to get a seat at the counter by the open kitchen and watch these zen masters do their magic.  The staff are delightful, the food wonderful.  Go hungry and enjoy the funky vibe and fantastic food.  But don't get between me and my biscuit, k?

name: local-188
review_text:
Atmosphere: super cool. I love how there's couches in the middle of the restaurant. It's a real wholesome vibe. They have plants everywhere and the lighting is pretty dim. 

Food: we got the goat cheese appt., and that was spectacular. The cheese was on point, warm and creamy. It had tomatoes mixed in which gave it such a refreshing finish.
