Everything is buttery. Even Paula Deen would be like, "too much butter" as she finished her second piece of yummy Chocolate Donut French Toast, thick, crispy but greasy hash browns, and crazy good grilled banana walnut muffins. 

Get thick or die tryin'.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
If you've not had a grilled muffin from Marcy's, you've not lived. Wasn't even aware such a thing would be life-changing (or even possible - who came up with this idea?!), but now I'm spoiled for regular muffins forever.

There's a bit of a wait (I was here on a Sunday) but the servers make it worth it! They're super nice and helpful, and definitely spread a great vibe throughout the diner.

I also ordered the French toast, over-easy eggs, ham steak, and hashbrowns (which were easily my favourite bit of my breakfast; my gods, the potatoes were good!), and only spent $18 between the two of us (husband got eggs, toast, hashbrowns).

Loved every minute of my time here!

P.S. - "Be careful of gravity!"

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Cash Only. Had breakfast here Monday, Nov 6, 2017. 

If they weren't so snippy toward out-of-town-ers they'd get more stars.  If they recognize you it's like Norm just walked into Cheers.  If they don't then it's like you're from Mars The guffawing with the local yokles was a bit over the top at times.  Ok, you don't like tourists. Message received.

"You can't bring any outside food or drink on here!"
"It's just skim milk for my coffee."
"It's our policy."
"Well, do you have skim milk?"
"No."
"Then who is really being harmed?"

Food was good though.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Simply awesome food (we've had different things and all have been so good) in a friendly fun environment, wait staff is simply amazing and your meal becomes a fun experience with the music around.  and do yourself a favor and ask for a grilled muffin, it's simply worth your calories

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Went to Marcy's due to good reviews on Yelp. The positives are that all of the staff work hard to make sure you are taken care of. The coffee is hot and tasty, plus they have some great music going on in the background. As others stated, it is small only a few booths and then the stools at the counter. I went on a Thursday morning just before 9:00 and was seated at the counter. I was promptly poured a cup of coffee and told the specials. I ordered corned beef hash with over medium eggs and Hobo style hash browns. The portions were huge and eggs done perfectly. The not so good. Hash browns are dehydrated and not fresh, plus the corned beef hash appears to come from a can. As others mentioned it can be hot in the place due to lack of ventilation. Cash only but I was prepared by reading the other reviews.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Incredibly rude! We waited 40 minutes and when seated, the music was blaring so loud that we could not hear the waitress or each other so we thanked the waitress and told her that we would just order food to take out and she could seat someone else in our seats When we stood up I tried to finish my water, (we had driven 3 hrs to get there) and the waitress grabbed the waters out of our hands and another one took the menus - right out of our hands that we were we were trying to read so we would know what to order to carry out.! Then the guy who would have taken our take-out order said it would take 40 minutes for that! So, we left never to return! Good luck if you go!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Have always wanted to try this place and after many stays in Portland, timing was right. Has excellent reputation for service and breakfast food. Usually the line is too long to wait because of size, but very happy I was able to get in on this visit. Super friendly staff and excellent service and food. It is small and was very warm in mid July with only fans for cooling. I did find music was way too loud for size. Hearing Shattered by Rolling Stones blaring for breakfast was a bit much. Overall, great place to try and definitely as unique atmosp

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Driving back home on Sunday, stopped in Portland looking for breakfast. Arrived to find a line but what did we expect from a place with only 5 booths & ten counter seats. It was well worth the 30 minute wait.  We scored counter seats enjoying the conversation with the awesome staff and watching in awe the speed and agility of the cooks!
My omelette was huge and cooked to perfection....and I'm extremely picky about omelettes!  My wife had the Hobo hash browns with eggs which we all shared too! Our son had the steak & eggs also delicious! 
Coffee is a local brew too!  Just a heads up cash only, but don't let that or the line deter you. Definitely worth making the trip back to Portland!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Overall, the food was alright. Good for the price. Would have rated it 4 stars, but serviced left a lot to be desired, especially when we came for morning brunch.  Waited for 45+ min when we were initially told 25. Called our names but then gave our seats to another pair of hangry customers. Then waited another 10 minutes before getting a booth. If you come, prepare to wait or get there on a weekday.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Great early Saturday morning breakfast! Extremely accommodating to our little one also, brought Cheerios and milk for him to snack on, then gave us coffee to go. Food was excellent, had the quiche and the eggs Benedict. Great portion sizes, and of course the grilled muffin was superb!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Great staff and food. One of the best places I've been to in Portland. Ate the shaved chicken and oh my god - it was great. 10/10 would recommend.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: This place was perfect for coffee and a grilled muffin on a rainy morning! Wonderful atmosphere and some really great music to relax by at the counter.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Call first, because their hours change seasonally (and both Yelp and their website are incorrect). Wasted two mornings over last two months learning this the hard way.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
I've been wanting to visit this diner ever since the notorious controversy happened a couple years back (Darla is my hero) and experience the place for myself. Since I was in South Portland at a convention and visiting family, my mom and I decided that it was high time we tried Marcy's Diner. We showed up this past Sunday morning around 8:30 am and were greeted when we walked in by a cool yet polite guy and groovy music like Stevie Wonder and other upbeat tunes of yore. The cool dude promptly seated us at the counter and the dedicated, energetic waitstaff got our beverage order in moments. For food, my mom got the Crustless Quiche (Ham, Broccoli, and Cheese, I believe) and a colorful side salad, since she's trying to be as ketogenic as possible. I ordered D from the "Favorites" menu which included eggs, NY Strip Steak, toast (I opted for an English muffin), and hash browns. Oh my goodness...it was all so good. The steak (ordered Medium Rare) was just the right amount of pink and so juicy! The hash browns were a little like mashed potatoes but they were seasoned just right and the sunny-side up eggs were just runny enough that I could soak them up with my English muffin and hash browns. It was so substantial and stuck to my ribs so well that I barely wanted lunch or dinner later on! 
The only thing I will say as a word of caution is that it's probably best to go solo or just with one other person, since groups of 3 or more had a little bit more of a wait, but between the wait staff that could put the Energizer bunny to shame and the nice greeter/cashier guy, everything was running smoothly like a well-oiled machine.
What I liked the most definitely was how much the staff seemed to support one another and had an enviable amount of synergy. The dishwasher seemed like a new hire and was a little nervous, but the cool guy and the other waitstaff had his back and were giving him tips and encouragement every step of the way. I wish I had that much moral support at any job I've had! The waitress we had most of the time was so funny and had us laughing even at that early hour and took the time to get us a Marcy's Diner shirt (we usually don't get souvenirs but the bacon and eggs in skull and crossbones formation was just a hoot), never once making us feel like a bother. 
Darla was a delight even though I didn't get to say anything to her since she was busy cranking out breakfast. She was just cooking away merrily, grooving to music in her pom pom hat and Hawaiian shirt, and looked like she was having the time of her life.
I would go again in a heartbeat and I feel that a trip to the Portland area isn't complete without a trip to Marcy's Diner!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Traveling up from Pittsburgh and of all the places we have been so far, this is definitely my favorite for food. We didn't know that they closed at noon today but the staff was so nice and accommodating and was not mad at all that we were there a little after closing. The chef was also hilarious. Great food, great service, 12/10 recommend!!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: I have found my new favorite place to eat in Portland and they don't even have seafood! This place was simple phenomenal. The staff was so nice and helped each other so well, and the food was the absolute best I have tasted so far on this trip. 100/10 would recommend and we will be back when we come back to Portland

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
CASH ONLY! (or you will get scolded, so you know it's good!)

I was very impressed by this place.  I had high expectations, assuming this place would piggy back off the Screaming Kid Summer 2015 national publicity (yes, it was big talk even in Kentucky this summer) to skimp on food and service as a result.  But I was wrong; this place was fantastic in all ways possible.

First the atmosphere: it's your classic verbal-abuse diner.  It reminds me of going to Grandma's after a Democratic victory in the Elections: good cookin' but Grandma is pissed.  But seriously, the service is great.  They all have the typical frank but semi-friendly attitude with an accent (aka The Maine Special).  Parking isn't bad at 7:30AM; but good luck finding street parking later (I assume). I've seen this place packed out the Wahzoo (which probably explains why Marcy's successor is pissed 24/7 lol jk), so go early to beat the giant crowds that will eventually engulf this place later in the day!

The food was AMAZING!  I had the Corned Beef Hash Benny which was served on super-buttery Texas Toast and with a side of fluffy and buttery hash browns.  I was in Paula Dean Heaven (minus the scandals). And the prices were grand!  $23.74 for a large breakfast for 2 + 1 coffee.  And they sell their hot sauces!  $5 a bottle, and you get to see them go into the secret underground tunnel of hot sauces (this actually exists!).  I highly recommend the green Gringo Bandito sauce.

Bottom line:  Go here, get yelled at, eat lots of food, try some new hot sauce, and buy some sauces to go (because its still cheaper than going to 90% of other places in Portland).  Nicest staff in Portland, besides the verbal abuse :)

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Warning! Cash only!

Excellent service, and great price. 

Cool little place, I would definitely recommend if you're lookin for breakfast or brunch in Portland, me.

Upgrade your hashbrowns. Totally worth it.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Always good. Had first date with my girlfriend here and now we're always coming back. Good coffee. Grilled muffins always crispy and buttery and muffin-y. My girlfriend loves the hobo hash browns, and my favorite is the hippy French toast. Friendly staff. The loud rock n roll might be off putting at first, but you get used to it, and it benefits the upbeat atmosphere overall. If you have to wait for a spot to clear, there are plenty of nearby shops to check out.
Update: last time the waitress misheard my girlfriend's order! So they charged us for the mistaken order (which was cheaper), brought us all we needed, with a free yummy muffin, and of course coffee to go! Good food AND service.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
The atmosphere of the diner is similar to a cozy hole in the wall style place. Music playing in the background is a mix of the best hits of the 80s and some 90s, bringing back memories of my younger days. 

The menu offers almost endless combinations of breakfast, brunch, and lunch options, almost to hard to choose from. I utilized the specials board to help me pick my meal for the day which was a rendition of a spicy chicken cheesesteak omelet #delicious. The portions are enough to keep this fat boy full all day. 

This is the second time I visited Portland and also the second time I have had breakfast at Marcy's Diner without disappointment. I would whole heartedly recommend this place to anyone in search of an amazing local experience. 

The only suggestion I may offer while eating there, is if you order the grilled muffins, ask them to cut it in quarters not halves and grill them. This being that in halves, the muffin is not warmed all the way through to the back side and who doesn't want more of that buttery crispy grilled crust of goodness.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: This place was aaaaamaze. I am always down to go to a cash only place, because I feel like the food has to be REALLY GOOD if you're going to have the chutzpah to turn away cards and know that people are still going to want to pay. And.... they were right. I'd pay in cash for the rest of my life if it meant that I could eat here every day. We had grilled muffins to start -- one raspberry and one blueberry. So so good. They don't need butter, but I liked them even more with it. I especially liked the raspberry muffin. For my meal I had the E1 (2 slices French toast, 2 eggs, bacon and home fries) with a coffee. I got the captain crunch French toast because I was intrigued. It was so worth it. I somehow ate the entire breakfast and was full all day after. Still. Drooling.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: We went at 1030 on a Thursday and they were closed with no explanation. We made a special trip downtown for it. Very disappointing.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Would have loved to have eaten here but they were so rude with putting me on hold for 10 min and then hanging up without taking the call. Day before they took a phone order and had food ready in 15 minutes. It was very good.

Wanted to do the sAme thing but was told " we don't take phone orders". I said you did yesterday, she then put me on hold never to pick up again. 

They were rude and short on both days.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Way good. We were staying nearby and found this joint on Yelp. It was 8:30 on a Saturday and we lucked out and got a table quickly. A line formed outside as we ate. It's a tiny spot so plan for a snug experience. I hade the Nudge which was 2 eggs, Taylor ham and cheese on a bulky roll. It was perfect and you don't see Taylor ham much outside of Jersey so that was a treat.  The sandwich came with a heaping pile of shredded hash browns, perfect prepping my belly for our upcoming tour on The Maine Brew bus. My wife ordered a western omelet and gushed over how full of stuff it was and how pillowy the eggs were. The ham inside was also delish. 

The staff was super friendly. I know they've got a bad rap for hollering at a toddler but make no mistake, the staff oozed genuinely happy vibes.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Small quirky diner with amazing food! Grilled muffins were amazing and so was the homemade lemonade. Pancakes are huge and fluffy! Place is small so usually a wait but well worth it. Would definitely recommend, look forward to coming back!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Brunch in Portland is great, but constant weekends standing in line for lobster & eggs benedict w/ bloody marys are going to cost you a pretty penny. Break that pattern and come to Marcy's instead! 

It's cute but tattooed, homey but not your grandma's, it's that perfect spot for you to get in, get delicious food, and get out--only to come back again tomorrow for more.

Among two people, I/we split a grilled blueberry muffin($3), peach cobbler pancakes (2 giant ones for $7), & the veggie hash special with eggs/toast ($9.50; $7 w/o eggs/toast). By early lunchtime on a weekday, the muffins were almost all out and I can see why! They're split down the middle and grilled with extra butter and they are DELICIOUS. It's actually quite filling and I wasn't able to finish my pancakes. 

The veggie hash was delicious, the pancakes were tasty but a little too much for me (the granola was a nice touch though!). All in all, I had a nice, hearty meal and a seat at the bar meant that I got to enjoy watching dozens of other hot meals get dished out during my short time there. 

While the food was great, the service stood out even more. From the friendly welcome at the door, to the personal greeting from the chef, every interaction felt genuine and kind. As the fellow at the door said, "We'll see you tomorrow."

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Went on a Sunday morning and was able to get a seat at the counter right away. This diner is on the smaller side, maybe 5 tables and about 10 seats at the counter. Menu is diverse and they had some interesting specials listed. I ordered a raspberry muffin grilled and a slice of spinach and feta quiche with hash-browns. This was way too much food. The muffin was huge and was more than enough to fill me up for breakfast - large portions here. Grilled muffin was great (warm from the grill, soft and moist on the inside with a sugary crunch crumble on top)! The quiche and hash-browns on the other hand were blah and lacking flavor, and I wasn't very impressed and didn't eat more than a couple bites of each of those.
Additionally, I was rather uncomfortable while trying to enjoy my breakfast as it was so hot in the restaurant - much better air ventilation is needed.

Muffin was really tasty and customer service was pretty great and for those two reasons, giving 3 stars, otherwise would have given 2.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Come Hungry! 

My first time in Portland and I'm in love  with Marcy's Place... It's a small corner "dive" restaurant with some booths and counter bar stools. Put your name in at the register, grab a cup of coffee for the outdoor wait and start drooling over the menu selections! 

We were told the wait time would be 30-45 min but, it was more like 20. ( there were 2 of us ). We sat at the counter and watched the grilling magic in progress. Everything they prepared looked amazing in Hearty proportions! Entree sizes were definitely big enough to split. Daily specials are listed on a chalk board.

I had the French toast, eggs, hash browns and sausage breakfast. I left way too much food on my plate.... So stuffed!

Music was great! Very loud but along with the coffee it sure did wake me up! All of the staff were sweet as can be which is a shock if you could see how hard they work. I made sure to tip well cause they deserved it! 

Bring Cash. No Credit.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Marcys diner is tucked in a corner one block over from where Otto's Pizza is on free street. Breakfast is always good. This is your standard diner that has maintained its old school decor. The staff was super nice. I was in Portland and craving diner food. I wanted just plain old simple diner food and Marcys diner was the answer. Breakfast food isn't the priciest so in terms of cost this place isn't too bad- the servings are huge! But they only take cash. They also have iced coffees to go. The restaurant is a bit stuffy. But now that the weather is getting cooler it probably won't be as bad. 

If you're in the mood for diner food with nice staff go to Marcys! But remember bring cash.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
My fiancée and I came to Marcy's Diner THREE times for breakfast. After our first time eating here, we agreed that this was going to be our breakfast spot while we were in town. Okay so let me get started: 

The place is cozy and awesome! The decor is cool and they play music from the 70's, 80's and 90's, so you'll most likely be jamming while waiting and/or eating (the radio station is 100.9). The wait time really wasn't crazy. Our first time, the super cool host gave us about a 20 minute wait and it felt like we got seated a lot faster. The second day, he gave us a 25 minute wait and it was just about right. Third day, Sunday, we got there around 8:15 AM and there was no wait. The waitresses are very attentive, polite, high energy and very cool to chat with. This place is hoppin'! One of my favorite things about Marcy's diner is that they have these bowls filled with Cabot butter and Hood half and half on each table. I love extra butter and love my coffee VERY light, so it was very convenient.

Darla (owner) is a firecracker and you can tell that she is passionate about her food and her business. She is in there cooking, greeting and keeps open communication with the staff. She even took a picture with us!

The food: there was nothing average about the food. AT ALL. It was off-the-hook! The first day we ordered a grilled raspberry muffin to share. It was toasty and soft in all the right places. It wasn't too sweet or bland. For our meals the first day, we had scrambled eggs with hash browns. The eggs were fluffy and perfect. The hash browns had a crispy top and very soft inside. Again, perfect. The Texas toast that comes on the side is delicious.

The second day, we ordered our own grilled muffins. This time I got blueberry and my fiancée got raspberry again. For our meals, he got the daily special which was the angel cake French toast topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream and I got an Italian omelette with onions and Texas toast. We were more than satisfied with our meals. Everything tasted fresh and nothing was over or under cooked.

I tried the Spanish omelette on Sunday and in pictures it doesn't look too appealing, but it was delicious. We ordered 4 muffins for the road, 2 blueberry and 2 raspberry. Also, the iced coffee is damn good!

Overall the service was consistently awesome, as was the food. We are DEFINITELY coming back to Marcy's Diner.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
We were up SUPER early one morning and this was one of the few restaurants that were opened that early. This place really reminded me of a diner shop with the staff knowing who their regulars are. I read somewhere that they yell at people so we were on our best behaviors which we didn't get yelled at in the end. 

The portions here are enormous and definitely worth it. We ordered one of their breakfast platters (e.g. eggs, ham) and that filled us for a while. I also enjoyed the muffins a lot! I believe that is what they're known for and you won't be disappointed. 

Don't forget to bring cash since it's cash only. It's a small place so you might have to wait in line if you're going during prime time.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
If breakfast is the most important meal of the day, do yourself a favor and DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE!! It is everything a diner should be! Great coffee and conversation. The staff is outstanding. The atmosphere is just fantastic. 

Now, the food....holy cow! Our hotel wanted to charge $10/person for breakfast, so we opted here instead. Everything we ordered was under $10. We started with the "famous" grilled muffin. Who knew this was a thing! I'm glad we didn't skip past this. What an awesome treat. I had the pot-roast hash and hash browns hobo style! Just do yourself a favor and go for it. It's a plate full of food, and each bite is better than the last. My wife had the BLT on a bagel and my daughter had the pancakes. There were NO leftovers. My wife remarked several times about how good the coffee was too!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Everything was good and large servings. We got the grilled muffins and a burrito that we split! Not a ton of room but we ended up being seated at the bar which was a pretty cool place. There was a wait and I presume this place always does have one.

Definitely a Meal you will want to nap after and don't come if your on a diet Bc you will eat everything !

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Continuing on my recent breakfast fixation i decided to try Marcy's today. I was kinda hoping for an eggs benedict. But i found a breakfast club made on three slices of bagel. Really cool!! Really delish hash browns. And the bacon i could go on for days about. The sandwhich was perfect and huge. With what seemed like 3 orders of hash browns all for 8$... After yesterday that was a big plus. 

The people working there are wonderfully personable, friendly, and colorful. They even literally crawl out of the floor from time to time (u have to be there kinda thing).. 

But CASH only.. ;-)

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
I've only been here once but I REALLY enjoyed it. Its a nice casual place to have breakfast when you just want to enjoy home-cooked food and the company you're with. 

I had a grilled lemon muffin and a fresh fruit bowl - the fresh fruit bowl had 7 different fruits in it, and I feel like thats worth mentioning because it SUCKS to get a fruit bowl that only has cantaloupe and honey dew in it. At Marcy's they do it right. My dining partner had a huge french toast breakfast with all the sides and LOVED it. Last thing about the food, they have their own creamer and both it and the coffee are really good - just like a really good simple cup of coffee. 

Things to know:
- It's cash only
- It's small - they only have a few booths and a counter, but they turn them over fairly quickly and I'd say its worth the wait. Just don't come here with a big group (4+).

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Great experience. Friendly, helpful staff. Solid food. Honey bun French toast was excellent, prices were reasonable (lower than other options in the area). Local feel, even as a visitor just passing through. Felt a bit like a small town out west or down south. Went alone, sat at the bar, and loved it! A highlight of my brief stay in Portland.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Large portions, delicious food = great value.  
I couldn't decide if I wanted raspberry or chocolate chip pancakes, so to compromise I was going to have one of each. The waitress recommended getting raspberries and chocolate chips in both. So glad I did because they were amazing, AND HUGE!

The kitchen and sink are right in front of the bar counter and I loved it! Reminded me when I visit home and walk in the kitchen to the smell of bacon and eggs. They blast rock music and it made for a really fun atmosphere. The servers are nice and keep it real, and gave great advice on some other local places to visit.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Came here for Bruch and it was such a nice surprise. The intimate feel of the place makes it seem like you're one of the locals just there for your breakfast. Got the hash browns, eggs and chocolate chip pancake. Good! The hash browns were more mashed than the shredded which was an enjoyable change to what I'm used to. Also if you want hot sauce they bring you a whole bucket with a variety of flavors, it's not a one spice type of Tabasco place (though the do have Tabasco). Given its size, I thought they would have one unisex bathroom but they actually had two rooms-one men's one woman's- and in that they had a little sink station and then a separate room for the toilet! Delightful.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: This diner lived up to its reputation! We had to wait a little bit, but it was worth the wait! We sat at the bar top and ordered French toast, scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, and the peppered steak burger. It was all very delicious! The sausage was great quality and not processed. We got to watch the cooks/servers work, and they definitely know what they're doing! Btw it's cash only! They even offered us hot coffee while we waited for a seat! Great service and food!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
I had the special blueberry grilled muffin and veggie omelet with hash brown and toast. My husband had the amazing hobo hash browns. It's an open kitchen, everything is made fresh in front of you.  

Best place for breakfast in Portland Maine!! We waited for an hour to get a seat! The waiting time in this diner is over an hour during anytime of the day, but it is worth it. The guy at the reception bribed me with a free grilled muffin to give up a table of 4. Friendly people. Nice place to start your day. This is a cash only place.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Great food. Staff was sweet and fun. The grilled muffin was amazing. Quick service. Small, decor is nothing fancy, just stuff they thought was fun.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
I really don't enjoy the "I Got Yelled at at Marcy's" thing they've got going.  

I was seated at the bar which is fine.  The chicken salad club had too much mayo for my taste.  My husband's shaved beef was good but the hash browns were the best thing!  A great golden brown crust intertwined with soft potatoes made these beyond perfect!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
This place is the real deal.  We were told an hour wait, the reality was more like 20 minutes, which was nice. 

I got the Neuge, because when you see Taylor Ham on a breakfast sandwich, you order it.  I also got a side of bacon, which was six pieces of maple smoked goodness.  

The coffee was piping hot and the flavored cream was a nice touch.  I also appreciated that our waitress never let our cups approach getting empty.  

Great spot and highly recommended.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Fantastic breakfast spot.
Nice atmosphere.
Fresh, hot, delicious breakfast.
Incredible homemade muffins.
Outstanding staff with very friendly and efficient service

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: The place has little ventilation. Super hot inside even when only 70 degrees outside. Waited for 20 min to get a table and watched as another couple that came in after me was seated. There was another empty booth available. I asked the hostess to be seated there. She told me no, she was going by a list. I pointed to my name on her list with the couple's name under mine crossed out. She said she called my name and no one answered. I told her I was standing beside her the entire time and that she most certainly didn't. She again stated she did in her snide millennial tone. I walked out never to visit again. Bayside American Cafe has better food without the snark.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
I did NOT get yelled at while at Marcy's - I guess I was well behaved enough. Actually, we had a couple of nice breakfasts here while in Maine. The service was quick and friendly and the food was abundant. 

The pancakes were pretty good. I see why that mom ordered three giant ones for her screaming baby. The coffee was ok. The meats were pretty saturated with salt. Fortunately, the buckets of hot sauce and easy access syrup can help fix that.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: Looking for a great breakfast while in Portland, look no farther, you've found it at Marcy's Diner.  But know this, get there early as the place is small and the line happens quickly.  The wait staff are all so friendly and they make you feel like you're a local or one of the family, it was awesome.  I had a full and hearty veggie omelette which was excellent.  I discovered the most delicious raisin bread I've ever had; just full of tons of plump raisins.  There were 4 of us and even though the restaurant was packed we had great service, delicious food and we absolutely did not feel rushed.  This is a must visit, you'll be happy to say you've had breakfast at Marcy's Diner!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: This was one of the best breakfast places I have ever eaten in.  We were on vacation from Miami Florida and my cousin recommended this place. It is small and cozy and we did not have to wait long (it was Thursday). We were greeted by the friendly staff. We first ordered the grilled blueberry muffin.  It was so good we ordered one to go! The eggs were cooked perfectly. The pancakes are the size of hubcaps so my son only ordered one. He ate the whole thing! The hashbrowns were cooked well also. I wish we had a Marcy's diner in Miami!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: We were in town for a concert a few weeks ago. Have never been to this area. Pleasantly surprised to have found this diner. Major plus- it happened to be on a Monday which is apparently metal Monday. Fantastic! The playlist was amazing, and the food was delicious. Wish I had a place like this in my hometown!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Breakfast here was tasty but not anything mind-blowing. I had basic eggs, hashbrowns and toast. For toast they offer Texas toast cooked on the grill, which is excellent, but the eggs were mediocre and the hashbrowns were undercooked and had a VERY strong flavor of pork (none of my other grilled food had this flavor, so I think there was pork fat or something like that added to the hashbrowns as opposed to simply the effects of being cooked next to bacon on the grill). I don't normally eat pork and the flavor was strong enough that I had to give the hashbrowns to my husband.
I also had a grilled blueberry muffin. The muffin itself was good - very large and with a nice crumbly topping, but the fact that it was so large meant that not much of the muffin's surface area got grilled. I've had grilled muffins elsewhere that I liked more.
We only had to wait about 15 minutes but we went at 9 am on a Friday. I would say this place is a good option if you can catch it without a wait, but it's not something I'd wait in a long line for. It's a fairly standard diner, homey and with tasty, cheap greasy spoon food, but compared to many other Portland eateries it's not very unique.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Hubby and I were in town today. No kiddos, were celebrating our anniversary and Thanksgiving this week. 
We were still on California time, so we barely made it in time to grab some of the best damn food we've ever had!
If you can imagine the best ever comfort food and multiply it by 10000, you got Marcy's Diner!
The actual restaurant is very cozy. It's an open grill with bar top service and a few booths. 
Daily specials are posted on chalk boards colorfully displayed underneath the cool merchandise display 
We ordered the grilled banana muffin and grilled blueberry muffin, quiche, potatoes and French Toast. 
Everything was beyond delicious! Servings are plentiful. I had to take a to go box for the yummy potatoes! 
The servers are friendly and on top of their game.  Did I say they also have awesome coffee!? 
This is a one of a kind gem located in the heart of downtown Portland. 
Don't miss this place next time you're in town. You won't regret it! 
I'll be back.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Marcy's is the one and only restaurant I dined in during my 24 hour stay in Portland and we stumbled upon it early Sunday morning when we awoke in our hotel room, were starving and craved more than the complimentary continental breakfast being offered.  

We arrived around 9:30 a.m. to a full house!  Mind you, this diner is very small; there are around 10-12 counter seats and 5 or so very narrow booths.  Thankfully, we only had about a 5 minute wait but we were both glad we walked in when we did because within minutes there were 4 other couples waiting to be seated.

Service is fast and friendly.  Typical breakfast diner atmosphere but it was definitely warm and welcoming.  Our waitress was pleasant and attentive.  I didn't poke much around at the menu because I usually eat the same things for breakfast; I ordered 2 eggs, hash-browns and an english muffin.  My date ordered eggs over-easy, hash-browns, hash and an english muffin which he enjoyed and ate every last bite where as I, on the other hand, am a food snob.  The scrambled eggs were watery and warm and the hash-browns were undercooked, the only thing I really liked was the english muffin.  Even the coffee was cheap tasting.  

I've always been of the opinion that it's kind of hard to screw up breakfast foods, but I guess I was wrong.  Was it the absolute worst food I've ever eaten?  No.  Would I suggest that one of my friends stop by Marcy's for a fulfilling and delicious breakfast?  No.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Excellent hot breakfast! Quick staff. Been there several times and each time it was consistent and delicious! 

The owner is a BOSS!! She runs that place tight and doesn't skip a beat! Very smooth and amazing to see how quick they are!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Why wouldn't you eat at Marcy's Diner? It's a kick@$$ atmosphere, old school breakfast diner where the owner works her tail off for her customers. Friendly, fun, metal Mondays, for goodness sake.

The food is awesome breakfast fare and American lunch, there's literally something for everyone, the grilled muffins are especially tasty! Everyone is happy, loves their job and the clientele feel the same way. It's a bustling cozy place. You'll love it!

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
4 stars for service
2 stars for food overall, except the grilled raspberry muffin, which is def a 5 star! 

I had heard about Marcy's for a long time and wanted to try it out, especially after it made news over the infant tantrum vs owner spectacle that went down a few months ago. 

First of all, service we got was excellent. No shrieking baby helps, I'm sure. They were friendly, warm and fun. Although our 1 hour wait on a Saturday at 11 was no fun at all. 

Our server had recommended her personal favorite: the raspberry muffin grilled, and that was highlight of our breakfast. 

Marcy's has pretty typical greasy diner food, but I was sorely sorely disappointed with the cinnamon swirl pancake of the day that we ordered. There was hardly any cinnamon flavor and the whole pancake itself tasted like bacon grease. 

Don't get me wrong, I love my bacon bits. Just not when I'm expecting a sweet, cinammony pancake! (for that, I have to say that Bayside cafe has it down!) 

The breakfast burrito I also ordered was alright. It wasn't a standout, just tasted...fine. Lots of cheese and grease with the eggs. 

Price was really inexpensive. Good place to go for greasy grub if you don't mind the wait (or the grease). I probably will be around the block trying out other diners before heading back.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
Small diner that seats about 25 people. Very cozy atmosphere. Food is just ok, I wouldn't come back. 

I got the B2 - 2 eggs, ham steak, hash browns, toast $6.50. Portions are fairly large considering the price but the food is under seasoned. The hash Browns were very mushy so barely ate them.The ham steak was recommended by the staff and it was the best thing on my plate. Get the TIGER SAUCE to go with it!

Got a regular coffee, it is just ok

Got here at noon and they were out of one of the specials and only had two muffins left so GET THERE EARLY.

The only source of air are fans so it's pretty warm. If you are looking for have a meal while enjoying the breezy Maine weather, this is not it.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text:
This small eater is great with excellent food all around and low prices.  Just a block and a half from the Portland Museum of Art.

We had one dish with corned beef hash, potatoes, and rye bread toast.  The portions were generous, the food came out piping hot, and everything was really fresh and delicious, tasting like homemade.  The other plate was a steak and cheese sandwich with high quality beef, which you usually do not get.  The onions were perfectly done.  Also a big portion.

Service was superb.  The waitperson came by frequently to refill our glasses and sincerely wanted to know how we liked our meal.  

The next time I am in Portland or passing through, this will be the first food establishment I hit.
Marcy's truly deserved the 5 star rating from other reviewers.

name: marcy's-diner
review_text: What an awesome traditional American diner! Fast service and great food. On a Wednesday morning in October, I was surprised at how packed this diner stays-- I guess that just goes to show how popular this place is. Anyways, if you're visiting Portland for a few days, this is a fun place to stop for breakfast.

name: terlingua
review_text:
What a great location.  I heard about it from friends and decided to give it a whirl with a colleague.  He had never been, so it seemed like a great idea.  Parking can sometimes be a challenge on Washington Ave, but be patient.  There are spaces around the neighborhood.

The location is small, but they fit in plenty of seating without feeling too crowded.  The menu is great and offers a variety of choices for your varied taste buds.

Our meal was fantastic and just the right portion for what we needed and wanted.  Did not feel stuffed from the meal and it was not over priced, in my opinion for what you get and the taste.  Well done.

I truly enjoyed my visit and would do it again.  Thank you

name: terlingua
review_text:
The food is good, but the portion sizes are a complete joke. You'd need to order 3 entrees to have a full meal. Way overpriced. Also, what restaurant charges for chips and salsa?

Response:
I have never been to a restaurant that charges for chips and salsa, including many that make their own salsa from scratch. Tomatoes are cheap. 
For dinner, we each had an order of fish tacos or brisket tacos. Speaking from experience with many restaurants serving tacos, businesses typically serve 3 or more tacos with an entrèe. This place serves you 2 small tacos for the same price. All 4 of us in our party felt dissatisfied with what was served. I would not eat here again unless plate sizes were revised to be fair. Please adjust your menu to be fair to consumers.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I WAS HOOTING AND A HOLLERING WHEN I CAME IN. The UT flag hanging outside the shop, a Wille Nelson art mural by the bar, a little drawn picture of the Big Bend?! YUP THIS FEELS LIKE HOME. Like all Mexican restaurants, we started with the tortilla chips and the salsa-- usually complimentary, here it is $4. The salsa... the consistency was thick like PASTA & it tasted bitter too!! I got goosebumps from my first bite...  and not in the good way! After a few more bites to try to figure what was going on, we called it quits and just ate the remainder of our chips.

We ordered the next Texas thing you can get. The Barbecue Board. Yes, this was the most expensive item on the menu. It came with Chicken & Pork Shoulder, Grits & Mushrooms (this could have been MUCH better), Cornbread (they actually did a good job on this), and we ordered a side of tortillas...which btw they only give you two. The chicken & the pork shoulder were moist and burnt perfectly. However, we got bored of this real fast. 

They offered Habanero Sauce, Barbeque Sauce, and a Vinegar Chili Sauce as well. But, even the sauces disappointed. The Habanero literally tasted like spicy, orange water. No flavor. Nothing exceptional. The Barbeque Sauce was tooo sweet, and the Vinegar Chili was just okay. 

We ordered the $5 Happy Hour Margaritas as well. These weren't too bad. Except, for the Chili rim, I would suggest mixing the salt AND the chili for flavor.

name: terlingua
review_text: I've now been here twice (brunch and Sunday Neighborhood dinner) and everything I or my companions have gotten has been delicious (and excellent service) which leads me to believe it deserves 5 stars. This is Tex Mex done right! One of my favorite things I've now had here is the deviled eggs with smoked shrimp. Will be attempting to recreate that at home. My stomach is growling just thinking about the cheesesteak I had. Brunch, dinner, Sunday neighborhood dinner (smaller menu and dinner run 5-9)- it's all good. Make sure to get there early because the small dining room fills up fast!

name: terlingua
review_text:
Went on a Saturday night. Called ahead just to get an idea of how long the wait was. He told me for a 2 top that people would be leaving in 10-15 minutes so if we got there about that time then none. We rushed right over and he was right. We sat right away.

Inside is small only about 8 tables and a bar. Staff is friendly. They have beer on tap, cocktails and even a few drinks with no alcohol.

Food wise- tortilla soup was on point and delicious. It does have a little bit on a kick. I've been struggling with a cold and coughing and it sent me into a coughing fit. Normally the heat level would have been fine, but I couldn't hack it, pun intended.  I then got fish tacos which were very good. The haddock had the most amazing crunch topped with slaw, crema and siracha. The only thing that would have made it better was avocado. My husband got brisket, it came with 3 slices and he liked it. He also got collard greens and baked beans. He loved the beans and said it was the best part.

Staff- super friendly. Made the experience even more enjoyable.

Will we be back? For sure.

name: terlingua
review_text: This is a great spot. The blend of tastes is excellent. We had the brisket tacos and they were so good. Great margaritas and local microbrews. Small, cozy atmosphere.

name: terlingua
review_text: An adorable gem. The atmosphere is fun and eclectic and the space is well laid out. I enjoyed the flight of tequila with the jalepeno shrimp which I felt did need more spice. The tortilla soup was okay but the broth was thinner than what I expected and the meat a little stringy. The avocados on top of the soup were a nice touch. Order the bbq board. It's so much fun when it comes out and tasting the array was definitely the highlight. The pork shoulder has too much fat unrendered but was succulent. The brisket and sausage were fine. The grit cake with spinach was an explosion of butter and I didn't care for it at all. The slaw was bright and necessary to cut through the richness of the meat. Overall really fun and different and come hungry for meat. Oh and for some reason they have happy hour 2-9pm on Wednesday's so check that out.

name: terlingua
review_text: Overall this place is pretty good. The first time I came here I had some tacos, I think they were brisket tacos. Those were delicious. My friend got some smoked trout deviled eggs and those were really good as well. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I came all the way down here for brunch on a sat and when I got the menu, it was completely different then the one that was online. The online menu has sandwiches and I was a bit disappointed by the menu that was presented to me because the choices were so limited.. when I asked the server about he just said that he was sorry and that they haven't update the menu online yet. We ended up leaving but then came back the next day with some friends (because they were from out of town and really wanted to try this place)To our surprise the menu was completely different (on Sunday) and there were sandwiches on the menu! So I ordered a hamburger. The meat was sooooo good. Super flavorful. I got an egg added but it was over cooked :( it was a bland, over hard egg and I was a little sad. But overall it's a cute spot to eat. The prices are not bad compared to other places in Portland. I am coming back to get the meat platter soon, my mouth waters every time I see it!

name: terlingua
review_text:
Walked in as a party of 10 on a weeknight and were sat immediately, we were very impressed at how accommodating they were to such a large party! 

Restaurant is on the smaller side, but has a bar and quite a few tables. Service was excellent, especially considering most of us needed separate checks and we were all ordering cocktails. 
-"eve" cocktail- very good, some concoction of liquor and elderberry. Would order this again. 
-Burnt ends appetizer- tried some of this. very good. small portion for $8.
-Street brisket tacos. Delicious, excellent flavor. 2 for $9. Would come back for this. 
-Jalapeno cornbread- large portion for $2. The star of the show. EAT ALL OF THISSSS

Would totally come back to this restaurant, excellent service and food is good, portions a little on the small side for the price.

name: terlingua
review_text:
First, I have to mention that we were a walk in party of ten. A slightly tipsy party of 10. They were awesome and quickly accommodated us. 
Kayla, our server, was amazing!!! I mean above and beyond! Thank you! 
The restaurant itself is small, but it is not crowded or stuffy. Super cute decor, full bar, plenty of tables. 
Kayla quickly brought us water and took out drink orders. I got the Coronita-Rita, it was pretty good. 
The burnt ends appetizer was delicious, melt in your mouth yummy. The street tacos were also fantastic. My favorite thing though, was hands down, the corn bread!!! So good!! 
The prices were about average for small plates in Portland. You are definitely paying for the quality. The food is fresh and well made. If you have an opportunity to get the brisket, don't hesitate.

name: terlingua
review_text:
Woah. Just woah. 

I'm a recent transplant to Portland from San Francisco, and Terlingua has very quickly become my go-to dinner spot. Located right on restaurant row, it's just down the street from where I live - lucky me! My two favorites are the margaritas on tap, and the fish tacos. These aren't just any old fish tacos...these are eyes-roll-back-in-your-head fish tacos. Easily the very best I've ever had in my life. So crispy and flavorful. They are also known for their BBQ which is always a hit with my husband.

Terlingua is a cozy little spot with limited seating, so expect a wait if you're coming on a weekend night. When you check in, the hostess will take your number and call you when the table is ready so you can bar hop on Washington while you wait for your table to be ready. If you dig margaritas, tacos and BBQ, Terlingua is NOT to be missed!

name: terlingua
review_text:
It's Tex-Mex BBQ ... kinda. 
Nice environment. Small space yumminess.
The food was very good...but I wasn't excited about my adult drink, so I haven't ordered another again. I've visited three or four times. 
Worth the trip!

name: terlingua
review_text: I was so excited to go here at the recommendation of my friend. Sadly, the bartender was patronizing and rude, so I lost my appetite. Fortunately, there are many other places in the area where you will experience positive service.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I had been wanting to try Terlingua since moving to Portland. I have walked by numerous times, and I have always been struck by the amazing smell of the food. In the summer, they also have some outside seating set up, and I have always checked out the food that people were eating, and it looked great! 

I finally got a chance to try Terlingua for myself on a Tuesday evening with a party of 10 people. Being that we didn't make a reservation, we walked in hoping that we could be seated, even though it was busy. The restaurant is generally smaller with limited seating, however, they were extremely accommodating and made a place for us to sit in the restaurant. 

We were quickly greeted by our waitress, Kayla, who was really personable and nice, and she took our drink order. I ended up getting the sangria, which was really good and it was only $6! They had other cocktail options which were each around the $8-$10 range, and they had some beer and wine options. 

For my meal, I ended up getting the Street Tacos ($9) which were made with brisket, and I ordered slaw ($2) and the slow-cooked greens with pork belly ($3). Their meals are served really nicely on boards and pieces of slate, which appeals to their general aesthetic. The tacos were small, but when I think of their price, it makes sense that you get two small-er tacos. The flavors of the tacos were really, really good. The brisket was smokey and fell-apart-tender. The slaw was more pickled than a typical slaw, but it was good, and the greens were amazing! They also have some spicy vinegar at each table, which I also put on everything! It was so, so good!

Overall, Terlingua is doing what it does well. I wish their portions were just a bit bigger, but their prices are decent. Unfortunately, I left the restaurant still feeling a bit hungry, so that's why I gave four stars. Incredibly nice staff and great tasting food!

name: terlingua
review_text: Saw this place after we were finished chowing down on some crispy tacos right up the street putting the hammer down. We can't pass a good barbecue spot without trying it out. The girl got the pulled pork Sammie and I'm trying the brisket and we'll just mooch a little off each other to see who's is better. The brisket was great but I'm going to have to give the nod to the pork, same with the girl. Waitress was just as nice as could be.

name: terlingua
review_text: Okay, I can be wrong (rarely) but either I've changed or they've changed because the service is (or has become) excellent and the food is prettier, tastier, and has just the right punch....again, is it me or them?  I could eat the tortilla soup all day long and the ribs we got at lunch were applause worthy!  I am not a big drinker but the happy hour beer and cocktail menu is too good to miss....so yes, I went with a Wilson's Basement (a shot of tequila and a beer chaser) which paired perfectly with the soup, the ribs and oh the tortilla chips and salsa....oh, the salsa, oh the chips....yeah, it's a 5-star place all the way.

name: terlingua
review_text:
This place was a carnivore's dream. We moved here from Texas not too long ago and had been searching around the area for a good BBQ place. I get that we aren't going to get the stuff we were used to, but was hopping to get something at least a little close. This place did the job. 

We got the BBQ board which had sausage, brisket, pork belly, slaw, potato salad, and jalopeno corn bread. The portions had me wishing for more, but again.. i'm not in Texas. The meat was cooked perfectly, and it was easily the best I've had in the area. If you looking for a good meaty meal, check these guys out!

name: terlingua
review_text: Terlingua! Thank you for your service. Bringing the  southwest to Maine. We have seen this done before, time and time again but y'all are doing it right. It is extremely difficult to get the real deal up here. Growing up in the Southwest I often crave this style food and Terlingua fills that void. They have a smaller dining room and bar- so plan on going early or having a little bit of a wait. I'll probably be there taking up a seat...

name: terlingua
review_text: While in town on vacation we took a foodie tour and this restaurant was one of our stops. We regret not being able to eat more food here or being able to come back for more. This restaurant had a unique and fresh looking menu with some items that apparently change. We were served pork belly lettuce wraps with the most perfectly smoked pork belly that melted in your mouth. The barbecue sauce was amazing as well, house-made. The restaurant is small, quaint, relaxing. The service was great and friendly. We hope to make it back to Maine one day to visit this restaurant and a few other amazing ones in this neat area of town.

name: terlingua
review_text:
We drove by on a quick lap thru back bay and checking out the recent development in this part of town. The name of this place (advertising at work) peaked my interest and the fact they had a happy hour sold the deal. 

Upon being warmly welcomed into this gem, we sat at the bar, some great liquid options- I started with the fresh margarita which was very solid and on special, and  then dipped into their impressive craft beer collection, a must of a Portland establishment. 

As for chow, we snacked on the queso and the deviled eggs. Both were phenomenal, the queso was unique and packed just the right punch and the deviled eggs were nothing shy of phenomenal. (Pro tip: you get more queso then chips but they'll bring you more chips) Great presentation on both, especially considering these were just happy hour apps. You can tell this place takes pride in what they're putting out.

name: terlingua
review_text: Came here for lunch again today.  This place continues to be one of the better places in Portland.  The drink menu and food are both great.

name: terlingua
review_text:
As a party of 10, Terlingua gained some huge brownie points from me for being able to accommodate us without any wait (also huge thanks to the kind couple that moved tables to help accommodate us!)

Terlingua is a super cute Latin American place in the East End. The inside is rather small but has a good amount of tables and bar space for seating.

As a party of 10, our server was pretty great. She did an awesome job of checking in on us and assisting anyone when needed.

I started off with the house margarita. Honestly, there was nothing exciting about this. Wasn't the best but also wasn't horrible. 

For food, I ordered the brisket street tacos, the jalapeño cornbread, and the beans.
The street tacos came with two small tacos. I have to say that these were DELICIOUS. I probably could have eaten at least 10. The cornbread was also fantastic.
Unfortunately they forgot about my beans at first but were quick to get them to me once realized. Once received and consumed, these too were absolutely delicious.

My only con about this place is their portion sizes. The portions are pretty small and given how good everything tastes you will definitely be wanting more. However, I will also say that the prices are very reasonable so you can order more than one thing... I just wish I knew this in advance.

Will definitely return!

name: terlingua
review_text: We've stopped here twice for lunch when traveling into Portland and loved it both times! It's a really quaint spot with a great menu and nicely plated dishes. The BBQ pork sandwich is fabulous as have been the crispy tacos, Frio Pie and Tortilla soup. We've never had to wait for a table. Check it out - you won't be disappointed!

name: terlingua
review_text:
Ok...let me start by saying the food was delicious. I had the daily BBQ lunch platter which was ribs, collards, beans, & cornbread. The platter changes depending on the day. My wife had a yellow tail ceviche tostada, a lunch special. All ingredients fresh & portions ample for lunch & for the cost.

The restaurant is very small. Maybe 10 tables tops. It has a big emphasis on the bar. It's really much more of a hipster spot and NOT a southern barbecue joint. The menu of a regular bbq place would feature its meats (ie., chicken, pulled pork, brisket, sausage,& ribs) in a "by the lb" price and have a selection of combos. There's almost none of that here. My rib platter had 4 small ribs. Granted it was only $12.

The real tell came as my wife was still hungry after her lunch so she ordered a cup of red chili. She said to the waiter "can I have cornbread w it?". He said that normally if did not come w cornbread but "I'll take care of you". It was very nice of him. She was happy. BUT no cornbread with chili? 

Which brings me to my overall observation: this restaurant is a hipster joint that serves good bbq albeit in a very "precious" way. There's nothing precious about cornbread or bbq, for that matter. Time with friends and family is precious. Food is not. Make more cornbread.

They deserve 4 stars for the food. It was tasty. The waiter/bartender was slightly inattentive. He never asked us what we'd like to drink so we just stuck with water. He also needs to check in with his tables a bit more often. It wasn't that busy.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I've been to this place twice now so that probably means I'm eligible to give a review. The place is cute and small which is nice once you're seated, but can be a pain if you have to wait for a table. The menu is quite concise but the quality has been generally pretty good both teams, although apparently the menu changes often so take my comments with a grain of salt. Can't go wrong with any of the tacos!

My only gripe is how loud they have whatever medium of music being played. The first time I went there was a drummer and a sax inside the place and it was the like having someone scream in your eardrum for an hour. The second time, during dinner, the speakers in the place were just turned up way too loud to have a comfortable, normal speaking level conversation. I swear this isn't me being nitpicky or acting like a prima dona - be prepared to nearly yell to your friend while eating.

name: terlingua
review_text: Fantastic experience with a family of 5. Service was incredible. Drinks were perfect, fun and different. Now let's get to what should get an 11 rating...the food! I travel for work and have had some of the countries best BBQ (Franklin) and Mexican in my travels. This little gem delivers the goods and is on par and uniquely better with both offerings and how they are blended together. I'll be back often.

name: terlingua
review_text: I love Terlingua. Adobe Pork, just try it! I'm drooling just remembering it. Oh, and don't forget a side of cheesy cauliflower ! Dreamy

name: terlingua
review_text:
From the manager "I look forward to your review on yelp". My two friends ordered a drink at the bar. They saw an available table outside and went to tell the rest of us to come over. The bartender literally ran after them--grabbed the drinks out of their hands and dramatically threw them in the street like they were children. We went back into the restaurant to request a refund for the drinks that were thrown out. That's all. They gave us an refund-eventually. Appreciate that...would never go back. Thanks for the refund.

Response: Just a heads up--you have picnic tables outside your restaurant. No one was taking your drinks to another bar.  Just still trying to wrap my head around the fact that the first response was to run after someone while yelling and then throw their drinks on the ground. Seems a bit overkill, no?  A simple "hey girl, you have to drink that inside the building" didn't cross your mind? So much drama! I guess if you want dinner and a show-go here. I'm sure the food is decent. Cheers!

name: terlingua
review_text: First time, and it did not disappoint! Sunday's is "Neighborhood Night" with a smaller menu, so go early because some items do run out. The deviled eggs with tuna was excellent, as were the fish tacos. And be sure to try a Kombucha-Rita. It's local and delicious. Small setup, fun atmosphere, and great service from the bartender Erin. We'll be back!

name: terlingua
review_text:
Was a great place ! We came in Saturday afternoon with a party of 6. 

Service was great and the food - WOW ! 

Will definitely come back again  as we all agreed this is our new favorite spot in Portland :-) 

Keep it up guys A+++

name: terlingua
review_text:
Truthfully, I can only really give this a 3.5 for what I've experienced (but I give it the 4 because I have high expectations that the rest of the menu is great). I can't give an extended review here because I've only been in briefly (and unfortunately it was at that awkward time between lunch and dinner when there's a limited menu). Mom and I shared the deviled eggs as an app, and both had the green chile as an entree. Portland doesn't have much in the Latin American genre for dining, so I had been checking out the food-porn on Yelp here for a while. As expected, food was good. 

*Oh, and I like when appetizers come in odd numbers because it allows one person, at each dining experience, to practice being the bigger person. Literally, or figuratively you might ask? You be the judge...

It was a quiet afternoon, and there were maybe only 2 other people here when we stopped in. The ambiance was a little quiet and awkward, and also it seemed kind of weird with the server. I felt like maybe our timing was an inconvenience, plus sometimes my mom acts like she just got to America even though she's been here for over 30 years. Thus, I'll have to go back sometime, and try a dinner. I sense that the vibe, the options, and the overall experience would be much better. Plus, Id prefer to be on a hot date, and not with my mother - because that changes everything. I do have to give props to her, though; she's got the ability to make me appreciate even the most fowl, cheap tequila by her mere presence. That's a pretty amazing super power if you ask me #mothers. I digress...

I also recall seeing some Philadelphia paraphernalia on the walls. I had a little PTSD from the nightmares of living in that alleged city of brotherly love, however, the food helped to ease my troubles. Or was it the booze...

name: terlingua
review_text: Excellent service, very good smoked meats. We got the small meat board, which was enough for two. Favorites were the ribs and brisket, pork belly coming in second, and the chicken was missing something...amazing toasted cornbread, and cheesy cauliflower side. Must stop here again next time we are in town.

name: terlingua
review_text: I have been here twice and have had 2 terrific experiences. The fish tacos were great and the cornbread is tasty. My first time was with a very subdued supper club and the 2nd with a boisterous group of ten. I had the same server both times and she (Kayla) is a rock star. I tried a bite of my daughters mushroom toast app and I wish that I had ordered one for myself, but I wanted to save room for the delicious tres leche cake (I ordered this on both of my visits). I will def go back again.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I have spent a fair amount of time in the Southwest, and think extremely highly of Southwestern cuisine.  To me, there is nothing more warming to the soul (and tummy) than a bowl full of green chile stew.  Luckily for Portland, Terlingua produces a nearly perfect bowl.  The only thing I would change is serving it with tortillas instead of chips.

The smoked meats here are excellent, and taste like something straight out of Texas.  I'm surprised they don't have lines down the street!  Everything I've had here has been thoughtfully prepared and damn tasty.

This is a small restaurant, and it's a cozy place to be on a cold evening.  The smell of roasted chile and smoked meats will warm you to the core.

name: terlingua
review_text: As a vegan, this isn't the ideal choice for food, but they do have a couple choices. They have a delicious salad and if you ask, they can usually make vegan mushroom tacos that are to die for. Also, they make great margaricios. The staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is cozy.

name: terlingua
review_text:
Was getting bored with crudo and charcuterie was looking for some sing and spice. Read some different menus and found this little place that did some smoked foods with some Mexican flare. Good call, quaint little hole in the wall but when your inside nice atmosphere of a nice local chef owner operated restaurant. Had the beef brisket tostado, nice flavor, grilled chiles added some nice heat, then a smoked lamb belly  with a tamarind glaze and Serrano. Very well prepared 
Definitely recommend

name: terlingua
review_text:
Danny and I have been wanting to enjoy the food here. We have heard from so many friends as to how much they like the food here. 
It took a few years and we finally went in. 

We were so delighted with Kayla and the quality of the food products.   

We will be back many times.  Love the whole experience.

name: terlingua
review_text:
Terlingua is unlike any other BBQ Experience I've ever had!
If you want the Sheer Joy of tasting amazing BBQ this is the place for you. IF You just want a big quantity of meat to gobble down, rushing past all your taste buds then stay away. 
Their portions are smaller but the quality and taste are exceptional.
The meat comes off the grill at 5pm and if you're late, they may be sold out of your selection.  
We arrived early at 4:30 on a Friday night so we could secure a seat. The restaurant is tiny, so plan ahead.  There were 3 in our group and we ordered drinks, a Deviled Egg appetizer which was 4 halves of the best tasting Deviled eggs we had ever tasted! And the Queso and chips appetizer, It was good, but I would skip it next time.  We also ordered the Burnt Ends Appetizer, we later ordered a 2nd round of. 

For Dinner we ordered Family style and shared an order of Greens, Rosado Beans and Jalapeno Cornbread (don't worry its not hot) and an Adobo Pork shoulder and a Big Bone In Short Rib and finished it off with a slice of Tres Leches Cake to share. We got happy hour prices on our drinks by arriving early. The Total Bill was $114.48

name: terlingua
review_text: We stopped by around 2:30, serving only happy hour menu, snacks and drinks. We had the cheese dip with the smoked meat. Absolutely delicious!! Best I've had. Even without the meat the dip alone would have been great. Chips were home made. Also had drinks, I had a margarita and my husband had a beer. Wonderful quick service. Would return for sure for dinner or lunch!

name: terlingua
review_text: In a town full of great brunch spots, terlingua stands out. Went in for Sunday brunch, and found a concise but mouthwatering menu of bbq and southwestern breakfast mashups. I Got the sweet potato brisket hash, which came with two perfectly poached eggs and Tabasco hollandaise--absolutely fantastic. I can't wait to return for dinner.

name: terlingua
review_text:
Outdoor seating for us on our first try here. Nice beer and craft cocktail menu. I opted for a couple of styles of pilsner and saison. The menu is predominantly small plates. We tried a few things and I'll give the general essence. 

The burnt ends small plate is a flavorful must try. Nice portion for two to sample, with a chili drizzled sauce that was excellent. The deviled eggs were very creamy. I'm not a huge smoked fish guy, but the smoked trout accompanying the eggs was very good. 

They had four fresh ceviche....we tried two, and both were excellent. One had a very hot and cool profile, with very tender octopus and shrimp as the seafood. The chilies here gave this a spank, but it had fresh fruit to cool things off. The other was a fruit based scallop ceviche, with the beautifully fresh scallops being the star. Highly recommend this. 

We also tried the carne assada tacos, with fresh raw slices of radish and fresh slices of jalapeños. It has a cool creme fresh to balance off the heat. Again, this was a good dish. I didn't try the avocado and spices side dish. Looked nice.

All in all this is a good spot. Food pricing is reasonable, selection is varied, service was good....a solid 4 star spot. Recommend.

name: terlingua
review_text:
"Everything I put in my mouth was 'wow'!"

We came for New Years Eve and had three if the five courses and it was all amazing. Lamb ribs with a winter veggie salad, and Pork belly tamale were the starters. I had the pumpkin bisque with a mushroom and cojito empanadas and the spouse had a fried oyster Caesar salad. We then had the beef tenderloin (so perfect) and the duck chorizo chili relleno (just spicy enough and so flavorful). 

This was one of the best meals in Portland.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I got myself all excited for this spot and was ready to chow down on some meat. I went for lunch and their small menu was definitely for lighter fare. Items like salads, soup, and sandwiches (which are really wraps in a pita, but still delish).

But when I got there and ate lunch, I was like, "eh, that was good, but nothing I will crave in the future" My friend got a deviled egg sandwich, which was really egg salad, and I got pork, where the highlight was the relish-type spread that went in it. 

Overall, I wasn't super disappointed, but I wasn't amazed. Not much more I can say. Maybe dinner is really where it's at for this particular restaurant?

name: terlingua
review_text:
First timer! I love barbecue and this is better than all of the bigger restaurants in Portland. You MUST get the burnt ends!! The next time I go I am only getting four orders of burnt ends ... and three margaritas.  The drinks are great too.

In addition to the burnt ends, which you are required to order, we had fish tacos, chicken tacos, 1/2 whole jerk chicken, taco soup, and jalapeño cornbread.  Everything was awesome. All four of us thought it was one of the better meals we had in a long time and we go out to eat a lot.  Everything seems to have some spice in it which leaves the lips with that perfect numb feeling.  Not hot, spicy.

I don't want to forget the waitstaff who were super knowledgeable about the menu and specials. All could not have been nicer.

The place is small. If you have anxiety go during the week.  We went on Friday night and it was crowded and a little tight.

I think the food and service is well worth the wait! Plus, you might get lucky like us and have nice table neighbors!

If I forgot to mention it...get the burnt ends!!

name: terlingua
review_text:
Where to start...
The staff is welcoming, the establishment is inviting, the owners are dedicated to not just great food, but opening their doors to the neighbors and friends every day, especially on Sunday when they host neighborhood night at reduced prices. 
We dropped in late Sunday afternoon for cocktail hour with the intention of having a drink and an appetizer then moving in to have pizza in Portland. 
We ordered beer and spicy rimmed margaritas chips with Queso dip and deviled eggs. Let me add that our waitress was so funny and made the experience so much fun.  After emptying our glasses and all but licking our plates we just couldn't resist staying for dinner. More drinks, fish tacos, the best wings we've ever had and a heaping mound of pastrami on a crispy potato cake with a delightful drizzle; heavenly. 
We can see why this little restaurant, that feels like being at a big family dinner, is so popular. 
Many thanks to the owners who were so welcoming, for a memorable Sunday dinner.  Family and great food! That's what they are all about. 
We will be back!

name: terlingua
review_text: Wonderful food, tasty cocktails. A couple of dishes were a tiny bit smaller than expected for the price, but not shockingly so.  We enjoyed the acoustic guitar playing the evening we visited. Service was a little on the slow side getting started, but it was a busy night and once we got our orders in the food arrived in a very reasonable amount of time.  Great little place, friendly atmosphere. We'll return!

name: terlingua
review_text: A solid 4.5. I had the beef tacos and they were totally chock full of flavorful taco beef (not the shredded kind)- like I kid you not 2/3rds of the way full. Unfortunately it didnt leave much room for veggies which is a must for me. It came w a side of pot beans which had crumbled Mexican cheese on top. The margarita I had was delicious as well w a spicy rim. It's a very small place and quaint. I was told to go here and to taco Escobar and I would choose this over that.

name: terlingua
review_text: Really good, walked in here randomly. I had the jerk chicken wrap and a chicken tortilla soup, absolutely delicious. I will definitely be back again, perhaps today now that I'm thinking of it

name: terlingua
review_text: We stopped in on a Sunday during their Neighborhood menu. The fried rice, both with and without meat were delicious dishes. The came with a perfectly fried egg on top and fairly spicy. We also had trout with crispy seasoned skin and vegetables. The potato cake side was crispy and creamy at the same time. We can't wait for our next visit to Portland to come back.  Reasonably priced and every bite was delicious!

name: terlingua
review_text: Every place has an off night and im hoping our experience was one of those.  Wilted lettuce in the Scallop ceviche.  Fish tacos were full of flavor but came out a little extra crisp and cool.  Maybe the bbq will fit the bill next time.

name: terlingua
review_text:
I rarely fall head over heels for a restaurant from one meal, but Terlingua has managed to pull that off. I mean, what's not to love? Great atmosphere, impeccable service, incredible food--Terlingua's got 'em all.

I went on a Sunday evening for their Neighborhood Night, and I was blown away by everything. I got a brisket BBQ bowl, which came with red beans, collard greens, and tortillas, and it was absolutely delicious. My server gave me an empty dish in case I wanted to make tacos, and I'm glad I followed her subtle suggestion. I only wished they had given me the tortillas separately instead of on top of my briskets because the tortillas soaked some of the broth and got soggy. Otherwise, everything was perfect. 

A special shout out for the most amazing service I've encountered in a while. I asked my server if the hot sauce she got for me was homemade or store bought because I really loved it. Apparently it's made in-house, but she kindly offered to give me some to-go. I'm so excited to put that delicious hot sauce to good use tomorrow, but even more so I'm excited to have found a neighborhood restaurant that's basically almost perfect.

name: terlingua
review_text: got a table outside on a beautiful night and had an amazing dinner with my in laws, waitress was attentive and informative, food was delish, we split a board of various bbq meats, wonderful

name: terlingua
review_text:
Terlingua was recommended to us by friends and we are so glad they did. We had awesome food and wonderful service. 

We had the empanadas, the mushroom tacos, and the smoked brisket. The flavors were terrific. Each plate had those touches you wish each restaurant included like pickled vegetables, cabbage slaw, and corn bread to die for.

Now, let's talk about the brisket; it's poetry. So tender and delicious with a crisp roasted smoked crust, just like you dreamed that it should be.

There's draft beers and creative, tasty cocktails. No improvements necessary. Just wish I lived closer.

name: terlingua
review_text: Chose Terlingua for the amazing food.  On my birthday I invited friends to meet here for drinks and dinner.  This ended up being one of my best birthdays ever thanks to Wilson, Pliny, and the entire staff.  We ordered the Bbq platter, soup, empanada, fish tostada, and many drinks!   I recommend everyone try as much of the menu as you can- it's all phenomenal.  While I give the food the highest rating, it's the staff that will have all of us coming back again and again.

name: terlingua
review_text: Great slice of Texas in Portland, Maine. Really enjoyed my experience. Can't recommend this place enough, especially if you're a homesick Texan in New England.

name: terlingua
review_text:
A newish joint that talks about organic, local and smoked meats. 

Service is polite. 

The day we went, a chalk board outside the restaurant listed the pricing for the smoked meats of the day:

Brisket: $18/$23.
Ribs: $14/23
Lamb: $23/$28
Chicken: $17
Trout: $17

This may seem normal until the portion size is verified. The first number is for a quarter pound or quarter rack and the second for a half pound or half rack. In this case, a pound of brisket ends up at $46, a rack of ribs $46 and a pound of lamb for $56. 

You do the math, pricey and pricey again. Outrageously expensive, even. 
 
Using inflated NY prices, by the pound offerings at far superior BBQ joints (Hometown, Brisket Town, Sweet Cheeks Boston) come no where close to Terlingua's price per pound. Nothing can justify this kind of expenditure for good but not awesome smoked meat. 

The meats sampled: ribs, brisket were certainly smoked, albeit with not much additional rub or flavorings.
