I plan on going back to Maine, and while everyone else is on their lobster roll crawl, I will be on the hunt for some golden, flaky fish and chips.

Thank you, East Ender.  Because of you, I will always be that a--hole who opens the take-out container for inspection at the hostess podium.

name: east-ender
review_text: Went in with my parents to celebrate my 24th birthday. Not only was the gnocchi out of this world, with the Brussels sprouts are a must.  Tina went out of her way to pour us some bubbly to celebrate and she also added a candle to the incredible chocolate torte we shared . As someone who works in the industry, I really appreciated her hospitality and helping me start off 24 with a bang. Thank you !!

name: east-ender
review_text: Encountered long waits at Central Provisions and Duck Fat and had  3 very hungry kids in tow, so we stopped in East Ender for drinks and snacks. We grabbed seats at the bar where husband and I ordered the Ginger Lemondrop and the kids were served beautiful mocktails with orange juice blueberry soda and cinnamon. We were enjoying the atmosphere and service of the friendly bartender that we asked for menus and decided to stay for dinner. We all stole bites of my daughters lobster melt and wished we had ordered our own, the kids burgers were delicious and just the right portion size. The adults split a plate off Brussels sprouts and chili lime vinegarette and the fish and chips. I removed most of the fried batter... but inside the Hake was flaky and delicious.

name: east-ender
review_text:
We had a fantastic experience at East Ender! The chicken wings were unlike any others we have had, cooked and seasoned perfectly! No need for any dipping sauce, the chili lime rub was amazing all in itself. We also had the fish and chips, excellent filet of fish fried to perfection. The house smoked burger was the shining star of our meal - perfectly cooked, excellent bun, and it had a fantastic smoky flavor that we have never had in a burger before. The service was fantastic, friendly and attentive. 

Personally, I don't get the hype with Duckfat, so was thrilled to have such a great experience and great food at East Ender.

name: east-ender
review_text: I can't say enough positive things about this place!!!  The service kid outstanding!!!  The food is absolutely perfect!!!  Tonight Was my second time dining at East Ender and I lived every second I was there!!!  Even as we were leaving the bartenders on the first floor said "thank you.  Have a great night" with such sincerity I knew they meant every word they said.   I will definitely return next time I am in town.

name: east-ender
review_text: Enjoyed Sunday brunch here..was able to make a resv. .but not needed.service was very good..drinks good..and I had one of the best burgers ever..everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals as well..we will be back..love this place..one problem-parking!!

name: east-ender
review_text:
What a gem!

TL;DR: Exquisite all around; definitely get a mixed drink and dessert!

My mother and I were looking for a nice place to celebrate that wasn't too expensive. We have different eating styles. (I'm inquisitive, she's rather reserved.) Though there weren't a plethora of food options, the menu varied plenty to cover most palates.

The appetizer we shared, the grilled escarole, was fantastic. The vegetables were grilled perfectly; the dressing, plated beneath the vegetables, was amazing; the toast was wonderfully flavored. And the plating was beautiful. I was particularly impressed with the perfectly poached egg - no residual water whatsoever.

My mother's main course was the lobster club whereas I ordered the gnocchi. Her sandwich was very flavorful, the strong flavors blending exceptionally. My gnocchi was more relaxed but just as flavorful, wonderfully crafted. (And the sauce was absolutely superb!) The portion sizes were decent, but as wonderful as it had been, we had to try dessert.

The panna cotta was the best I have ever had. Perfect texture, brilliant flavoring, and a wonderful blend of the flavors as well. It was also unexpectedly large, making it great for sharing. Absolutely heavenly!

The beverage list also deserves a highlight. They have a full bar with specialty cocktails that looked wonderful, but the mocktails drew our attention. My mother got the Old Ship Fizz - flavors I would not have thought to combine but which made for a magical concoction. The lemon soda-based one I had was potently delicious, offering a punch of pucker.

Finally, I must praise the excellent waitservice. From offering suggestions when requested to knowing the menu well to keeping our glasses full to simply being genuinely kind, our server was nothing short of superb. (Thank you for being so awesome!)

name: east-ender
review_text: Really enjoyed the food. The fish sandwich and burgers are both delicious!  The waitress Katie was very attentive and did an excellent job.

name: east-ender
review_text:
"Thrice cooked fries" are an idea better left in the test kitchen.  Too bad because this place is charming enough, with a roomy upstairs, friendly service, decent prices and good selections on tap.  

If you avoid the fryer, you can have a nice meal at East Ender.  The non-deep-fried choices in our party were all hits.  The marinated olives and the mussels were delicious.  The burgers, lobster melt and cavatelli earned thumbs ups.   

But O that fryer! If you didn't think it possible for a Maine restaurant to mess up fish 'n' chips, welcome to Portland.  The fish appeared quadruple-fried, encased in a barely edible sarcophagus as thick and hard as that of a week-old corn dog. Which is too bad because the fish, once collected from the shell, was flaky and fresh. The thrice cooked fries, which are the same as those imposed upon the burgers, were deep fried to total crispiness.  One might reasonably consider them burned. They are also very over-salted. None of the three members of our party whose orders came with fries could eat much more than half the not-huge portions, which, considering that two of the three were teenagers,  is saying something.

name: east-ender
review_text:
Duckfat had an hour wait, so, we decided to kill some time at East Ender.  Ordered a couple of appetizers and had a beer.  We had the onion rings and the fried brussel sprouts & chili lime vinaigrette.  

The onion rings were probably the best I've ever had.  The brussel sprouts were great, as well.  

The service was awesome.  Wish I had more time to try out their other menu items.  Highly recommend this place!

name: east-ender
review_text: Great atmosphere, great service but poor selection on the menu and pricey. My food was cooked perfectly (the pork belly sandwich) but the quality of the food is definitely what you're paying for anyways.

name: east-ender
review_text:
Awesome little hole in the wall place. I had the octopus and lobster grilled cheese -- FIVE STARS. The beer I had was trash, but that's what I get for trying a 'craft' beer. They didn't have coors. My mom got a hamburger because she's from Batavia, but it looked nice. 

Hi Megan.

name: east-ender
review_text:
This is another of Alan's Yelp discoveries.  He made 6:45 reservations.  We drove over and readily found parking in the lot at the end of the block.  We walked over and up one tall step into the restaurant.  Upstairs is what seemed to be a lounge.  We didn't climb the stairs to explore, but noticed others did.  We were greeted by Chloe, who was also our server, and invited to choose between two tables for two.  We chose the one in the window.  We were given menus.  I ordered a glass of Malbec.  Chloe gave Alan a taste of the dark beer they had on tap so he could decide if he liked it.  He did, so he ordered some.  I forget its name.

We had both decided on fish and chips when Chloe came over and told us the evening's specials.  The main was short ribs w/ carrots, locally foraged ramps and fiddlehead ferns.  Fiddlehead ferns!!!  I love them.  I was introduced to them at a Downeast restaurant several years ago.  I was excited at the prospect of having them again.  Of course I abandoned the fish and chips for the short ribs and fiddlehead ferns.  We decided to share a bowl of smoked hake chowder.  Alan stuck w/ the fish and chips, which came w. roasted spaghetti squash.  We also ordered a side of the fried Brussels sprouts.

The chowder was delicious, w/ a lovely smokey flavor from the hake.  It was light and had small dice of potatoes that were wonderful, so small they didn't dominate.   They were not overcooked, so they weren't mushy.  They had a toothsome bite that was a pleasure.  The short ribs came w/ a largish cube of potatoes.  It was unlike anything I'd seen before.  It was seasoned nicely and fried so it had a sturdy crust.  I don't generally eat potatoes but this was so deliciously unusual I ate every bit.  Fortunately it wasn't huge.  The short ribs were tender and w/ no visible fat.  The carrots were al dente, just the way I like them.  Only the fiddlehead ferns were a little disappointing, lacking in flavor.  They could have used some of the seasoning from the Brussels sprouts, which were excellent.  Alan's fish was one very large piece, moist and delicious.  The chips were thrice fried.  The spaghetti squash was very tasty too.  I liked the tastes I had of his dish and he liked the taste he had of mine.  We were both happy w/ our meals and neither of us had room for dessert.  Service was excellent.  There were 3 or 4 other tables occupied.  I saw several people go upstairs to the lounge.

name: east-ender
review_text: Loved this little place! The chicken wings are wonderful! Made with a chili lime rub, the wings are big & meaty. Guy next to us had the pork shoulder sandwich & it was huge! Everything on the menu sounded great. And... they gave a decent wine pour, not a small glass halfway filled.

name: east-ender
review_text: Very impressed with the food and service at East Ender!  Our server took care to walk me through what gluten-free options were available, including which items on the menu would not be safe for Celiacs.  I really appreciated the information and decided to go with the Steamed Mussels (delicious!) and the Lobster Risotto (was sad that dish had to end), both of which were full of great flavor.  To top it all off, there was a gluten-free chocolate torte on the menu.  Not only was the torte delicious, but it was such a treat to have a sweet gf desert that tasted so good and was so rich!  Would absolutely recommend East Ender to any fellow Celiacs.

name: east-ender
review_text: Just left and had a dish that was fantastic.  I can't recall the name.  It was a chickpea stew with chicken tikka. My husband had the braised pork shoulder with grits and thought it was delicious as well. Super satisfying and not too heavy. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.   Only rec would be to add small salad w entrees.

name: east-ender
review_text: We really enjoyed the brunch here. I made a reservation because I wanted to make sure I got an outdoor table because we had our dogs. It was pretty quiet for 11am on a Sunday, which made me nervous. When we got there the server informed me that she had already set up a spot outside for us with a water bowl for the dogs. There weren't a lot of breakfast-type options. I got the breakfast sandwich which had egg, bacon, cheese and kimchi which was an interesting addition. The hash brown was one of the best I've ever had. My husband had the sausage and eggs and he said the homemade sausage was fantastic. Service was great. I'd definitely like to come back to try dinner next time.

name: east-ender
review_text: Cute decor and atmosphere, but underwhelming. Food looked amazing but had no flavor. Party of 9 and each of us were disappointed with our meal in some way. We ordered turkey sandwiches, grilled cheese, burger, fries, Brussels sprouts. Turkey was good until avocado was gone, then really was tasteless. Service was seriously lacking. Took forever to get stuff and needed to remind staff about drinks we ordered

name: east-ender
review_text: The food and drinks were amazing. Had the lobster melt with fried brusssel sprouts. Great little spot with a relaxing atmosphere. Will definitely come here when I'm in Portland.

name: east-ender
review_text:
We had a fantastic experience at East Ender.  Our server, Bridget, was fabulous - very comfortable, confident, and fun.  We were heading to Trevor Noah's 10:00 show, so with a 7:00 pm reservation we had time for grazing.  And graze we did.

The wings were cooked perfectly, and the pork rillettes had incredible flavor.  All four of us thoroughly enjoyed our (and each other's) entrees.  We had the cassoulet, burger, cavatelli, and Tunisian chickpea stew.  Then we shared two desserts - the chocolate cake and profiteroles.  Quite possibly the best chocolate cake I have ever consumed.

Bridget, we hope Trevor drops his current girlfriend and carries you off into the sunset!

name: east-ender
review_text: I will say this we came in earlier and it wasn't busy yet and the place next door was so I was a tad bit worried after setting down and enjoying some of the best I've had so far while on the east coast was by all means pleasantly surprised and I can promise you I will be back when in the area by far!!!

name: east-ender
review_text: We came here after finding a crazy long line next door at Duckfat. So glad we tried this place! Amazing fries...you first think "thrice fried"? why would you need to write that out on a menu, but once you try them you understand completely. Those fries were perfectly crisp on the outside but thick enough that the inside was still amazingly soft. moral of the story, I would come back for the fries alone. Although, the burger was great as well. The meat was perfectly cooked and tasted so fresh. What i love about this restaurant is that everything is local, from the meat to the produce. I'm always down to support local farmers and the quality of their products speak for themselves. Thanks!

name: east-ender
review_text: We just got drinks because we were waiting for another restaurant but the food around us looked really good. I felt I had to write a review because Molly and Kate were so nice and offered great service even though it was clearly a busy night where they were completely booked. I will definitely be coming back to get the food and hope they are both there. Thanks East ender for making us feel welcome.

name: east-ender
review_text:
Last night I went to the East Ender with a friend for dinner. We had tried to get into Eventide and the wait was very long so we ended up at the East Ender for a drink. We were upstairs in the comfy bar seats with backs. We had such a nice time, the service and atmosphere were so awesome we cancelled our reservation and Eventide and just stayed.

We started with the mussels which were absolutely delicious. My friend had the octopus and the chowder which were both awesome. I got the grilled chicken with a side of brussel sprouts.  The chowder was very think and flavorful filled with potatoes, fish and whatever else. The Octopus was not rubbery at all and cooked very well. The brussel sprouts aren't as good as Pai Men Miyaki's brussel sprouts (which are the absolute best in Portland) but still very good. 

What we liked most was the atmosphere. Everyone was so helpful and kind. The bar tended, Natalie was so sweet, attentive and helpful. We will be back to hang out, relax and we agreed this is our new "spot".

name: east-ender
review_text: I've never been disappointed with any item I've ordered here. Fish and chips were excellent. Burger was excellent. Beer selection was good. The space is a bit awkward in winter (sat right next to the door) but the food and service make up for it.

name: east-ender
review_text:
I honestly don't think this place would still be in business if not for its close proximity to the two and a half hour waits at Eventide and Duckfat.  I've given it three chances now because I WANT to like it (loved the old one, love the building), but the third time was the nail in the coffin.  

Food: The burgers were overcooked and tasted like lighter fluid, which doesn't even make sense as I can't imagine they're cooking on a charcoal grill, but all three of us who ordered burgers agreed.  I'm not even sure I would have been able to suffer through a burger that bad at a tailgate, so paying $15 each was a real bummer.  Even the 200 LB "eat anything" guys at the table wouldn't finish them.  Pate and fish were dissapointing but edible, wings were fine, fries were pretty good.

Service:  The service was friendly, not the most knowledgeable but willing to try. 

One star for the building, one star for the service.  There are far too many 5 star places in Portland at similar or lower price points to waste your time and money here.

name: east-ender
review_text: I came in with some friends and we had one of everything on the happy hour food menu (warm olives, hake dip, pistachios, pretzel with mustard, mortadella, pork rillettes, mussels, and lobster sandwich) and every single bite was absolutely fantastic.

name: east-ender
review_text:
All I can say is... NO.

(I'm sorry, I hate to do this. I love Portland and I've always had great luck trying random cute looking places there, but it did not work out this time.)

First of all, I feel like this place is only able to stay open because of Duckfat and Eventide being impossibly packed all the time and people being cold and hungry/thirsty.

The drinks weren't good. The best thing I had were the chili cheese fries which were only just ok. 

The gnocchi and hake chowder were lukewarm at best- that is a huge pet-peeve of mine as I used to work in a kitchen. The Brussels sprouts were fine. The wings were not special at all. Also, this place is NOT CHEAP so really not worth it in any regard.

Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else- Portland has too many other good options and this is just not one of them.

name: east-ender
review_text:
The mussels are amazing.  Also, their wing sauce is on point.  

Quaint, dimly lit in a good way 

Service was great.

name: east-ender
review_text: Fantastic pork shoulder. Very good fish and chips. Good seafood stew. Excellent fries and brussels sprouts. Quite inexpensive given the food quality. Highly recommended.

name: east-ender
review_text: One of my favorite restaurants in Portland.  Great menu, interesting specials and fries are best around.  When ordering....choices on the menu allow you to make it as sophisticated as you want.

name: east-ender
review_text:
This restaurant is one of 3 in a row of wonderful places to eat:  Duct Fat, Ribolita and Eastender. 

The atmosphere is a little noisy, but not more than expected for the day and the hour. 

The wine list was good, if not expansive. We were pleased to find a Muscadet sur lie, as we prefer very dry whites. 

We split a "snack" of chicken liver pate. Plenty for a good taste for two, and wonderful!

My partner had a starter of hake chowder that she said was the "best chowder " she had ever had. I had a grilled squid over potato. It was ver tasty: spicy and well presented. Cooked just right!

I had a grilled duck with vegetable entre, my partner had a beef pot au feu. Both were cooked and presented very well.  The pot will feu was not like the traditional stew we expected, but was well done nonetheless. The duck was well done and nicely presented. 

We split a chocolate cake for desert. It was very dense and satisfying   
 
Overall, this was a very good evening out!

name: east-ender
review_text:
We came on a whim and were lucky enough to get seats at the upstairs bar.  Watching them make cocktails was a lot of fun - I enjoy places that elevate the art.  My Manhattan and her Old Fashioned were exactly what we wanted.

For starters we had the Roasted Beets with Whipped Ricotta, Balsamic Vinegar, & Toasted Farro.  So good!  Fluffy, creamy ricotta with sweet, roasted beets, and the occasional, crispy farro.

I had the Cavatelli with Short Rib Ragu and it was amazing.  The smoky, savory flavor of the ragu with the toothy pasta and clouds of parmesan on top.

The wife had Lobster Saffron Risotto with Vanilla Turnips.  We had never heard of these type of turnips, but they had a lovely texture and a distinct vanilla flavor.  The risotto itself was perfect.

I look forward to our next visit.

name: east-ender
review_text: Great burger and fries here at the East Ender. I loved the smoked hake chowder. Great service and nice people here. Close to the Shipyard Brewing Company - walking distance.

name: east-ender
review_text: Better than its neighbor duck fat! We lucked out to step into this place rather than wait in the cold for the place next door.  The burger with bacon ham was amazing and the mussels left my companion speechless in a good way.  I'm a snob about French fries and these were just ok... way too thick for my tastes.  A generally comfortable space with friendly service.  With a minus ten degree evening the draft from the front door opening was bracing.... a common problem for any small place on Portland though.  The burger was good enough to warrant a return visit.

name: east-ender
review_text: What a pleasant surprise! We initially wanted to go to Duckfat, which was slammed, so we got a reservation here. We were very happy! Service was great with an amazing beer list (would you expect less in Portland?). The Vadouvan Spiced Chicken Wings were ridiculously good. I could have eaten 2 dozen of them in pure gluttony. The Tunisian Coconut-Chickpea Stew was so ridiculously good, I wanted to order two fo them. This place is a must visit.

name: east-ender
review_text: Excellent meal to celebrate our anniversary! Adorable little restaurant with upstairs bar/lounge. We were seated promptly and received excellent service. Both my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the lobster melt! Thank you!

name: east-ender
review_text:
I booked this place for 8 people for Saturday lunch at noon - pretty last minute reservation on Open Table.  We sat upstairs, and they had plenty of room for us, so it was good to know they could accommodate.  

The servers were super nice, although we did wait for a while for drinks to be served and for food to come through.  I know we were a party of 8, but lunch seemed to drag on a bit towards the end.  

The food: the chili cheese fries with pork belly were out of this world.  A good size starter portion that started the meal off right.  The pretzel was a good size and came with some very good/very strong mustard - also a solid pick.  The hake chowder was not a crowd pleaser - too many onions and potatoes, but a good smoky taste throughout.  

The entrees/sandwiches were mostly hit or miss.  The lobster melt was tasty, but I wish they hadn't diced the lobster into such small pieces.  The pork belly sandwich was a large portion of pork belly with a nice BBQ sauce.  The turkey club was a solid choice, as was the burger.  The thrice fried fries were a must. 

Overall, the food was pretty good/decent, and the beer and cocktail menu was spot-on.  I would hit this place up again since Duck Fat is always packed and they could accommodate large parties without hassle.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
So in our quest to find affordable dining in Portland, we stopped in to see Blue Rooster. Very small space so unless you're lucky like us and catch them at a slow time, you'll want to grab it to go.

The menu is pretty great, but it's all loaded with a whole lot of items so if you're a picky eater like me, you may want to pass. I got the Italiano and I asked for it without peppers which seemed to cause the young man taking my order to forget how to function as he repeated it several times and seemed very inconvenienced by the request to simply leave one item off. 

The food was fantastic! I highly highly highly recommended the tot-tine tator tots. They're delicious! My sandwich was a great size! Big but not overwhelming. I also got a soda. My partner got a salad, regular tots, and a soda as well. We came in around $35 for a total. Very worth it, especially since it's hard to find dining for 2 under $50 in Portland!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Hidden gem, in the most literal sense I could mean it!

So for months I've been going to Bar Method classes (the entrance is 15 feet down the street from Blue Rooster)  and so I've basically parking right in from of this place all along and had no idea what delicious magic awaited inside.  A friend brought me here for lunch the other day and holy goodness!  They offer hotdogs (which I need to try), tots (which I really really need to try...maybe post Barre class?!), and a few unusual but amazing sandwiches.  I say unusual because it's not just the standard turkey-on-wheat situation.  

My friend ordered a falafel (which he loved) and I ordered the pulled pork.  This sandwich was incredible- juicy and not dry, Carolina style pork, with a Brussels sprout slaw on a heavenly and giant roll!  It was perfection, I have nothing to complain about.  So seriously, don't accidentally pass this place by like I did for months...go in, get yourself something delicious.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
You had me at homemade tots. They were crispy, and delicious. I did get the 3 little pigs, and I could have done without the pork belly as it seemed like it wasn't seasoned, but everything else on it made me very happy. The chicken shawarma was good, but the falafel is where they sealed the deal with meal. Great flavors.
I do wish their menu was a tad bigger, but it's a affordable and tasty eat in Portland.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Not a huge hotdog guy but the Slawsky was excellent, I needed more toppings on Das Boot but I think that was my fault, user error in ordering. Tots and Sprouts are spicy, love the banana peppers, with delivery they were still crispy. Can't wait to go visit.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Blue Rooster brings me back to my childhood and my early twenty-one-year-old days, as I grew up in Biddeford, and there are a variety of establishments that are open late and serve hot dogs and burgers to drunken patrons, or people who just want a late-night snack. 

However, Blue Rooster is a step above those late-night establishments, as they serve elevated hot dogs and tater tots. My husband and I, along with a few friends decided to stop at the Blue Rooster on a wim, as we weren't totally starving, but we wanted to get something in our stomachs before a night of fun. 

As you walk in, there are chalkboards with a variety of different hot dogs, as well as a variety of tater tots! There are also some places to sit by the window, as well as some tables and benches to sit at. 

I ended up ordering a texan dog with some texan tater tots. Both were amazing, especially for the cheap prices! Blue Rooster also offers some local drafts, and they also provide some canned beer as well.

Definitely some place for a quick, cheap, delicious bite in the Old Port area of Portland!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Who knew tator tots could be a yummy main dish?! My coworker and I were looking for a fun place to eat some lunch on a Friday and decided to give this place a try. Let me say the tots were delicious. We got the Early Bird and Three Pigs which are the most popular for good reason. The sweet chili Brussels sprouts were surprisingly good. 

For me, Early Bird stood out with an awesome Maple Mayo mixed in with bacon and hot sauce on an egg. The tots are just tots, but the toppings definitely make the meal. We were planning on sharing so we got two smalls to try each other's choice. I would say the small tots is enough food for one, if you upgrade to a large I would imagine you'll probably want to save some for later. 

The restaurant is clean and tidy, with a cool painting of a funky blue rooster on the wall inside. I liked the funk and feel from this place. I would have liked some air flow inside or AC as I went on a hot humid day, but the wait was short and service was friendly. Also, didn't really notice they have more drinks behind the counter other than the water bottles in the front-facing fridge. It would be great to visually see the kinds of drinks available, because I actually happened to miss the drink list.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
The hot dogs were good; reminded me of Criff Dogs in Alphabet City.

The service: terrible.  The bearded man behind the register behaved as though the customers were a nuisance.  While we got our food quickly, it was certainly not served with a smile, or even a hint that the employees were glad we were spending our money there.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
- great prices
- juicy hot dogs
- great location in the center of all the bars in the old port
- staff is patient even in the middle of a huge rush
- limited seating, though. Pretty much nowhere to sit.
- huge menu
- the sauerkraut hot dog with the gravy cheesy tater tots is the best thing on the menu.
- no parking at all, but it's near a lot if streets that do have parking.
- funny wall art and hip atmosphere
- new favorite portland restaurant
- small bathroom

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
My sandwich was crafted in under 5 minutes, which makes the Blue Rooster and excellent choice for a quick bite to eat.  I ate the Charlie Nobel on a port roll containing roasted turkey, provolone, and brussel sprout slaw. The sandwich is huge, with generous amounts of juicy roasted turkey. Mild melty provolone coated the turkey, and the crunchy, tart, brussel sprout slaw. I also enjoyed the roll. It reminded me of a baguette, because it had a similar, sweet taste with a crispy crust, but a softer, airy texture inside.

Overall, the sandwich was yummy, and a good value for a large sandwich at $10.00. I recommend grabbing a sandwich to go or enjoy the causal booth seating inside. I'll definitely visit again soon to try their special brussel sprouts or tater tots!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
My friend and I went here last night after I suggested it. We walked up to the counter and she asked the cashier "what do you recommend?" To which he replied "nothing. I would NEVER eat anything here." And creepily smiled saying "but don't worry. You'll love it." 
I was immediately so turned off by this comment, that I changed my mind and decided not to order. This person should not be working here. I won't be back.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Okay honestly, I'm not a big fan of hot dogs but I was super hungry and getting tired of walking around trying to find a quick bite to eat without having to wait in line for a table, since nearly all of Portland does not take reservations.

Suuuupppeerrrr glad I stumbled upon Blue Rooster. I went with the Pineapple Express (bacon wrapped hot dog, pickled mango salsa, cilantro jalapeno pineapple mustard), but I was honestly here for the Tot-tine (tator tot poutine) and I'm just going to go ahead and say that it totally beat out Duckfat's poutine. 

With most poutine, the fries end up getting less crispy and more soggy than when the plate first comes out. Using tater tots lends to a crisp exterior through and through, which makes your poutine experience much more enjoyable. 

The hotdog itself was pretty darn good, but again, hot dogs aren't high up there on my list, but I would like to come back to try their sandwiches and other menu items!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Portland ME is an AWESOME city with so many eclectic boutiques and eateries it's hard to decide where to eat! I had some places bookmarked and I'm proud of myself for checking them off. This was a cool little spot, I was looking for yet another version of lobster rolls but found tater tots instead! Too bad I didn't have jogging pants on and TUMS because I would have tried more! And no worries how much you eat bc you will def walk it off let me tell you! And with plenty of inclines!
Anyway decided on the three little pigs which had pork belly sausage and bacon on poutiene tots w curds and gravy, washed down w Thai iced tea- sounds heart attack ish right!
Oh well- DIE HAPPY and SATISFIED!
Lmao!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Took 25 minutes to get tots. Egg is over cooked and sat for so long it cooled down. Maybe if the cooks weren't baked out of there minds they would move a bit faster.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Stopped by for lunch - there was no one in the restaurant. Probably should've been a red flag. Decent food, but the attitude of the guy behind the counter was completely off-putting and we felt unwelcome. Complaining about what I ordered to my face because it's popular? Get it off the menu if you don't want people ordering it.

I generally don't mind quirky service in tiny establishments but this dude was straight up rude. I know there are several reviews pointing out this guy, and I have no idea how he still has a job.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Eat HERE!

Great lunch spot for cheap, fast, and delicious. We drove up from CT and got this place recommended to us by a store manager up the street. We wouldn't have found it if it weren't for the recommendation since it isn't on the fun little map you can get for free to see most of what downtown has to offer.

I can't remember the names of the hoagies we got, but I can't imagine anything here is a bad choice!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: I can't believe I've been here in Portland for 6 months and I just found about this place today. The Pineapple express dog and the Thai tots were out of this world! Mind blown.... Thank you!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
We didn't even get the chance to eat here sadly, and I was so excited about it. We came in and the guy behind the counter was extremely rude, which was such a bummer because everyone in Portland and Maine in general have been very pleasant and nice since we've been here. 

He informed us that they were no longer serving sandwiches. When my wife asked if they had any all beef hot dogs (she has a pork allergy), you would've thought we insulted him personally, then told her that if she has a pork allergy she shouldn't even bother eating there because everything is cross contaminated - YIKES. When we told him we'd find somewhere else, he acted offended that he had even taken down my two item order. 

Yeah, kind of a bummer. I get you deal with a lot of drunk people due to location, but you should probably treat your customers better.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: The Best Weiner's. Thai dog on point. Buffalo taters are delish. Super addicting. My go to stop for late night grub. Keep up the good work blue rooster.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
The food is amazing. Highly recommend the Brussels sprouts.

Unfortunately, I have to give 1 star to this establishment based solely on the awful service. The attitude from the man behind the counter, while kicking everyone out at close - only moments after I was allowed to drop $40 on tater tots (sadly, they were out of Brussels) without any forewarning ("all orders have to be taken to go at this point in the evening" would have been expected for this to be OK) is absolutely inexcusable. He was rude. Plain and simple. 

It was embarrassing in fact - as I had raved to my sister and husband visiting from out of town how fantastic this place was. 

With so many wonderful establishments, even "late-night" - skip the line here and find someone who treats their customers well and appreciates their business!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Ordered the turkey sandwich - pretty large hunk of meat and the horseradish slaw was pretty good. Overall a good sandwich. I believe it was called the Charlie noble sandwich? It was good.

This place is known for the hotdogs and tatter tots though which I did not get a chance to try- but maybe next time! Overall not bad for a quick bite to eat, cheap and fast! It would honestly be really good late late night after a night of drinking!!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Total banger.  When you're sick of lobstering around, hit this chill spot.  Very creative menu with lots of tater tot and hot dog craziness.  Highly recommended.  Oh, they also have a couple local beers on tap.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Uhhhh YUM! Small joint right off the main streets in Portland. Very unassuming. Holy crap was it just the munchie spot I was craving. I ordered the "tot-tine" which is the Canadian classic with freaking TATER TOTS INSTEAD OF FRIES!! It was so bangin my friend decided to order something else off the menu. He got the "wagon wheel" dog--another delicious snack! Chill place with good service and GREAT food.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Went here because we love  hot dogs and ended up getting the pulled pork sandwich, gyro wrap and the poutine tater tots. Amazing food really, but the tater tots were just a little too salty, but boyfriend said that the pulled pork sandwich with those poutine tater tots is going on the list of last meal options. Would go back in a heartbeat.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Hot dogs, tater tots, a few sandwich options and two salads. If you want more than that go elsewhere. Limited seating too. We enjoyed the tater tots and the hot dogs we had though! Very tasty.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Quality retro hotdogs & a heaping of hot tots. Always a good go to if we havent packed lunches for the work day. Easy going hole in the wall establishment.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Tater poutine should be a thing. And for what I got it really is what I should have expected. But the whole poutine dish from here actually left me feeling a bit greazy, which I blame on the tots. Flavor of the gravy was good and cheese curds can do no wrong, so really the rating is for how I felt after eating the large one (not by myself-heavens no!). The guy working the counter was really nice and helpful and gave us some hot sauce and ketchup. I do love ketchup.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Stopped here for lunch with my hubby and two young kids. Everyone found something on the menu they liked, and the food was outstanding. I had the Thai Peanut Dog which was delicious, as were the tater tots and Caesar sprouts. Only downside to the place is it's small, so there's not much seating.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Solid lunch joint in Portland. They have a pretty extensive menu with hot dogs, sandwiches and tator tots with some diverse options that offer a break from Maine's traditional seafood emphasis. For me, their roast beef sandwich made for a great lunch.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: I love the Blue Rooster for late night eats. Things like Loaded tater tots, fried brussel sprouts, sandwiches, and crazy awesome hot dogs, like the one with bacon, bbq sauce, cheese and fried jalapeño!! Only downside is very limited seating.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Great food. Great prices. Excellent falafel and tater tots. It helps that they were blasting some Jethro Tull...a nice touch!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Stopped here for lunch while strolling around Portland. Came for sandwiches, which were just fine, but BLOWN AWAY by the tots. So many toppings, so many varieties, so. many. tots. 

I got the Thai tots, husband got the BBQ tots. We finished both of them of easily. That meant our sandwiches didn't get much love/attention, but they reheated well the next day.

If I could have done it all over again, I would have skipped the sandwich and focused my efforts and palate solely on the tots. 

Assuming this is a great late night option after imbibing in Portland's brewery scene!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Decent food, annoying and inexperienced staff.  Been here a few times...really the only times I come here are after a couple drinks from the old port (what do you expect from a place open till 2am, next door to Amigos?).  Went last night (1/27) and it was very crowded near closing.  My friend finished up his food, rose from his seat and tripped over someone's foot, dumping his empty tray of buffalo tots on the ground.  He started to pick up his stuff when the guy working counter came over and said, and I quote: "If you ever try pulling that shit here I can and will blacklist you from ever coming here again."

Not sure if he was just having a bad night, or if he thought my friend had intentionally dropped his trash on the ground, either way very unwarranted.  The food itself is usually about what you'd expect for the price-range.  I may suggest going for lunch and skipping out on the late night experience...also may want to limit contact with staff

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Great food. Welcoming staff. Prices reasonable. I would try this again. I had the falafel, which the guy told me that it was not like a normal falafel. It tasted like a chicken patty. Food was delicious!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Pretty good food, pretty long wait. 

We were passing through Portland around lunchtime on our trip up to Acadia National Park. I turned to Yelp to guide me to a great lunch spot and Blue Rooster Food popped up. I started reading the reviews and was sold on Tator Tot Poutine AKA "Tot-Tine". Onward! 

The Tot-Tine was EVERYTHING. Gravy and cheese-- yes please! The PBLT was also interesting and delicious, however I was not a fan of the chicken thigh meat. The Das Boot Hot Dog was a steal at $5-- very tasty and filling! 

For a small takeout place, I was very surprised by the long wait time. It also was not very busy, so not quite sure what took so long. While I appreciate the attention to detail and fresh food made to order, the 25 minute wait time is killer for a fast casual concept. That small gripe aside, I really enjoyed the creative food at Blue Rooster Food and wish I had the opportunity to try a few more items off of the menu!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Speaking of delivery only, this place is just okay. 

I ordered a Beefsquatch from here on a lark through a delivery food company.  The sandwich itself was decent, but not really memorable in any particular way.  It was ridiculously hard to eat because it was served on naan, which was cool but a bit cumbersome for lunch.  The tater tots here are good, but probably not worth going here for by themselves.

I may go here again and try this again!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Awful service. The manager literally said that he does not want to work here any more and just wants to go home and does not want the customers there. Sad. Could be such a great place but is unfortunately run by out of touch incompetent and rude people.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
TL;DR small place, tots Arr very crispy, fresh and delicious. Get the Thai peanut tots and you'll be in tot heaven. 

Blue rooster was in a cute little side street. Pretty small place with only a few tables so I can see it getting busy around lunch time. We popped in for dinner around 7 and there was nobody inside. We ordered two small tots and a sandwich each. Costed about $30. The tots were amazing. They were very fresh and crispy. Highly recommend the Thai peanut tots. I got the pineapple Express hot dog. It was good with a nice kick from the pineapple jalapeno mustard. BF got the PBBLT (pork belly lettuce tomato) which had pork belly, fried chicken tomato and lettuce. That was alright. Wasn't really a fan of the chicken thigh. I think that chicken breast would have tasted better. All in all great experience though. Would definitely go back for the tots when I'm in the area again. Doesn't get any more crispy than here!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: This place was okay... I got some tots which were actually pretty good, lots of cool flavors to pick from. But my pulled pork sandwich was very boring and kind of dry. But this place usually has pretty high ratings so maybe I ordered wrong here. I'll have to try this place again and get a hot dog. From what I hear and read they look and sound amazing.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Food was good.  Had the Big Easy sandwich that had salami, Capicola, provolone and giardiniera salad. This is a cold sandwich but the Bread was stale and dry but ingredients were tasty. $10.   Ordered the three Little pigs tatot tota; cheese curds gravy bacon sausage and pork belly.  Really good and tasty.  Small was $8. Fried brussel sprouts were delicious. small $6.50. Beer $6. Had the masons ipa and oxbow.  Draft was a little warm and definitely  flat. Not very clean.  Table were dirty entire time. Only clean place to sit was at the window and we had to wipe down that area ourselves to sit there.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Tots and Dogs for lunch on Sunday afternoon...heaven sent. 

I was recommended to go here by a few yelpers and my co-worker who's originally from Maine and man, I am happy I came. 

The place is a bit small with a few booths - however somehow we got lucky. There was no line and about 2 freed up booths for us to sit in... granted the place filled up immediately once the clock hit 12 for lunch. 

Food: So many creative food options - I went with the Tot-Tine and my BF went with the Nacho-Tots. We also got a Growly Dog and Pineapple express. I really appreciated the mix of unusual flavors one isn't used to eating all the time. Everything tasted EXTREMELY fresh. 

Service: Super nice staff. Great sense of humor! Also, VERY patient with an indecisive customer like myself ;). HAHA. 

Long story short - check this place out if you're in the area. I can guarantee you'd never been to any other place like this. I'll make sure on my next trip to Maine - to stop by.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Who doesn't love a dog and some tots! Was with the family in Portland for the day and wanted a quick bite before our Firetruck tour started. Found this place on Yelp and liked what we saw. Unfortunately they didn't have the lobster BLT so many people were raving about. Total bummer, luckily the menu has many interesting options. I ordered the Daus Boot and my wife got the shrimp and sausage poeboy sandwich, a large order of plain tots, a order of the fried Brussel sprouts and a regular dog for the kids to share. With two lemonades the price was around 40 bucks, a little steep for this type of food, but the service was quick and food was great. The tots were awesome and crisped to perfection. 
8/10 definitely worth a stop if your in the area.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
First time in Portland. After walking for about an hour looking for a place to eat, we finally stopped "searching" at Blue Rooster. First impression of the place didn't hit home, but the reviews were great and I was curious about that the big deal was. A couple that had just finished their meal kept telling me to stay, that it was very good. So, we stayed. 
Oh. My. God. Best decision of the day. A must try place! And since everyone else was making lines at every other restaurant, we didn't have any lines at Blue Rooster. Score. I ordered the Sweet Caroline and it's to die for; the coleslaw is delicious on this sandwich!. My sis had the Beefsquatch and said it was delicious. 
Definitely a must around here.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
I ventured into Blue Rooster this past week for a charlie noble and some tator tots with artificial cheese (which I love, don't judge me). The sandwich was really great. The tator tots are exactly what you remember from grade school and that's not a bad thing. There are a bunch of different varieties and toppings for the tots, but I went straight for the artificial cheese (only $0.50!) and was not disappointed. What really bumped it up another star for me was the awesome root beer they sell here. Be sure to get that if you stop in.

There is limited seating (three or four booths and a few bar stools at the counter) so go early or late if you want to eat it there. It's not my favorite lunch spot in the area, but you get a lot for your money and the food is pretty damn good.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: My new favorite late night food place! You know when you're out late, desperately hungry and not much is open for a quick bite that isn't pizza or Thai? This place will meet your late night munchie needs! The menu is an eclectic mix of an assortment of designer hot dogs, tater tots, sandwiches and sides. You can also grab a beer or soda if you're thirsty. My husband tried the Tokyo Drift dog and I tried the falafel wrap on special. We split an order of the Thai tots. Be still my heart. While I never in my wildest dreams thought you could do much to dress up tater tots, this place proved me wrong. Both the dog and falafel wrap were delicious, but the Thai tots stole the show. Spicy, sweet and super flavorful-not soggy at all. They are open for lunch so I can't wait to go back and try a different tot style. I really can't say enough good things about the place. Seating is pretty limited so plan on take out or waiting. It is a counter service which makes things go smoother. Check it out! You won't be disappointed!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
One of my favorite places from my visit to Portland. The only place I went to twice!

I'm a little obsessed with tots in general, but I'm obsessed with these tots beyond. I think I the first time I got the buffalo tots and the second time I got the early bird I don't really remember *drunk* but they were everything. Crunchy! I'm sure you'll be good with anything you get and what other people recommend most on Yelp.

Speaking of recommendations, get the Brussels sprouts! The guy at the counter couldn't recommend them to us because he hates vegetables in general but he's missing out and you don't need to make that mistake!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Get the Lobster BLT Roll- that is all. DELICIOUS!!!!!!!! There is fresh bacon sprinkled across as well as a chipotle mayo sauce on top- SO GOOD!!!!! Never had a lobster roll so good in my life.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Poutine tots with pork belly was very good, although could have been served a bit hotter. Slight complaint there because we enjoyed that dish overall. The hot dog with chili and cheese sauce was okay.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Nothing says America like burgers and dogs. Not even Apple pie. They are such a quintessential staple of our food and culture. So I say congratulations to Blue Rooster for applying the gastropub treatment to the formerly humble hot dog.

On our first visit earlier this week I tried one of their specialty dogs created by guest chef Ricky from the Portland Hunt and Alpine Club. This rich and satisfying dog was topped with a succulent lamb chili,salsa verde and a delightful pile of cheese curd. Yumalicious! Accompanying my fine dog was a side of the most golden home made tator tots Portland has ever seen. I particularly loved the big visible flakes of freshly ground pepper that added a touch of heat. Not a fan of hot dogs (really?), they also offer a wide array of truly special sandwiches and even have a salad on the menu( Are you sure you don't want to try one of the hot dogs? They are so good).

Continuing with the good stuff.  Despite arriving with the lunch crowd service was still fast and friendly, and parking was plentiful mid-week.
I look forward to stopping in again soon.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: I can say this place has one thing going for it, the lack of customers provides quick service. Other than that I failed to satisfy my appetite with anything on the menu. I rather eat at a junk yard finding left over meals under sofa seats (if you know what I mean).

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Had both the Pineapple Express dog and the Slawsky and Hitch dog. Also had the Thai Tater Tots. Everything was great. Having a few local beers on tap is nice too. If you like hot dogs, you have to stop at the Blue Rooster.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
I would say this place serves its purpose.  I simply wish I had photographed the drunk girl swallowing her sandwich with her face. BUT in her defense,  there have been countless times where I have drunkenly begged my designated driver ...

Me: "Please, can we stop at Dunkin Donuts for tots!?"
DD: "No."
Me:  "Please can we stop! ? I'll buy you tots too!"
DD: "No."
Me: "I'll buy everyone in the car tots!"
DD: "We're going home. Stop saying tots."

...and Blue Rooster has tots. 

Considering where this is located, it's a good place to get a snack or soak up alcohol.  I didn't see many healthy options, but I wasn't expecting that anyway. My friend informed me in the beginning of the night that she wanted poutine. While I am not against poutine, I'm just not into cheese curds. Plus, no human being ever raised their self esteem by eating a bowl of fried potatoes covered in cheese and gravy. And did I mention there was also pork AND bacon on the tots we ordered? Let's be real, adding bacon to any meal is like adding a lap dance to your mouth.  

My friend's boyfriend got a hot dog of some sort.  To be frank (badum-chhhhhh), I'm guessing it was good because he literally ate it in 60 seconds. They have some unique toppings, and that seems kinda cool.You could have an all American lap dance of ketchup and mustard....or an oriental lap dance (think fried egg and kimchee). 

I'd be unlikely to come back on my own, but likely to tag along and have bites of my friends' food.  'Cause who doesn't love to share with me?

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
We were pleasantly surprised by this unique restaurant with even more unique dishes. 

Love tater tots?  You have never had these tater tots!  There is a huge variety of flavours and they come in small and large.   We shared a large with jalapeño peppers and salsa and they were awesome. 

If unique hot dogs are your thing that's just another reason to love this place.  There are several signature dogs on the menu that are uber unique.

It's not easy to find but it is also not far from the touristy hotel area which means if you're staying close to Franklin Street you can easily walk.

A really unique little place.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Drove into Portland last year and this place looked great. I was visiting from Minnesota that takes their tater tots seriously and they could learn a trick or two from Blue Rooster. I got a Mexican-style hot dog (that I now can't find on their menu) and a side of plain tots. The tots were crisp and hot with a seasoning on them that was a bit spicy but great. The hot dog was really good with lots of fresh toppings and flavour. It was a fun stop in downtown during our road trip.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Tots. Do I need to say more? Tots, tots, tots. What keeps me coming back here? Crispy potato goodness covered in whatever you like or buck naked. Tot-tine with cheese curds and gravy is my new best friend (sorry real friends!). The gravy is perfect and the cheese curds are the real deal. I recommend inhaling it like I do or the tots can get a little soggy from the gravy. The three little pigs is also another of my favorites. It's the Tot-tine topped with bacon, sausage and pork belly. Heart attack city? You bet. Guilty pleasure? 100%. If you are a tot purist, you can get them plain and just enjoy the crispy goodness. Have I said enough about the tots? Oh probably. 

To keep the goodness going, try a sandwich or a hot dog. You can get a hot dog wrapped in bacon! Yes! What an amazing idea. The toppings are varied and different from your average hot dog vendor. You can go messy or simple, it doesn't matter because they are all good. The sandwiches are unique and you'll look at the board and wonder "hmm...I wonder how those flavors will go together." Be adventurous. You won't be disappointed. I recently  have the chicken PBLT which is chicken thigh, confit pork belly, lettuce, pickled green tomatoes and chipotle mayo. It was wonderful. I'm pretty sure it was on a ciabatta roll and there was just the right amount of mayo. 

I'm looking forward to going back and trying one of the vegetarian options. The falafel sandwich has arugula pesto and a watermelon, radish and fennel slaw on it. That sounds very intriguing.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This place is awesome. The flavors compliment themselves perfectly on everything. I got the "Charlie Noble". It's a well portioned sandwich with Turkey, sprout slaw, horseradish sauce, and provolone. Thick cut turkey not that deli sliced non sense. Very flavorful. The sandwich selection is off the charts.
They also have a huge selection of tots. I got buffalo tots with carrots, celery, buffalo sauce and blue cheese. Delish.
Never had a hot dog there but God I can't wait to have one. Easy 4 out of 5.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
I had been stalking Blue Rooster Food Co. for some time now. I'm always on the hunt for local eats open late so I can proudly tell outta statahs who whine that "there's nothing open" what's what. I would definitely send them to Blue Rooster should they be craving a delicious snack post-bars closing! For that matter, I'd send them there if they needed a little lunch fix during their Old Port excursion! It's a very small, but clean and inviting space that's ideally located and offers prime people watching. The staff is also VERY friendly and the menu is creative, interesting, reasonably rice, and delicious... if you're not a vegetarian that is.

We came for lunch on a Monday afternoon and ordered the chickpea sandwich, potato salad, and fried Brussels sprouts (three of the five things we, as herbivores, could eat there). There was some confusion between me and the man taking my order though, and instead of getting The Farmer Ted (the hummus, goat cheese, and veg sandwich) we got the chickpea salad instead. Not the end of the world, but the miscommunication was frustrating when we didn't get what we thought we had ordered.

The potato salad was good, but underseasoned. It was very nice, don't get me wrong, it just wasn't flavorful or memorable.

The chickpea salad was a blend of Mediterranean flavors - whole chickpeas, red peppers, olives, fennel, thyme - that worked really well together. It was good, but (if you're someone who cooks frequently) it wasn't worth the price tag when you could make something similar at home.

And then, there were the fried Brussels sprouts. Listen, if you're coming to Blue Rooster Food Co. for the first time and you don't order the Brussels sprouts, well then, SHAME ON YOU. These sprouts, covered in a sweet chili sauce and topped with sesame seeds and queso fresco, are alone worth coming for. They are definitely the stand-out item here, and are a unique food item in the city that Blue Rooster alone is making. They are a textural and flavor wonderland, though I wish there'd be more queso fresco on them (this is totally a personal thing though - everything, in my opinion, could have more cheese on it!).

Would I come back here? Maybe. But, because of it's lackluster veg-options (and I totally understand that I'm not their target audience; as a matter of fact, I appreciate the offerings they DO have... I'm still gonna get the The Farmer Ted someday) I'd probably be better suited elsewhere, especially considering I've eaten just about everything I can eat off their menu already!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This place is awful. No sign in the front. Ordered a hot dog with mustard and relish . It came with ketchup and onions. Oh that's what you wanted. They made another dog. One bite into it, YECH! It was raw. Disgusting. With that , walked out never to return. What a disgusting establishment , with wise guys assisting at the counter.
If you like cold dogs prepared wrong, this is the place for you.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This place is fantastic. My boyfriend and I went for breakfast and split 2 small orders of tots, a small kimchi, a small chickpea salad and small fried Brussels sprouts (the ones with queso fresco and sweet chili sauce) The tots were perfect- got one order with a fried egg on top and order of buffalo tots. The egg was PERFECTION. The Brussels sprouts were the best I've ever had- anywhere. The kimchi was spicy and delicious and the chickpea salad was light and fresh. We took home most of the kimchi and chickpea salad and left feeling full but not gross. 

I absolutely wish there was one of these in Los Angeles. Everything was awesome. Keep up the good work and holy crap, don't change a thing.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Got the early bird tater tots to go. Very good flavor as well as very crispy - we're still crispy when I got back to my hotel. They have a good variety of hot dogs and tater tots as well as other items on the menu. Would definitely come back again

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Super yummy tater tots! So crispy and delish. And I'm a hot dog fan so this place was an easy choice. I had the plain jane dressed up a bit, others in my group had the wagon wheel and slawsky and hutch. Small place with just a few tables but we went earlish.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Great food and unusual menu.  I ate till I felt like I was ready to explode and am so happy.  Service was nothing special but food made up for it.  Ceaser Brussel sprouts and fancy tatie tots were the best.  Po boy was so so.  Would definitely recommend this home in the wall

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Family and I had dogs from their cart on the main drag along Portland's wharf - so delicious! I'm usually a mustard-only purist but had mine plain (I was juggling two toddlers and a dog, simplicity is key) and in just their grill-marked bun these grilled dogs were fabulous au naturel. I was expecting uninspired tourist fare and was truly surprised by the quality of the food.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Alright, I've been here three times and it's about time I wrote a review.

And the verdict is?

GUILTY.

Guilty of OMG gooey goodness. It's dogs are fine specimens, but I come here for the tot-tine for a taste of those hot totty tater tots smothered in cardiac arrest inducing cheese curds. 

And as if that wasn't enough, their famous twist on poutine gets a new plot twist with the epic introduction of the three little pigs, i.e. Bacon, Pork Belly, and Sausage. Mmmm.

I highly recommend this place for after a night in the old port. It'll help soak up all that alcohol. Lol.a

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This place make me wish I had a a magical portal to Portland. Craving a sandwich but want something unique with an elevated flavor profile? Jump through the portal and get some top notch food at Blue Rooster Food Co. Unfortunately life is boring and cruel, so I often find myself fighting a tear as I eat a microwaved hot dog...I exaggerate...

The place is small with some stools by the window. It's purely a takeout place, but a takeout place for foodies.The food was prepared in good time. The main draws are their innovative selection of tater tots and sandwiches. They also have different hot dog dishes and salads.The menu is written on chalkboard which means the creative team of Blue Rooster will devise new eats to tantalize your taste buds. 

When my husband and I ate here for lunch we had the Lobster Roll (with creole remoulade, cherry peppers, and scallions) and the Pastrami Cuban Rueben (with house smoked brisket, braised pork, pickle, mustard on marble rye). The portions were just right for each person, the food was flavorful and was high in quality. Lunch came to about $19. 

Next time I'm in Portland I would get takeout from here and take it to my b&b room or eat outsideif the weather permits.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Super Yummy! Friendly staff and easy access and my picky child had no complaints! 
Tot-tine is a must try, tater tots with fresh cheese curds and house made chicken gravy, first time for me but so good!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
I saw this place mentioned in an article recently on things to do/places to visit in Maine. The menu online looked great so we decided to give it a try. We tried the Farmer Tess and the Sweet Caroline. Both were delicious! I am usually not a fan of pulled pork (Sweet Caroline). However, this pulled pork was great! I don't know what they use for sauce, but it is quite good. The ingredients in the Farmer Tess were fresh. I will definitely return. I'm looking forward to the lobster BLT. 

Additionally, we went early in the afternoon and found a small line ahead of us, but we were able to grab a table. It is small inside, but if you can't find a seat you can always get your food to go and find a place somewhere outside to enjoy the area views.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Good tot-tines man. Like ridiculously good. The three little pigs? Great pork, especially the pork belly (so tender, mmm with extra mmm). Cheese curds were legit and the gravy was refreshingly flavorful without being too heavy or salty.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: A true find down Dana Street! Hot dogs like you've never had them, and the Brussels sprouts and tater tots are amazing!  on tap too!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
We had the lobster roll with the Brussels sprouts (with sweet chili and queso fresco). The lobster roll was a 3, but the Brussels sprouts were a 5...excellent. 

This was the first of 3 restaurants in Portland whose seating consisted of stools/benches and a counter and by the time we left Portland we were sick of balancing on stools while we ate.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This is my favorite weekend location for either a quick lunch or a late night snack.  This restaurant is more of a "fast food" style place but with a friendlier and less processed (healthy is debatable) flare.  It is counter service with a few benches, but these probably would sit a total of maybe 12 adults.  I prefer to take my food to go and either walk around or hang out on the Prom in nice weather.  

I absolutely love the tater tots.  While I have had them and love them plain, one of the best things to split between friends is one of their more doctored concoctions.  Currently, my friends and I have the early riser option as our favorite.  

I have had multiple sandwiches and a few hot dog options here as well.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  The combinations are sometimes unusual, however, every time I have tried something new I have loved it.  There really have not ever been any misses for me (thus the five star rating).  

The restaurant does change up its menu every once in a while, so don't expect to always get the same thing.  It is a little hidden, so many of my friends had not heard of it before.  Anytime I bring someone here, I always hear from them that they come back again and again and they love it!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
This spot is tucked away from the busy port street. I was on the search for my first lobster roll. The food came out in about 10 minutes. My tots were hot and the bun was warm. I was expecting a heavy buttery lobster roll but in turn received a refreshing twist on the sandwich. The slaw mixture over pewees the taste of the lobster. Think it was to many layers  of  flavor for the rather tiny lobster  roll. They also have tater tots in  many different forms. The house ketchup taste  is  for a select group of palettes. Not a fan but to each  is  on. I also  tried the tot-tine, which is just like poutine(gravy cheese curds on fries) my friend had most  of this and said  it was decadent and savory. Ate it so fast I almost didn't get  to try it. 

Overall a nice spot for a variety of sandwiches. Real small dining area and food staff. When busy expect a long wait. Well in enjoy!!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Everything was excellent! We went as a group of nine. Even though the restaurant is very small we were able to find enough seating. The menu options are creative and fun, there is something for everyone. We had the fried Brussels sprouts (AMAZING!!!), beefsquatch sandwich, buffalo tots, and harissa flockhart as a salad. Everything we had was absolutely delicious, but the Brussels sprouts were by far our favorite side dish! Great for kids too!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: This place is definitely worth a five star! The lobster bacon sandwich although not too cheap, came in a big portion. There were huge chunks of lobster which consisted mainly of claws and legs, the most tender parts of the lobster. We also had a three little pigs tator tots and they were quite delicious and flavorful. The bacon, sausage, and cheese really enhanced the flavor of the tots. Since we couldn't finish all our food we took it to go and they still tasted quite flavorful after a few hours and some microwave time.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Was not impressed by the menu size, but I was very impressed by my barley salad, paired with several chopped veggies and an amazing pesto sauce to top it off. I used this pint of deliciousness as my lunch and it held me over until dinner! I'll most certainly be back for a sandwich, if not this tasty surprise!

There was a short line at noon, but I was in and out in less than five minutes and under five bucks.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Got the Tokyo drift... disappointed.. not recommended.. the bun and the hotdog is like stop and shop

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
The food is so good it almost makes me forget about their $9 minimum on credit card charges. Almost.

A $9 minimum when their average sandwich is under $9, including tax, just rubs me the wrong way. Are they doing this so that I'm nudged to add some tots and a drink to my order to bring it over $9, or are they just really worried about the percentage that the credit card companies are skimming off of their transactions? Either way, it irks me something fierce, and upon doing some light research, it may actually be illegal. Honestly, I'd prefer if they were cash-only. At least that's fair.

All that aside, their food is outstanding. I've had a sandwich, a bacon-wrapped hot dog, and tater tots from them, and they've all be absolutely wonderful.

I got my tots and dog to go, and they asked me if I wanted ketchup and/or hot sauce, and put them in little plastic containers for me in my to-go bag. They even marked the hot sauce with a "HS" in sharpie so I didn't mix it up with the ketchup. Upon opening my tots container, I noticed they had put a little wooden prong with which to poke my tots. A really lovely touch. Great attention to detail.

And so, I love Blue Rooster, but I'm also mad at them. "Change your ways!" I scream at them while shaking my fist, but in the other fist I tightly grasp one of their bacon-wrapped hot dogs. Did I mention their bacon-wrapped hot dogs yet? So good.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Don't get me wrong, the food is dank (can you ever mess up tater tots?) but the workers are absolutely terrible. I've gone here a dozen times and each time the service is a nightmare but the most recent experience takes the cake. Me and my friends were having some drinks at Amigos and saw a Blue Rooster worker there drinking heavily.  So we were extra surprised that he was working the cashier when we stopped in. Whatever. It didn't deter us from ordering food there. HOWEVER, upon finishing our food, my friend got up to throw away his trash and someone accidentally bumped into him and he dropped his fork and cardboard box. Not a big deal, right? WRONG. My friend quickly picked up the dropped trash and the (drunk?) cashier shouted at him saying "Hey! Pull that shit again and you'll be black listed from here!" Our entire group (and most patrons) just went silent and stared confusedly at the cashier. My friend who innocently dropped his fork was absolutely humiliated and embarrassed and we left quickly. This is not the first time we've seen this worker say/do some shady stuff. ALL IN ALL: The food is tasty but be prepared to potentially get accosted by drunk workers with bad attitudes.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Good and different. Food is prompt and fresh. They have a VERY LIMITED selection of beer. Not cheap, but not outrageous either. Music is good. Late night hours Thurs-Sat

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Simple menu with good flavors. it's a small place. I'd recommend ordering food to go. if you like tots then you should come here but you can get better hot dogs somewhere else.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Summary: great for late night foods, open late for post-bar munchies, AWESOME tater tots. I didn't like my other foods but I will be willing to try something else. 

Pros: Open later, great tater tots. 

Cons: Parking, small dining area. 

I went on a Sunday afternoon with the girlfriend after a day of roaming the city and we luckily found a parking spot right in front of the place, but there are limited spots around the area so just be mindful when going here. It's probably better off as a place to go to after you've done some exploring around the city. It's a small space to get your food and have a quick bite or a quick, casual lunch. 

We went in and it was empty so it was perfect to explore everything about the place. The menu had sandwiches hot dogs and our fav: tater tots. We opted for the three little pigs tater tots, small brussels sprouts (per recommendation of Yelpers) and the Seoul Dog. 

Tater tots: need I say more? Tots are delicious by themselves and the combo with cheese, and bacon makes it even more delicious. Left me wanting more. 

Brussels Sprouts: I've never liked brussels sprouts but wanted to give them a try since Yelpers raved about them. I still don't like brussels sprouts. They were grilled and had some sauce and cheese on them but I couldn't get over the brussels taste. 

Seoul Hot Dog: I've had better dogs themselves. It wasn't anything spectacular. The kim-chi on it was more vinegar-y than I usually like it. I probably don't try it again, but I will be willing to try another dog. 

This will be my new spot for post-bar munchies with tater tots!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Amazing place for late night snacks or dinner. Unique sandwiches and many different choices. I would definitely go back here.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
So very unique menu! I really loved that it was a mixture of favorites from a few different ethnic foods and with their own yummy twist on them. The guys were nice and the food was to us in good time. The portions were very decent. The only thing is that I would say that as yummy and unique as it is, it is really just a bit overpriced for what it is and the experience. I would actually say that for what it is, it should be $$. 

It is really good food though and definitely worth a visit, either while you're in town or on the regular. The set-up and vibe reminded me a little of Dos Amigos I must say.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
The hot dogs here were not too impressive. I had the pineapple express and my friend had a das boot. We were both unimpressed with our hot dogs.

The pineapple express has Pickled mango salsa, cilantro jalapeno pineapple mustard. The jalepeño is the only thing that had a strong flavor. There was not a hint of pineapple or mustard. The was a small hint of mango. As for the bacon, it lacked any flavor and crunch to it.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: I literally made this name so I can write a review. Worst food I've had in a long time. Asked to put the coleslaw on the side and it came on the sand which. They couldn't find a knife and the server who cut my sandwich took it from me, picked it up with his bare hands and put his hands all over it after touching money and whatnot. $23 for an overpriced horrible pulled pork sand which, horrible service, and for not listening to the customers requests. I'll never be back and neither should you.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text: Deep frying does wonders. The tater tots are creative, hit the spot, and are reasonably priced--commendable!

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Viva La Late Night Food!

If you are looking for some delicious late night food in Portland, The Blue Rooster is the place.  I went here two nights while visiting Portland.  I ordered the lobster roll (Bahn Mi style) and the Brussel sprouts.  The Bahn Mi style was a great idea for the lobster roll.  The pickled veggies were really fresh and complimented the lobster.  The Brussel sprouts were beyond awesome for a side.  They are flash fried and then covered in a light vinegar-based hot sauce topped with queso fresco = beyond awesome.  

The Blue Rooster also offers several hot dog varieties which all looked delicious.  It's a relief to see late night food done right.  Late night eateries beware...The Blue Rooster is preaching the gospel of awesome.

name: blue-rooster-food-company
review_text:
Have you been here? No? Okay, go right now. GOD I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!! I miss this place! I am so so happy I finished out my trip back to Portland with this place being my last meal! THANK YOU late night!!

This place has so much to offer for everyone. I am a vegetarian and yes, there are lots of hot dogs and meat here, but there are so many options for me, which I LOVE. Came here around 1:30 on a Saturday with my pals, and was probably the only sober one in here, which I also love. Love watching drunk people so much, especially in the Old Port. The place was packed, as it always is after the bars let out, and I came in not hungry at all and then all of a sudden I was the hungriest person in the restaurant. I love going out to eat with my vegetarian friends too, makes sharing so easy! We had the sweet chili brussel sprouts, the tahini fried cauliflower, and the buffalo tots. I am literally starving right now typing this and I just ate dinner. I was beyond obsessed with every single bite I took. The portions are big, the prices are super fair, and damn do they just do a stellar job. Is it healthy? No, not really, BUT you are getting your veggies in! While we are all eating, not talking, laughing, etc., we tried to decide what our favorite was. I went back and forth, back and forth. I was really just in love with all of them. I think when it comes down to it though, those buffalo tots really are the bomb. I mean, first off, who doesn't like tater tots? Second, add buffalo sauce, blue cheese, celery, and carrots. COME ON. That is a HUGE win. I was licking the box by the end of it. Oh, I see how that sounds. But then, wow, the fried cauliflower. Yup. Amazing. Scallions, tahini, paprika, okay. I am OBSESSED with tahini, so this was a no brainer to get. And fried cauliflower? One of my favorite things. Did I mention brussel sprouts are also one of my favorite things? Well, I have a lot of favorite things. We didn't know what to do because we wanted both but ultimately decided on the sweet chili- good choice, great choice, excellent choice.
