Besides, it's not the kind of place you want to run in and out of. It's a great environment to sit at the bar (we were lucky enough to be sat at the bar), talk to your fellow diners and just enjoy the atmosphere. Taste the several beers on tap, find a couple faves and take them home in Crowlers. 

The beer is great, the food is good, and everyone who helped us were all friendly and fun.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: If Dylan is working and you're in the mood for cocktails- he can create great drinks based upon your preferences! The beer is great, too!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Stopped off at Liquid Riot after our dinner at J's Oyster for a night cap. My friend Jason had told me about this resto-bar-brewery and said that it was an absolute must-visit when in town. 

Liquid Riot Bottling Co makes EVERYTHING in house. Every single one of their beers (they have it canned, bottled and on tap) and sprits are made in house. Their distillery is located on the premise in plain view for their patrons to admire as you walk through their doors. 
http://bit.ly/2AMmq1b

My friends all ordered several different beers and looked very satified with each and every one of them. 
Sorry, I couldn't tell you what they ordered because I was too busy staring at my bartender in awe as he skillfully crafted my cocktail and shaped my ice sphere in this cool copper ice ball maker.

HAUTE FASHIONED No.2 ($13):
Liquid Riot House Whiskey Blend (using Maine-grown rye), bitters and sugar or simple syrup. I asked him to make it with less sugar than what they're used to because I dont like my Old Fashioned very sweet.

Best.Old.Fashioned.Ever! 
http://bit.ly/2SKUaTK

Real smooth with a rich mouthfeel, perfection. We should've went here first before J's because their food menu looked really appetizing. I'll definitely come back. 

Hours: Mon-Thurs & Sun 12pm - 11pm, Fri-Sat 12pm - 1am
Parking: Not sure if they have on one premise bc we took a Lyft.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Contrary to what you may think after reading my reviews of distilleries/whiskey bars, we do not drink our way through Portland when we visit but this city does have some of the finest places to eat and drink!  We've been to   Liquid Riot a few times but never to eat (the menu was limited).  This time we decided to have lunch there on Black Friday and were glad we did.  My husband started with a beer The Killing and I had the house hot toddy (see pic below) which changes daily!  

We shared the Pork Belly Bites app (so good!!!) He had the Coconut Fried Chicken sandwich and I had the North Spore Mushroom Toast (messy but delicious).  Of course we purchased some bourbon to take home with us. 

Liquid Riot produces beer and spirits.  Try their Fernet Michaud for something different!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Good variety of beers and liquor. The beer I tried was very good and so was the cocktail my girlfriend had. The food was good, not amazing but definitely good, especially for a brewery/distillery.

We had some fries and an order of their pork belly appetizer. The fries were good, almost on the burnt side, but I kinda like them like that. The pork belly was tasty but I think the sauce, while good, was a bit overpowering and the pork kinda fell to the background.

I had to drop one star though because while our server was friendly, she was just very slow. We would have stayed for more drinks had she come by more often to see if we wanted anything. Instead we ended up going elsewhere after our first round.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: The best experiences I've had at Liquid Riot are when I sit at the bar. You do need to wait for the hostess to seat you regardless of where you want to sit. It's the best way to ensure solid customer service. The bar was unfortunately full when I last visited and we were sat at a table. The service was slow, the food was good, the beer is okay. We shared a pork belly appetizer and I had the gose on draft. The gose was good but doesn't stand out as better than others available in the area. The cocktails are really where it's at with Liquid Riot. All of the cocktails I've had in the past have been very delicious and are made with spirits made by Liquid Riot. I'd go back for snacks and cocktails and try sit at the bar.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Ok, the bad first.  Reservation was set - 45 min wait - OK no prob-we go get some beer nearby-I leave my phone #.  We get a call about 45 mins later telling us to be there in 10 mins if we want our table.  Everyone pounds beers, as it turns out, unnecessarily...we get there and they tell us it's another 15 minutes because they thought the party was leaving.  That's bullshit.  

I really liked the service otherwise.  In fact it was near perfection from there-but I also HATE the logs they make you sit on.  Wtf is it with Portland and sitting on hard wood everywhere?  Seriously, cushions were invented for a reason-it's because wood is hard.

As for the food-we all liked what we had, but I LOVED the burger.  Prob the best I've had.  It's there sauce, the bun and def. the burger itself.  I have to subtract a star for that poor execution of the hostest...don't tell me to rush make me basically waste my drink because you're anticipating something happening.  Other than, don't change that burger-it's perfect!!!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Stopped in here for a drink before dinner and it was great! This place makes a TON of their own beer and hard alcohol, their menu is expansive and there is something for everyone no matter what your taste. The location is also awesome, you can basically walk to any major area in downtown Portland, weather permitting :)!

I'd definitely recommend stopping by for a drink here if you're touring downtown.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Super fun! Their pinball machine is old and clunky and you'll go through quarters too quickly. The shuffleboard table is where it's at! They also have a nice sitting area with a fireplace good for groups. Get a beer or a whiskey and you can't go wrong with some friends. Excited for the summer to be on their deck overlooking the water.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I always love liquid riot. It's rare for a brewery/brewpub to have awesome beer *and* food, but they really nail it. And great cocktails to boot. They have that spherical ice cube maker too, which is fun to watch. 

The space is huge. Great for groups and lots of games. The service can be a little spotty but that's to be expected on busy nights.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Love popping into Liquid Riot as they always have great beers to try.  This time, I tried one of the whiskeys and, for not being a whiskey drinker, had the best one I've ever tried: smooth and delicious.  Now I'm a fan.   Bring back the Mocha Milk Stout!  Sooooo good! Food and nosh, excellent, as always.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Came here this past weekend to try the restaurant week menu and were pleasantly surprised. The food was well cooked and the beer selection was great.  

My only suggestion/complaint for this place would be to repair the seats.  The booth bench along the back wall has seen better days and is in need of repair.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
If I was rating apathy, this place would get 5 stars... buuuut ...

The food is okay.  The chicken sandwich was okay, but the fish tacos were pretty flavorless.  The corn tortillas had more flavor than the fish, sauce, or any other ingredients....  But that's okay, as this is a beer and cocktail place.  Those were okay too.  What was absolutely horrible was the service.  The place was not busy, and it was fully staffed.  We were here well over an hour, and our sever visited the table a total of 2 times. Drinks sat at the bar waiting to be delivered for 10 minutes.  Everyone just seemed to not give a crap.... whatever.  Maybe it's an off day.  Maybe the place just sucks... I won't bother to try it again.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
This place gets PACKED which causes long wait times and your server to forget about you.

It's like Sebago - more of a restaurant, but with a nice outside patio on the water. 

Check it out of you're in the old port.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I don't want to be TOOO hard on Liquid Riot, as I've only been once, but I did not enjoy myself while there. It has no free customer parking so we paid $20 to park 2 vehicles in the lot behind the brewery. We waited to be seated though there were many empty tables. Our party of 4 was told we couldn't sit on the patio because it was full, but I could see space from where our table was sat. I told myself perhaps the waitress assigned to patio couldn't handle another table. 

We were seated near the "merchandise" section which I would have liked to explore as we collect beer glasses, but it was under lock and key in a cage that you have to ask to be let into and presumably a member of waitstaff stands in there with you? The fact that t-shirts needed to be caged up made me feel like they didn't trust their clientele. Perhaps they don't? Shouldn't? I don't live around here, you tell me.  Anyway, asking to look felt like a lot of claustrophobic pressure, especially if I changed my mind so I skipped it. 

We came to Portland for beer, food, and music, not shirts and glasses, so we all ordered a flight containing different beers as well as their award winning fernet and a salted orange soda. Everything left something to be desired, and most of the darker beers had strong tobacco notes and little complexity. The fernet was closer to chamomile mouthwash than an herbal refresher, but bitters aren't generally my style to begin with. The salted orange soda was good, but could have used at least a teaspoon more syrup as it was more dark yellow brackish soda water than an adult version of pop. 

I wasn't getting any phone service inside the restaurant to plan the rest of our evening so I asked the waitress if I could have the wifi password (there are 3 networks, one of which read "Liquid Riot Guest," so I assumed I was okay to ask.) "Nope, no wifi here." she replied. No problem, but she seemed more annoyed I dared to ask then apologetic. The busboys made frequent rounds clearing flights nearly as soon as they were finished, and the waitress came back often to see if we were going to order more than a flight each. We read the menu over a few times and each could pick a thing that sounded good but we noticed we had seen little food coming out of the kitchen aside from chips and dip and hadn't been blown away by the beer or service thus far so we decided to go to Eventide Oyster Co. instead, where I proceeded to eat one of the single best meals of my life.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
We always stop here on our way up to and back from our camp in Maine... once when there was a wait here we tried somewhere else which was such a bad idea.

The drinks are incredible, the beer is incredible, the food is ALWAYS so good... in a word: incredible.

One of my favorite places to eat & drink.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I love some of everything Liquid Riot is doing.

Atmosphere/Seating
I like the dark wood that the interior is almost entirely comprised of. In a really bizarre way (what I imagine, that is) it feels like being in the hull of a pirate ship. There's bar seating, high tops, coveted comfy couches, and let's not forget the pretty amazing deck overlooking an intimate part of Portland's working waterfront. 

Customer Service
Every single time I've been here I've had rad customer service. Laid back servers who are still quick to get you your order or right a wrong without hovering or disappearing altogether once you're settled in. On the opposite hand, I haven't felt the same warmth from whomever staffs their tasting tables at events throughout the city - bummer.

Drinks
Like beer? Try their flight of four. Like cocktails? Ask the staff what they love (they're actually those kind of real people that will tell you straight what they actually like, what they don't like, and what's unexpectedly popular).  

Food
I mean, essentially it's elevated pub food. But they do it so darn well. Can I just say how charming it is that the pretzel is shaped into an infinity symbol? That *has* to be a shout-out to the previous name of this place. The pretzel is one of the best in the cities, FYI (I know, I've now eaten pretzels at EVERY place in town that serves them). Also, the fries are reeeeeeal good (get ALL the sauces: the gochujang aioli, the Liquid Riot beer cheese, and the spicy hop mustard). I believe the poutine (fries, local cheese curds, Blue Note porter mushroom gravy, squash puree, and arugula) is vegetarian; I haven't had it yet, but it's been on my radar for ages.

When I think about going out, this has become one of the first few places that now immediately come to mind. Always reliable, and despite it's pretty touristy location, it seems to draw a pretty localcentric crowd!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Ok, Liquid Riot you get 5 stars!  Love love love this place!  I volunteer for a rescue and a bunch of us went in last night for a Volunteer Night and they reserved the whole back of the room for us!  The servers were top notch as was all the food.  I'd easily hang out here once a week if my waist line could handle it.  Thank you LR & all the amazing servers, I'll be back!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I can't go any lower than 3 stars because Liquid Riot has a special place in my heart, but I sure have a hard time finding much I like to eat here. 

The atmosphere is top notch. It feels spacious, warm, with a huge bar and couches towards the back. The staff here is nice and easy to talk to... well, if it's not a busy day. When it's really busy it can turn into a bit of a shitshow. I'm sure with such a large capacity staffing appropriately can be a guessing game. 

They usually have 8-10 of their beers on draft in a variety of styles, some neat cocktail ideas, and their own spirits in .5oz and 2 oz options. 

Really the only food I could endorse here would be the pretzel and the french fries, and those two things are really, really good. I'm not sure the burger is worth $14 without fries, but it's decent. I don't like mushrooms, but I could see the mushroom toast being popular. My suggestion is to come in on a not too crazy evening, have some beers and fries or a pretzel and I don't know how you couldn't leave happy.

Unfortunately, the menu beyond that has rarely impressed and this last time was a real bummer. We had the house salad, falafel, and the wings with memphis dry rub. The salad was fine but the wings were somehow seasoned with that dry rub and also totally bland. I don't know if they just needed some salt or what, but they were some of the most flavorless chicken wings I can recall eating. I honestly don't even know what the falafel was. I've also posted a photo so you can make up your own mind. You can maybe see in the back what the outside looked like, it wasn't remotely crispy or crunchy like falafel usually is. Instead it was almost like a vegan meatball or something. The inside seemed like raw dough and not very chickpea-y. We didn't finish either and ended up going home and cooking. If it had just been a hair in there and it would have been easier to send back, but we didn't because I'm thinking... is it just a matter of taste? Am I an asshole for sending these things back because it's just my palette and others actually like this?? I don't know, open another tab, Google falafel and see if they look remotely similar.  Stranger still is that it's a very small menu so you would hope they had the few things they cook on lockdown. I can tell you if you're looking for traditional falafel, please go to EVO or Baharat and skip it here. The pretzels and beer, by all means.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Great beer
Good food
Fast service
Inside and outside dining 
They also make spirits 
Kid friendly 
Clean
Didn't taste the spirits to early, ok not really to early, just the beer is damm good

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Got the beer flight : early morning stout, special ale, zombie bunny and the funky poo , all good. Took a big can of funky poo away with me.
Foodwise, we had the fish taco and the fried dough. The latter was unexpectedly amazing with chocolate bourbon sauce.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We visited Liquid Riot for lunch on a warm summer Saturday.  We were seated on the porch looking out over the piers.  Service was prompt and very friendly.  The appetizers and food were terrific.  The fish was fresh and tender with a crispy coating.  The burger was large and cooked perfectly.  I had their flight of beers.  Overall, it was the perfect afternoon.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Most importantly, the beer was insanely good. That being said, our service was horrendous. We had a nut allergy in the group and we were we not assured that this allergy condition would be catered to. To make matters worse, the appetizer plate we ordered, which we were unsure would contain nuts or not (after asking) was never explained to us. After calling for the manager to confirm, we still never received an apology from our waitress or any staff member. My friend did not eat.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
The definition of average.

I'd say the beer was slightly above in that the Head Stash IPA was quite good, but none of the others in the flight were noteworthy.

The size of the pretzel is deceiving in other pictures you'll see on here (small and rather bland).

If you're looking for a beer and an app, there are plenty of other places worth going in Portland

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Stopped in here with my mom and sister for lunch. We all got a drink off the menu and I ordered the lobster roll. My mom got the caprese salad. Food was decent and the drinks were delicious! We ate outside on the patio and it was a beautiful day out! We had a good time here.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
My first experience with liquid riot.
Amazing!!! I had the all is illusion double IPA. Holy?:!@#$ this is a tasty treat to the senses and one of the finer beers i have had in a long time.

But this review is more about the service and friendly staff that work in this tasty mad house of brews.
If you get a chance ask for Erin she is truly a gem of goodness  and very knowledgable to all of the drinks that are served she was so kind and friendly, the perfect choice for a perfect place. 
Trust me. Go to liquid riot drink and be merry but if you want to skip being happy then dont have Erin be your bartender.
Whatever you do just go and be merry!!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Awesome drinks and the food is amazing. The pretzel with beer cheese is a must- super soft. Beers are good and rarely do you find a spot with beer and distilled liquors.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Delicious food and great atmosphere. I had the falafel and it was by far the best falafel I've had in my life...it was so fresh and fried to perfection. My boyfriend and I went around 6pm and it was a little crowded but we found a seat at the bar and the wait staff was very friendly. My boyfriend ordered the pretzel and the coconut chicken sandwich and both were great. First restaurant we went to in Portland and it was a great start. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Nice for drinks, I had a painkiller cocktail, nice and sweet like I like it and some apps.  Ask to sit outside if possible, nice view.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: One of my favorite places to sit outside on the deck and have a beer. The food is good, nothing great though.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: They brew their own beers and spirits. Located right off commercial street. They have a pool table, tabletop shuffleboard, outside patio and a large bar. You can see them actually working to brew the beer which is pretty neat.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Just OK

I recently visited Liquid Riot, based on the beer and food menus I read online, but was overall disappointed with my experience. Based on our drinks, the liquor was better than the beer options. For example, I love IPAs, but I thought most of the beers were a bit bland and weak.  We shared a few apps, but ended up leaving before dinner because we were underwhelmed with the food. In addition, it definitely felt like a bar crowd, rather than a brew pub, which is fine if that's what you're looking for. I'd probably be likely to go back on industry night for a hot dog and beer, but wouldn't recommend coming here for dinner with so many other great options for food in Portland.

Thanks

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
If you love beer Liquid Riot Bottling Co is a must on the bucket list. The guy working was very knowledgeable about the brewing process and local brew houses. He told us the wood stools, counter tops, etc. you see came from one tree! Cool little fact that knocked me off my rocker. The atmosphere and design is something you don't find often. 

The outdoor seating is what sold me. You can drink your beer and watch the ships. Wicked cool if you're not from Portland. We loved it so much we sat outside while it was raining. Another worker strolled by with a huge tub of yeast. He said a local farmer was picking it up to use as feed for this pigs....another cool fact. 

After several beers and more conversation with the beer masters behind the bar we learned more about the brew house. Someone told us Hoof Hearted Brewery (beer equal to crack back in Ohio) loves Maine so much they distribute their beer around Portland. You simply can't find this beer in Ohio. We almost fell off our stools. My point is...talk to the guys who work here if you love beer. Everyone is so knowledgeable and very friendly. 

Mad love all the way from Ohio! We'll be back. Go Indians!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I am a huuuuuuuge fan. 

I was back home in Maine for vacation, and on a rainy windy day in May some tasty vittles and superior suds were exactly what we needed.

Nestled into (I have no recollection of what this building used to be!) a spot on Commercial Street right on the waterfront, Liquid Riot has a fairly large interior with plenty of seating. Windows open up to the brewing & distilling facilities on one side, and the waterfront on the other.

The beers were tremendous, and we took home (to Colorado) bottles of bourbon & whiskey to enjoy, and they've been fantastic. Service was a bit slow, but it didn't really negatively impact anything as the food was really excellent. 

I brought home booze, and daydreams of beer. 

It's so good, I can't wait to go home to Maine again to stop by!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Maine restaurant week review:

I've been here before prior to MRW and loved the atmosphere. Music is always on point- on all 3 of my visits 80s and 90s hip hop and R&B was playing. They've got a pool table, shuffleboard table, and a seasonal deck out back. 

MRW menu included:

1st course: 
- Lobster Chorizo Bisque OR 
- Soft Pretzel

2nd course:
- House Salad-baby kale OR
- Chinese Takeout Wings (spicy!)

3rd course:
- Coconut Fried Chicken Sandwich OR
- Riot Burger 

I was able to try out all of the items and was impressed with the food especially for $25 for 3 courses. I would order them all again, but the Coconut fried chicken was my favorite.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Maine Trip #2

While on vacation in Maine, my best friend took me to Liquid Riot Bottling Company (LRBC) in Portland. Actually, she gave me a list of places to choose from, and LRBC was one of them. She said their food was great, but the service last time wasn't the best. I decided to give it a shot anyway since I wanted some good beer. 

When we arrived, the hostess asked if we wanted a table or to sit at the bar. My friend said we wanted a table. So, she brought us to a small table... in the corner, right by the bar. That was fine expect nobody came. Not one person came to take our drink orders or ask how we're doing. Nothing. It was like we were invisible. I started to think maybe my friend was right about their poor service. 

And then! Our hero came along: the bartender! He ended up taking care of us the whole night (perhaps that was the hostess's plan the whole time) and he made me completely forget about the fact that we were ignored by the rest of the staff. He was charismatic and made us feel welcome. LRBC--your bartender totally saved the day! Well, that and your most amazing food.

Everything I tried there that day was on point. You can see all of our dishes attached to this review. But I'm only going to mention my three favorites:

1) Ichigo Cream (strawberry cream ale)

I normally order dark beer like stout and porter, which I did that night. But when I tasted a sip of my friend's Ichigo Cream, I had to have my own pint! Something about that beer made me sing. 5*

2) Maine Hot Chicken   

Again, this was my friend's dish and I couldn't stop stealing bites from her pate. You wouldn't think maple syrup dipped in black pepper sour cream, but it was outstanding. I love that the chef took a simple item like popcorn chicken and then used some creativity to bring it to a whole 'nother level. 5*

3) Fried Dough with Mocha Stout Dipping Sauce

Do I really need to say anything? Exactly. 5*

At the end of the day, my friend and I had a wonderful time at LRBC and the food was some of my favorites from the trip. Even though our experience didn't start off too well, it ended up being magical. Despite their issues with service, I would recommend LRBC because of their food and beer. And I might suggest you sit at the bar.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Fantastic beer selection AND superb food! I can't emphasize enough how excellent both the food & drink are at this place. The waiter was friendly and patient, as we were a group of 4 and a baby. If you are in Portland and enjoy great beer & delicious food, this place is a definite MUST!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Cool space on the water but the beer was just okay and it smelled really funky in there (maybe from the brewing?).

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Portland Maine keeps providing great beers with every place I visit and LR didn't disappoint.   Had 2 of their delicious IPAs!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Great selection of beers, all made in house. We tried quite a few and their cider, all great. The food was pretty good. Tried the poutine and the mushroom toast, just wish there was more cheese in the poutine and less onions. 
The fried dough was the highlight, light and fluffy and the chocolate ganache underneath was awesome. Well come back next time we're in town.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We were just walking on Commercial street and seeing what Portland could offer us and we stumble up this gem. You cannot miss it, it's a big building. We loved the entry with the big buddha. It was extremely spacious and very cool decor. It was chic and you found people of all ages. We saw much older couples and a gentleman on his 20s hanging out with his parents. One of the drinks we ordered was an old fashion and it was made extremely well and precise. They made the sphere of ice right in front of us. Pretty cool and I was able to snap a video. We would love to visit again. We were full from eating at another place, all we smelled was yummy food, so we will def need to go back to visit to try the food.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We visited many restaurants and bars last weekend and Liquid Riot was in my top 3 favorites. I don't drink beer (but my husband does and he was very impressed) and the specialty cocktails were quite special. I had a delectable egg nog served in a teacup. If it was any bigger, it would've been too much. Really loved the attention from the bartenders and the history of the black walnut bar and fixtures. Will be back again soon.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Just ok. 

Sad I went here on our trip to Portland and wasted drinking time. The chips and salsa/black bean/cheese dip had no flavor. Could have pulled it from a can at home. Doesn't seem overly clean.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I was so happy with my experience here!! I had one of the best beers I've ever had - a strawberry cream nitro. It was delicious and creamy. I went late night just for drinks so I didn't get to try the food. The atmosphere was super awesome and they have comfy couches to relax on and hangout. The bar is also really big and there was a lot of people there. I'd go back again next time I'm visiting!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I really, really want to like this place, as it checks a lot of boxes for me on paper: Homemade liquors, small and focused menu, and unique and theoretically creative fare. However, both times I've been (once in the fall, once the spring) I've been strangely disappointed at the lack of flavor and enjoyment I've had from the multiple items I've tried.

It's almost as if a robot went to an upscale gastropub and tried to recreate their menus with limited success. 

The fries were greasy and unoriginal; the drinks too strong and tried too hard; while the wings and hot chicken were interesting they both lacked a sense of uniqueness.

To be clear, the ingredients are high-quality and the recipes fairly ambitious, perhaps I've just been to too many of these similar types of places to be inspired by another one that is so similar.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Very cool place. Lots of good house spirits you can try in .5 oz tasters. Also a good beer selection. Did not order any food. Space is nice and open. They have shuffleboard and pool to keep you entertained.... just ask the bartenders for the stuff to play!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I can't speak to the food, but the beer, atmosphere, and service are great. I was killing time, waiting on family to arrive into town, and ordered a flight of beer which I enjoyed on the back patio overlooking the marina. I tried four very different beers and enjoyed them all - the sour one is truly sour! I would definitely stop in again and would want to give something on their food menu a try.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I really wished I ordered food here because the food looked so tasty. We came in here for beer before hitting up another reservation. This place has amazing atmosphere and a great wait staff that is not only friendly, but quick and helpful. The place was busy but not too loud and has a plethora of seating options for any group. The kitchen is also completely viewable as is the distillery, giving the place a very open and welcoming feeling. I would love to come back!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I didn't spend a lot of time here, so I can't do a full review like I normally would.  I did try some of their beer that they make for local establishments and it was excellent.

The primary purpose for the visit was their ice ball.  They have a special device, essentially a weighted press, that compresses a block of ice into a ball.  The ice was roughly the size of a pool ball.  This is then placed into a glass and used to make a custom house old fashion type cocktail.  Obviously, it is a bit of a show to make the drink and the other patrons thanked me for having ordered it.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Wow! This Place rocks the atmosphere, the service, food and games are The Best! There is a deck out back for your enjoyment on a hot summer day or evening out! 
The food here compliments the drinks nicely! If you are looking for a  great spot to go with friends this is it! Casual but trendy! 
The music selection fits perfectly!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: This place was super cool, the atmosphere was great, we ate lunch on very comfortable leather couches, the detail to the woodwork was exceptional, the food was amazing and the service was excellent!! The strawberry sage kombucha was out of this world, the ichigo cream ale was sweet, smooth and refreshing!!! Highly recommend!!!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Visited this place for the first time and it didn't disappoint! Great service, prices were decent considering that the distill most of their alcohol and beers. It's a great place for large groups. There's a deck that will be great for summer. I had a classic margarita, I opted for the tequila they distill and it was delicious!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Homemade beer, food, and liquor, what more can you ask for?

But seriously. The beers are very unique (must try the blonde stout).  The food I've had is great - the pork belly was smoky, crispy, meaty, and fatty--with a great Asian drizzle. Ahh, the shishito peppers. Not hard to figure out, but executed well here. And a ton!! 26-27 peppers.

Though light in flavor, the spirits have very distinct and great flavors. The agave liquor is very smooth, almost half tequila, half mezcal.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: The Lobster Roll is delicious and there is an impressive drink/beer list. The space is nice and has an industrial feel.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Been here 3 times now and it's been great every time- fun, friendly, and trendy food and drinks! Liquid Riot is always on our list when we visit this city.

Most restaurants and bars in Portland are very busy, but even when this place is busy they have the space to accommodate a large amount of people. We have so much fun here and can't wait to come back.

In the summer they also have outdoor seating on the patio with harbor views, which makes it even better!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Great atmosphere with outdoor seating. Had a beer flight and cider rose; both were great. The riot burger was tasty, the fried coconut chicken was somewhat bland. Pretzel was warm & salted just right. Overall happy with my experience.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
My girlfriend and I came here for drinks the one night we stayed in Portland and it did jot disappoint. Cody served us outside and provided some great beer and house spirits suggestions. The IPAs we tried were all great. The fernet, single malt whiskey, and Blue agave were so tasty! 
We're excited to go back the next time we're visiting Portland.
While we didn't try the food everything that went by us looked delicious.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I love liquid riot! This place has a great atmosphere, friendly service, and tasty food! It has a really nice variety of beers and other drinks on the menu. It's a nice place to come and catch up with friends!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Pleasantly surprised. $2 tacos (Tuesday's) were excellent. Choice of fish or chorizo. I had 4 fish tacos ($8 total..., like that math?) and I'm stuffed. Fish was fried in a very light batter, crunchy slaw on top, cilantro, grilled tortillas, some kind of spicy sauce... For $2 what more can you ask for? 
Also ordered a large fry with chipotle aioli and garlic aioli. They were perfectly cooked, super crunch, really excellent. 
Beautiful view of the docks from the deck, great service and the beers we tried were quite impressive. Nordic Farmhouse was my favorite, nice and smoky, followed by Heart or Glass, which was very sour in a good way. Menu didn't look very creative or interesting but worth going for the $2 tacos and beer.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I will start off this review by saying I had very high hopes for this place. Great selection of beer, fun cocktails, and what seemed like an interesting food menu. Unfortunately, our experience there was so poor that it motivated me to write my first ever Yelp review-- not in an attempt to cease business-- but in hopes the ownership can read this, learn, and grow the business into its potential! 

We brought our party of 10 here on a Saturday night last month. I work in the industry and understand how busy nights can affect the kitchen, staff, etc... I can go into how the servers didn't give us the right beer flights, barely knew the menu, and so on, but none of that really inclines me to write this review- 

We were out with my sister-in-law who at the time was 6 months pregnant. When she ordered her fish tacos, she made a point to tell the waitress that she needed her food cooked extra well done to be safe, and the waitress completely understood. When she received her food, her fish was not only undercooked-- it was RAW! Completely blue and cold and quite frankly not something anyone should receive, especially a pregnant woman. I got the fish tacos too and mine were fine, so how does this happen??

When we notified the waitress, she didn't even seem concerned! What's worse is that I would have expected at least a manager to come to our table, check in, and apologize profusely. We spoke with a manager when this didn't happen and he seriously could not have cared less. I have NEVER in my life experienced service as horrible as I have here. Never thought I'd be that person writing a review to bash a business, but I seriously was in such awe at the whole scenario! Will not be returning.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Not your traditional pub food! The drinks and the food were delicious and had a unique flair to them. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. I would love to go back in the summer to drink on the deck! With all of the bars in Portland, this one is a must to check out!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: This is four stars because it's Portland, but could be five stars anywhere else. Their cocktails and spirits are well-thought and inspired, and some border zany (in a good way).

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Amazing beer selection! Great tripels and a dangerously delicious 12% quad. Such a fun spot with a deck in the back with an ocean view. Great appetizers and a fun atmosphere.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Great ambience, beer and fast service - fish and chips were great and the Blackout is a great beer to follow up with a long walk. 12% and tasty!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Had a nice afternoon here, just visiting Portland for a few days. The Korean bowl was a new item (kimchi broth with seafood) and was really yummy. It rather small and don't come w any bread to soak up those juices! Fish tacos were standard. Real item that stood out was the mushroom toast. Amazing. Had a flight of IPAs and they were really good. Suns out guns out IPA was my fav.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Liquid Riot's existence has been a bit of a roller coaster. The bar has had a deeper identity crisis than Caitlyn Jenner. Lately though they've really gotten it together and have become a top 5 favorite bar of mine in Portland.

The smartest move by Liquid Riot was leveling the space. Without the weird "RiRa-ish" elevated section, the room is now essentially one humongous bar. And it's awesome! This is one of the largest bars in Portland, with plenty of seating at the actual bar, various tables or couches. This is also one of the few Portland restaurants with an outdoor deck on the water (that no one seems to ever think of). If nothing else, come here just for the beautiful seaside deck. It's worth it. 

Liquid Riot is the only bar I've seen where all of the beers and hard alcohol are house made. I prefer the beers here to Gritty's (just awful) and Sebago (ok). The cocktails are creative and several utilize an ice ball machine, which mesmerizes. The food has taken many iterations over the years, and is at its best now, as pub food. The hot chicken ($11) was popcorn chicken coated in what suspiciously resembled Bingas Spicy Redneck sauce. It was delicious and packed solid heat. The pork belly ($12) was typical melt-in-your-mouth perfection. Surprisingly, the veggie dishes are some of the best, with the Brussels sprouts being fantastic. You come to Liquid Riot for the drinks, but the food can hold its own now.

Service has vastly improved lately. With great alcohol made in house, a big attractive space and decent food, this will be a regular hangout all summer.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I came here with nine friends last Saturday evening and had a great time. We played pool (for free) and used the pinball machines. The beer selection was extensive and the servers were very knowledgeable. Something that I really liked was that you could pick any four beers on the menu to be included in the flight for the same price ($12 total). I would definitely return!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Nice ,spacious atmosphere. Great salads and burgers. Lovely staff.
Good lunch location.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: This is a fun, hip place to eat. They play lots of 80's music, but this is not a retro place.   It has more of a rustic feel with wood everywhere. The restaurant is not brightly lit, but you are able to read the menu. The staff are friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu in terms of significant allergies. My friend call it upscale pub food. There are plenty of gluten free options and many dishes can be made without black pepper. They are also aware of nightshade allergies They do not have a diet beverage option, but water is available. This is a distillery, so they has plenty of delicious options. The menu is limited and has unusual offerings such as kimchi with fish and chips, but you are able to get an innocuous burger and salad. The prices are reasonable. I orders the unusual sounding fish and chips. My friends got pork belly with a salad and fish tacos l. Both have crazy allergies so eating in restaurants is a challenge. The fries were hot and crunchy, the fish was perfectly cooked and their homemade beer batter was flavorful. I was leery of the kimchi sauce, but it was amazing. I highly recommend this as a place to have a meal and a place to drink.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Great pub atmosphere, nice IPAs, but the kicker was the food. Innovative local microgreen salads, homemade pretzels, Thai wings, and the best burgers we've ever had in Portland. Expertly mixed old fashioned. Great acoustics wasted on bad rock and metal. Would be outstanding and become known if they switched to good jazz.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
I live locally and stopped in early Friday evening to try a couple of their beers and get something to eat.  My wife and I sat at the bar and after a few minutes, selected a couple of their craft beers.  After ordering the beers, the bartender asked if I wanted to start a tab and I said yes as we were also going to order food.  She said she would need a credit card??  I could not remember the last time I had to give up a credit card before ordering a dinner at a restaurant.  Maybe they thought we were going to dine and dash?

In any event, I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and my wife order a veggie burger.  The presentation and the taste were average at best.  However, the second IPA I tried was very good.

With all the other options for excellent food and craft beer in Portland, I doubt I will be back.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Randomly found this while roaming around Portland. I loved the interior, especially the wooden tables. Our server was super friendly and knew a lot about the product. We tried a milk punch (wow, so refreshing and interesting way it's made - ask if you order one!) and one of the beers. In fact, we liked the beer so much that we got 6 to go after eating. Prices were great. For food, we got the blueberry bbq chicken wings (yum) and the mussels (just okay). Noise level is high but that was expected with the pool table in the middle of the room. Awesome place to relax and enjoy their beer.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Zuur Fleur, Popcorn Chicken and Salt and Vinegar chips were all amazing! Can't wait to go back.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Loved the beers. We had a flight to sample some variety. Pretzel with mustard was real nice. Good horseradish zip. Fish tacos disappointed, they we ok, but we can do better at home. (Kind of plain)

We ended the night with spirits tasting. We were much happier with the beers. Flavors were not subtle. In the Rye whiskey, you get hit with the grassy rye. To me, I really taste corn with the bourbon.  The agave was oddly over oaked. 

I enjoyed the atmosphere of the deck overlooking the harbor, the beers and pretzels. Next time, I'll skip the spirits.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: I visit a lot of local spots, and Liquid Riot is on my short list of best places. The staff are warm and friendly, always remember my name, and are super knowledgeable about their beers and spirits. Their taps rotate, but try Sour Trouble if it's on, and their Fernet is not to be missed. Chef Josh Doria's cold soba noodle salad is over-the-top wonderful. I'm vegetarian, and will be back for another ASAP. They also have a backyard deck over the water in warmer months.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Best lobster roll I'd had in Portland. Great fries too. Well done beers. Overall great experiences. 

Seems to be popular for bachelorette parties. Thats a negative for me.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Cool place for a brewery/distillery. Can't quite tell
If it's commercial, local, corporate.. Seems to be suffering from an identity problem. None the less, the beer was great and there were endless choices. I especially liked the sour as well as the stouts. The food was above average for a place like this. Usually breweries have a few small plate items but Liquid Riot had a full menu. We tried and loved the Cuban sandwich, the chicken skin sliders and the frites. The sliders seemed like the ultimate buzz food. After a few heavy beers try nibbling on those salty, crispy delights.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
God no. They were great when it was infinity now the renovations to the inside make it painfully loud. I couldn't hear a word my husband said tome. We had early dinner and it wasn't even 530 and there are groups of men screaming drunk off their asses. Really makes me want to stay here. The menu is pathetic just another hipster shit restaurant yay 

No options for someone not drinking besides their "cola" I could drink used bath water and it would taste better

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Great experience at Liquid Riot! Great beer choices and eclectic food.  I really enjoyed the Marzen beer I ordered.  We ordered a variety of food tapas style including duck nachos, Belgian frites, Maine chicken and the cheese board.  If given the chance, we would reorder all these choices except the cheese board which needs improvement.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: 2nd time here first was for dinner 2nd for lunch beer and spirit selection is right in line with any note worthy hip water hole. Mixology is up to speed with any trendy cocktail bar. Beer is ok - not earth shattering but entire selection is worth your taste buds IMHO.   Food selection is limited but still diverse enough to meet most tastes and or requirements. They're chasing a James Beard better burger contest with a very unique entry however the relish needs to be tamed down a bit as it occupies to much of the flavor profile. Summer 2017. Good luck liquid Riot!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We got a beer flight and a spirits flight.  Everything was pretty darn good.  Favorites were Spiritus Sancti, Oats M'Goats, Rye whiskey, and Old Port Bourbon.  Whiskey here leans more in the direction of Irish. The rye is the most true rye tasting I've had and the bourbon tastes like pralines.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Walked past Liquid Riot while visiting Portland and thought I'd give it a try.  They have a ton of table seating as well as a good size bar to sit at.  The cool thing about this place is that you can see where the beer is made while enjoying it.  The beer was so crisp and had so much flavor.  If I did not eat lunch right before stopping in, I would have given the food a try.  From seeing what others got around me, it looked really good.  Will definitely stop in again next time I'm in Portland.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Great beer and distilled spirits.  Good selection of bar food, everything we tried was tasty.  The poutine was great, crispy fries and good gravy.  The charcuterie was also fantastic.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Loved the hoppy blonde and the pretzel!!! The killing was different and a great option for a more festive holiday beer.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Went for the beers - 80% of them I loved! I wish the bartenders were a bit more helpful and explained what we were drinking (considering we were the only ones at the bar). Loved that they had some Nitro options.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
You cannot tell from the name, but this place has some serious distilling chops. 

I tried a flight of the following: unaged rum, aged rum, unaged bourbon, and aged bourbon at the bartenders suggestion.  The aged rum (Dow's Demise dark rum) was really good.  I don't generally like rums, but the aging process added some nice complexity to the (hints of vanilla?) that I could see simply having this over ice.  Had to get a bottle to bring home.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
This place can be safely classified as a brew pub.  It has its affected pretensions, but scratch it just ever so lightly, and there's a brew pub.   I make this point because over it's existence, both in its rebranded form as Liquid Riot, and before as something called Infiniti, I've found the food odd, and the attitude superior (as in superior to me).  The prices reflect that attitude more than the food quality, I think.

The restaurant, both in its cavernous interior and the sunlit deck waterside, was not half full when my son and I visited.  We sat not outside on the attractive deck, but just inside at the bar,  out of the sun.  

For a brew pub, the menu did not have a broad selection of accessible food.  Instead, there were some effete vegetable and tofu dishes, some duck-ish things (not actually a sign of inventiveness, but a bow to the local duck-pioneer Duckfat, a smaller, less expensive, and more popular restaurant), and a couple of meat sandwiches. One of which was a cheeseburger.  We ordered that.

When it came, the size was OK for me, I'm not a big eater, but it was almost petite, and bare of condiments.  For a $16 cheeseburger I expected a little showboatin'.  Instead, we each had a modest cheeseburger with a dab of onion.  My son did have ketchup, but it was served in a small paper cup and was there for his fries.  I had no fries so was given no ketchup.

I asked the waitress for ketchup and mustard. She brought one more little cup of ketchup.  I said again that I still needed mustard, and that my son also needed ketchup for his burger. She told me he already had ketchup, but I pointed out that the ketchup he had was not enough for both his fries and his hamburger.  She mumbled something and returned with a single small dish of mustard, and another of ketchup.  We're not talking about handcrafted ketchup and mustard, built with locally-sourced tomatoes and carefully tended mustard seeds from a garden the chef keeps out back.  From the bar you can see into the kitchen, and I saw there that the condiments are spooned out of a massive tub of Heinz ketchup and a similar tub of mustard. 

I grew up in an America where mustard and ketchup were de facto components of a hamburger.  I do understand that hamburger making has become a field with a thousand flowers.  That there are now iconoclastic chefs building exotic hamburgers with wildly original ingredients (I'm looking at you 5-Star Burgers in Kirkwood Missouri), and that many of those hamburgers would be adulterated by adding Heinz ketchup and something like Grey Poupon mustard. 

The hamburger we were served, though, on June 10 at Liquid Riot in Portland Maine, was not one of those hamburgers.  This was like the hamburger Thomas Jefferson had in mind when he asserted, in the Declaration of Independence, that a hamburger should be served with ketchup and mustard (mayonnaise too, but I think he said this just to mollify Lafayette).   Pretty much just a hamburger.  Like you'd find at a Brew Pub.

After we'd finally gotten our condiments, we lathered up the little fellows and ate them.  I've had better, I've had worse. 

I also ordered an iced tea.  I know this is a brew pub, and that craft beer and (maybe?) spirits are their "thing", but it was a warm day, we'd biked a few miles into town, and I wanted tea, not beer.  

The tea came. It was just an iced tea.  I drank it. The waitress asked if I wanted a refill. I said yes. She brought me a refill.  I drank that too.

We move now to a discussion of the bill.

In all, I ordered one cheeseburger and a dab of onion, a small bowl of cole slaw, and an iced tea.  My son had one cheeseburger and a dab of onion, a handful of french fries, and a glass of milk.

The hamburgers were $16 each, the milk was maybe $2.  The mustard was $1, the iced tea was $4, and the iced tea refill was $4. 

In short, I was charged $16 for an average burger, without condiments, and $9 for two modest glasses of iced tea with lots of ice and 2 ounces of mustard.  I've eaten at restaurants up and down the Portland Waterfront, and well beyond.  I've never seen a $16 burger that wasn't pampered in some way.  I've never paid $4 for a run-of-the mill iced tea, then been charged again for a refill, and I've never been charged a dollar for mustard - for a practically naked hamburger.

You may think my complaints are trivial, but I think this nickel and diming speaks to Liquid Riot's general attitude toward customers, an attitude that matches the company's troubled history with its branding, which is cluttered, shambolic, and off-putting. The place doesn't know if it's fancy or simple, cheap or expensive, hipster-snooty or tourist-common. 

I know the answer though: A place with a name like Liquid Riot is a brew pub, and at a brew pub, no one should have to pay $1 for mustard on a $16 burger, or $4 for a refill of a $4 glass of iced tea.  Condiments and tea are not precious bodily fluids to be retained unnaturally.  Let them flow!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We stumbled upon Liquid Riot while exploring Portland and couldn't be happier that we did! We sampled almost every beer in tap that day and we loved almost every one! Service was phenomenal. The space is open, airy and perfect. We ended up doing three sample rounds and ordered some apps.  The food is as exceptional as the drink menu. We were so thrilled with the experience we took home 5 crowlers! Definitely worth a visit.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
AMBIENCE: We sat outdoors and the view was beautiful. Ask for the corner table on the left side. 

SERVICE: The waiter was okay. The food took a while to come. 

BEER: They were okay - a cut above a Corona. However, they did not have the entire selection of beers on tap. This was a bit strange considering this is a "brewery."

FOOD:
House Burger (medium) - The stout bacon jam was AMAZING. Overall, this was by far, more than an above average burger by at least two standard deviations. Although, it does not get the third standard deviation. The side of fries was alright.

Shrimp Tacos - The shrimp were well grilled but they were the size of popcorn shrimp and not enough to fill the soft taco shell sufficiently. The taco shell, which in itself, was not great tasting either.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text:
Went there on a Monday, and every one of my expectations was surpassed. I knew the beer would be amazing from trying Headstash and Ka$h Money before, but the food was on another level.

We shared the pretzel with beer cheese. I had the house burger with fries and hop mustards, and my fiancé had the venison sliders. Absolutely everything tasted fresh and home made down to the sauces. Between the pickled red onions and stout bacon jam, my burger might have been the best thing I've tasted. The venison sliders were equally amazing.

I'd give this place 6 stars if I could.  Chef Nick Krunkkala has elevated this place. The beer is amazing, and they have food to match.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Very friendly service!  Great location and delicious beer.  Spicy fried chicken is well worth it.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Awesome place that makes beer along with "almost" all of their alcohols in house. The cocktail list is great if you're a man with a decent palate and a man's tolerance... and it probably suffices if you're an adventurous woman as well. I've heard the food's great too. Next time I'll expect Shuffleboard to be available!

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: My husband and I stopped by on a friend's recommendation during our 24hr stay in Portland. It's a very comfortable environment with a fun, unique drink menu. We each had beer flights and loved the IPAs. Their house spirits looked intriguing, too, but we didn't get to those. Highly recommend for IPA lovers.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: We came here in 2016, sat on the deck, had great service and good beers & tasty unique apps (fresh mozzarella local tomatoes and also oysters). We came back this year and sat at the bar. We ordered some beers and said we needed a minute to look over the menu for food but we were not attended to again even with our glasses empty for at least 5 minutes. We may try this place again, but maybe not.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: Didn't make it to the food as the hostess was EXTREMELY rude to us when we just tried to take a look at the restaurant to see if it would be appropriate for our children (or more accurately if our kids would upset the ambience).  Happy to have not given them our money.

name: liquid-riot-bottling-co
review_text: This place was well thought-out. The layout and atmosphere are conducive to a good social atmosphere and good time. The beverage menu has just about everything you could want, made in-house, in a quality and thoughtful fashion, besides wine and mead (but they do offer guest wines, though not sure about meads), but even kombucha and...bierschnaps (guaranteed to be better than any schnaps you'll ever have). The food is even crafty and fairly priced. They offer cans, bottles (including spirits), and even crowlers to go. They have a pool table and sand shuffleboard table, and an outdoor deck overlooking the water. The service is approachable and not overbearing. Check this place out, it is one of them that makes Portland Portland.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Food was excellent, but more than that the service was above and beyond. We dined with our two year old son and were greeted with toy cars and a coloring book to keep him entertained throughout the meal.  Upon leaving the manager told him he could pick a car to take with him, which he talked about all the way home. Will definitely dine here again and would recommend to anyone with children.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
The Front Room is tucked inside the bottom floor of an actual house. Blink when driving by and you will miss it. We came in for dinner with a party of six and had no reservation, but were able to be seated right away. 
The vibe inside is casual and cozy. The kitchen is open, so you can see the food being made. The service was here and there, but still friendly and decent. 
Menu wise, The Front Room had a huge variety from meatloaf to seafood. For starters we had brussels with toasted almond and honey goat cheese as well as a arugula and beet salad. Both of these dishes were packed with flavor and large enough portions to split with everyone. The beet salad was my favorite of the two. 

For entrees my group had Casco Bay Scallops, roast 1/2 chicken, short rib and meatloaf. Despite being a larger group, the food came out very quickly. I was surprised by how huge the portions were, so come hungry!
My scallops were perfection and from the bites I tried of everyone else's entree there was nothing disappointing. 
The only downfall of this place was that it is a tiny room and gets very loud inside when you combine everyone talking, and the kitchen sounds. As a bigger group we really couldn't hold down conversation with people down the table and especially with my hard of hearing older family. I would come here again with just one other person, but not with a group due to the noise level.

name: the-front-room
review_text: My photos don't do this place justice, but the food was awesome. We walked in around 9:30 and was seated right away. Ordered two coffees, eggs benny special with spinach and caramelized onions, and the huevos rancheros with eggs over easy. Oh man, it was so good. The huevos were the best. But everything was tasty. If we lived here, I'd come all the time!

name: the-front-room
review_text: First time visiting today.  Service was exceptional, food was quick and amazing. No wait time because it was a rainy Tuesday morning. Coffee was hot and fresh, iced cold water.  The specials sounded amazing but we ordered eggs, bacon, potatoes and a grilled English muffin and huevos rancheros.  The bacon is super thick and flavorful. Great taters!  Wanted peanut butter but they don't have it, so our server recommended their raspberry jam and it was one of the best ever!  The place was super clean and the head chef was working and greeted us and we loved watching him work in the open kitchen. Fantastic and we cannot wait to come back the next time we are in town!

name: the-front-room
review_text:
Looking for a hearty brunch in Portland this weekend, we ended up at The Front Room. For a Saturday around 11 am we were expecting a wait and were right. They said 45 minutes to an hour for a table for two. Lucky for us, bar was first come first serve and we scored two seats within less than ten minutes of waiting. 

This restaurant seems pretty unorganized. They only had one bartender for brunch on a Saturday and no bar backs. This guy was fulfilling every drink ticket, going to their storage (he kept having to go outside) to get more champagne, and serve all the bar patrons. Safe to say, not at the fault of the bartender, we weren't acknowledged for a good ten minutes until after we sat because of how busy he was. We placed our order. Our beers were very warm which was disappointing for an 8 dollar beer but at least it was poured right away. 

Unfortunately, it took over an hour from when we placed our order for it to come to us. We didnt asked where it was but other people around us were having a similar situation and when they'd ask where their food was the bartenders response was "we are busy". Poor planning to not execute quicker knowing you'll be crowded at brunch time. The food itself was great. I really enjoyed my sweet potato hash and biscuits with raspberry jam. My fiancé got a bacon egg and cheese on toast. He liked it but we were shocked that a sandwich that can't take more than 3 minutes to make took over an hour to come out. 

When we were leaving we noticed they had put a sign outside with the specials of the day which sounded great but our bartender never mentioned the specials to us. Definitely a bummer. 

Although the food was good, we probably will not be coming back here because of the lack of service and wait.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
This place is worth the wait. We went on a Saturday morning around 10:30 and had to wait about 15-20 minutes. The restaurant is about a couple blocks from some great water views so you can take a quick walk while you wait.

The food and service was outstanding. I got the Vegetable Hash with biscuits and was surely not disappointed. Food came out quick and the waitress was knowledgeable regarding the menu. They fill up your coffee fairly quick as well! If you're in Portland I would make an effort to go here.

name: the-front-room
review_text: This is probably one of the best places I've ate at in Portland. My husband and I spent the weekend in Portland for my birthday. We went to The Front Room for dinner Saturday night and I had my heart set on creme brûlée, which we found out they were out of. Our meal was so absolutely amazing, that we went back early before our departure and enjoyed brunch topped off with some creme brûlée. All was fantastic including our service.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
Came here with my family for brunch last Saturday before our kayaking reservation. We were told to come here by a local that we met at the farmer's market earlier that morning. 

We were absolutely starving by the time we got there and we were not disappointed! We didn't have a reservation but were seated almost immediately and the service was fast. We had the egg plate (2 eggs any way, home fries, toast, and either sausage or bacon), veggie gnocchi, corned beef hash, mac & cheese, and the sweet potato hash. The best dish was the corned beef hash - it looked like real roast beef that had been torn up, which is something that I have never seen before, and it had tons of flavor. The sweet potato hash was pretty good as well, but the egg wasn't poached properly and the yolk was not runny, which was slightly disappointing. 

Was a great and filling brunch option for a good price. (Also- make sure you ask for jam with your toast! It is amazing). 

*Note: this restaurant only serves brunch / lunch. It closes in the late afternoon every day.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Awesome, unique menu. Delicious food. I'd absolutely go back the next time we're in Portland! They have high chairs, but they do not have a kids menu; however, you can order half-portions if some meals!

name: the-front-room
review_text: Spectacular short rib. We started with the drink of the day, a gin and cucumber and blueberry concoction and the man on the town cocktail. Both were delicious but I found the drink special overly cucumbery. Their house made focaccia is excellent but I'd prefer the olive oil with a little herbs or red pepper flakes. The Tomato soup had a nice freshness to it and the cheese on top added an unctuous flavor. The blt was average with excellent bacon. Their short rib with horseradish potatoes was sublime though. Succulent and soft short rib paired with a unique take on the traditional mashed potatoes. Their negroni for two was fun and came in a lightbulb but I was expecting something a little more than that since the drink in the lightbulb isn't so unusual and the drink was on the sweeter side. Out table had a wobble to it as well but the staff was very accommodating and really tried to fix it. Overall I'll definitely be back.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Went for a weekday brunch.  First of all, the food isn't anything special.  I had French toast and it was not great.  Really? Anyone could make it.  The coffee wasn't too good either.  The worst part was the service.  There's not many servers, the bar tender didn't even acknowledge me (I was at the bar and he was busy stocking shelves) and the busser was slammed.  So really there's no reason to come here.

name: the-front-room
review_text: I would fly to Portland just to eat at the Front Room again. We tried to come here for brunch on Saturday, but it was packed. Instead we came for dinner at 5pm, as soon as they open, and even then were shown to a table and told we need to vacate that by 6:15pm. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable. For an appetizer I convinced my friend we needed to try the short rib gravy poutine, and - whoa - that was absolutely amazing. So flavorful, and the polenta is a nice change from fries. For my entree I chose the scallop dish, and the scallops were the sweetest and most tender I've ever had the pleasure of eating - plus the price was right, too! Overall, one of the best meals I have eaten this year.

name: the-front-room
review_text: One of the best kept secrets in Portland for breakfast! Absolutely outstanding cuisine. I had the steak and eggs, and it completely hit the spot while it was snowing out. This place is family friendly, and adheres to all your breakfast needs.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
Considering making the 10-plus hour drive to Portland--and devoting half of my take-home pay--to eat brunch here every day.

Had the Caprese Benedict, and it was superb.

name: the-front-room
review_text: We were told the wait would be around 45 minutes on a Sunday morning for brunch. Completely understandable so we went for a quick walk and we're back in 25 so we wouldn't miss our call. We came back and waited another 20 and my companion very politely checked to see if we missed the call. The seating host proceeded to yell at my companion that we had been called "several times". We had been willing to wait until my companion told me how she had been treated. We went somewhere else. Not cool, Front Room. Might be time for some employee customer service training.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
We arrived for a late lunch after exploring the East Promenade, and it was still very full, so we had to wait for about 20 minutes for a table. By the time we sat down to eat, the restaurant was probably only about 1/3rd full. And it became apparent that the servers were more interested in closing up shop in a timely manner than actually tending to their patrons. This was just a small hiccup, though. Ours was friendly enough, just inattentive.

The food was thankfully excellent. We ordered the Mac 'n' Cheese and the Croque Madame, and both were delicious. I loved the hot dogs in the Mac 'n' Cheese - made it feel rather homey. 

If you happen to be in East Promenade, then definitely consider making a stop here when you get hungry.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
- the kitchen is open in such a way that is able to be seen from the dinning room, which is cool, but also very noisy.
- the food and drinks are a bit pricey.
- there's not a lot of street parking options.
- it always seems too busy in there and there doesn't seem to be a lot of room for how many customers they always get.
- the food is tasty.
- nice atmosphere.

name: the-front-room
review_text: I love this place as you can see from my last review. But it really irks me that with all the families (currently) 3 in here as I write this. There's no kids options. Makes no sense. I wonder how many awesome families don't come back because the a la carte adds almost up to but cheaper than a full adult menu.

name: the-front-room
review_text: This is actually my favorite restaurant in Portland. It's probably not what most would classify as fine dining but it's never let me down. The food is always good and the service is always friendly. It's one of the few places in Portland that I feel has great value for what you get plus it's a cozy little place.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Have been here a couple times for breakfast and everything has been good so far.  Would recommend if you are looking for a casual place to have breakfast with good food.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Fantastic place for brunch.  What a nice vibe and great food.  Lynette was so nice as our hostess.  She actually cares about your experience here.  Can't wait to come back.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
I've been here for brunch on each of my last 4 visits to Portland, and it's very solid!  We love sitting on the quiet patio out front with our dog.

Biscuits and gravy are rich and delicious, but don't leave me feeling too full. I love that you can order this as a side instead of the whole meal.

They do a great hash, and often have very inventive specials. The gnocchi Benedict (on the everyday menu) is something you won't see too many other places, and it comes loaded with cubes bacon or pancetta. Highly recommend trying it.

Can't endorse with a full 5 stars because of one small hiccup that could have been handled better.  The most recent visit we did have an issue where we both ordered poached eggs, and all 4 egg yolks were completely cooked through.  The server apologized and replaced them with new eggs, but didn't offer to replace the full dish (so it was room temperature by the time the new eggs were ready). To be honest we probably would have said to just bring the new eggs anyways because there was nothing wrong with the rest of the dish and I don't like to waste, but either way I think a 5 Star spot would have at least offered to replace the full dish or comp something small on the bill.  

Also - bring back the red flannel hash!

name: the-front-room
review_text:
Great food. Great service!
Came in on a Monday morning and it was pretty busy. We were served very fast and with a smile.
All the bread is homemade and the focaccia was to die for.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
Oh front room. Pricy as hell but good as hell. 

Best service on the hill, best eggs in town. Open your wallet and open your heart for the only redeemable "Room."
Small and bustling, and worth the wait. Fingers crossed for the outdoor seating option. Enjoy each DEVILISHLY GOOD bite.

name: the-front-room
review_text: examine your check very carefully for food and drinks items you did not order - if you attempt to receive credit after the fact / good luck- promised refunds do not arrive as promised-

name: the-front-room
review_text:
If you enjoy great food, this is a great spot! If you don't enjoy terrible service and ticks being smooshed in front of you - plenty of better places in town.

I've been coming here for almost 5 years and typically always get great food and decent service. My most recent visits have just not been anywhere near what they used to be. The past couple of times have been pretty inconsistent for both food and service, but a recent visit just ended any sort of joy I used to have coming here.

I arrived here on a Saturday morning for brunch with my girlfriend and we were quickly seated by the super nice host next to the hosting booth. It was a little more busy than the rest of the place but still a good spot. When our server came over, that was when we first noticed things weren't the same as past visits. She was very short with us, very rude and didn't even mention the specials until we asked (the special hash they had that day was phenomenal). We ordered our drinks and received everything in good time. 

It all fell apart when we asked for jam - I had asked for jam since we both ordered toast and she promptly left to get it before my girlfriend could finish also asking for jam. When she came back we attempted to ask for refills and ketchup, but the second we asked for ketchup she was already walking away (she did toss it on the table before ignoring another request for jam). Thankfully he host was great and refilled our drinks. 

Right in the middle of our meal we saw a couple come in w their dog and asking to be seated outside. What happened after was just disgusting. She had found a tick on her dog and instead of goi outside decided to crush it right next to our meal. With the host right next to her, we couldn't believe she too didn't say something! 

At that point we both lost appetite and when the server came back, she didn't even ask us for a box. 

She just took our plates and threw everything out! 

Needless to say, we're no longer going to be frequenting this place. It's too bad because we love the other 'Room' locations so having to cross this place off our list is extremely disappointing.

name: the-front-room
review_text: you know all the food is amazing when the special is the first and best eggs benedict you've had in eggsitence (get it). yeah the wait might have been long, but it's worth every minute to hour. we both got the eggs benedict special, which had local tomatoes, goat cheese, and hollandaise on em. that hollandaise sauce is to die for also got bacon on the side which ventured it's way on top. they kill brunch, and ya gotta have it!

name: the-front-room
review_text: Food and breakfast cocktails were delicious. Food took a while to arrive but still deserves five stars due to attentiveness of staff and quality of meal.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
What a wonderful find in Munjoy Hill!  My Husband and I were staying in the area for the weekend and our hosts highly recommend The Front Room and now we see why.  We ate here twice in one day, once for breakfast and then returned for dinner.  For breakfast I had the lamb Eggs Benedict special which was so tasty and my Husband got the corned beef hash, which was one of the best he's ever had!!!

We returned for dinner and had a feast!  We started with the deviled eggs of the day which featured pulled pork and cole slaw, oh so good!  We also had the fried green tomatoes, which were also delicious.

For dinner my Husband got the Lamb Sephardi Pie which was phenomenally delicious!  I highly recommend this dish!!  I had a special- the Olive oil poached halibut with rice, which was also very good.   The fish was perfectly cooked and very flavorful.  

The service was also very good on both occasions.  Friendly, courteous and promp!  Our dinner server was especially friendly, funny and attentive.  We will for sure be back here next time we are in Portland!!

name: the-front-room
review_text:
The food - 
Pros: Awesome hash, nice big chunks of corned beef.
Cons: no black tea, no skim milk, no berries for the oatmeal, most dishes contain garlic.
The atmosphere:
Very tight, too many tables smooshed in, makes it hard on waitstaff and customers.

name: the-front-room
review_text: Great food and service.  1st time, recommended by friend.  Definitely would return and recommend  myself.  Ask for Lynette,  great server....

name: the-front-room
review_text: The dude who owns this restaurant and several others on the peninsula is someone whose ego impacted the quality of his dominion.  I used to love The Front Room when it first opened. However, I went back for dinner this weekend and was so disappointed.   Now the venue has a slick, corporate feel.  The staff are saccharine.  This place has lost its panache; so sad. Our meals were okay, just okay.  No point talking about what we ate except to say that portions were skimpy and frankly unremarkable.  No plans on going back. Why?  Because Portland is a "foodie" town; there are far more extraordinary restaurants to patronize.  I wish restaurateurs could understand the laws of diminishing returns.

name: the-front-room
review_text:
My partner and I drove by on a Saturday and saw the wait didn't appear to be too bad so we stopped in for brunch. We were told a 15 minute wait for a two top. It turned into a 40 minute wait, during which we saw multiple tables arrive after us and be seated before us.

It was clear they were understaffed but the hostess did a fantastic job of trying to keep the plates spinning. Tables were left uncleared for long periods of time as the servers did not clear their tables.

Once seated, however service was great! My croque madame was divine! My partner got that hash special and very much enjoyed it. I was looking forward to that chocolate cheesecake that was on the board but was told they were out.
